text_he: ויך שאול את-עמלק מחוילה בואך שור אשר על-פני מצרים | And Saul smote the Amalekites from Havilah as thou goest to Shur that is in front of Egypt | ויהי מקץ ארבעים שנה ויאמר אבשלום אל-המלך אלכה נא ואשלם את-נדרי אשר-נדרתי ליהוה בחברון | And it came to pass at the end of forty years that Absalom said unto the king 'I pray thee let me go and pay my vow which I have vowed unto the LORD in Hebron
text_en: And Saul smote the Amalekites, from Havilah as thou goest to Shur, that is in front of Egypt.
text_pisuk: וַיַּךְ שָׁאוּל, אֶת-עֲמָלֵק, מֵחֲוִילָה בּוֹאֲךָ שׁוּר, אֲשֶׁר עַל-פְּנֵי מִצְרָיִם. | And Saul smote the Amalekites, from Havilah as thou goest to Shur, that is in front of Egypt. | וַיְהִי, מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה; וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֵלְכָה נָּא וַאֲשַׁלֵּם אֶת-נִדְרִי אֲשֶׁר-נָדַרְתִּי לַיהוָה, בְּחֶבְרוֹן. | And it came to pass at the end of forty years, that Absalom said unto the king: 'I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the LORD, in Hebron.

text_he: ויתפש את-אג מלך-עמלק חי ואת-כל-העם החרים לפי-חרב | And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword | כי-נדר נדר עבדך בשבתי בגשור בארם לאמר אם-ישיב (ישוב) ישיבני יהוה ירושלם ועבדתי את-יהוה | For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Aram saying If the LORD shall indeed bring me back to Jerusalem then I will serve the LORD'
text_en: And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.
text_pisuk: וַיִּתְפֹּשׂ אֶת-אֲגַג מֶלֶךְ-עֲמָלֵק, חָי; וְאֶת-כָּל-הָעָם, הֶחֱרִים לְפִי-חָרֶב. | And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword. | כִּי-נֵדֶר נָדַר עַבְדְּךָ, בְּשִׁבְתִּי בִגְשׁוּר בַּאֲרָם לֵאמֹר: אִם-ישיב (יָשׁוֹב) יְשִׁיבֵנִי יְהוָה יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וְעָבַדְתִּי אֶת-יְהוָה. | For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Aram, saying: If the LORD shall indeed bring me back to Jerusalem, then I will serve the LORD.'

text_he: ויחמל שאול והעם על-אג ועל-מיטב הצאן והבקר והמשנים ועל-הכרים ועל-כל-הטוב ולא אבו החרימם וכל-המלאכה נמבזה ונמס אתה החרימו | But Saul and the people spared Agag and the best of the sheep and of the oxen even the young of the second birth and the lambs and all that was good and would not utterly destroy them but every thing that was of no account and feeble that they destroyed utterly | ויאמר-לו המלך לך בשלום ויקם וילך חברונה | And the king said unto him 'Go in peace' So he arose and went to Hebron
text_en: But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, even the young of the second birth, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them; but every thing that was of no account and feeble, that they destroyed utterly.
text_pisuk: וַיַּחְמֹל שָׁאוּל וְהָעָם עַל-אֲגָג, וְעַל-מֵיטַב הַצֹּאן וְהַבָּקָר וְהַמִּשְׁנִים וְעַל-הַכָּרִים וְעַל-כָּל-הַטּוֹב, וְלֹא אָבוּ, הַחֲרִימָם; וְכָל-הַמְּלָאכָה נְמִבְזָה וְנָמֵס, אֹתָהּ הֶחֱרִימוּ. | But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, even the young of the second birth, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them; but every thing that was of no account and feeble, that they destroyed utterly. | וַיֹּאמֶר-לוֹ הַמֶּלֶךְ, לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם; וַיָּקָם, וַיֵּלֶךְ חֶבְרוֹנָה. | And the king said unto him: 'Go in peace.' So he arose, and went to Hebron.

text_he: ויהי דבר-יהוה אל-שמואל לאמר | Then came the word of the LORD unto Samuel saying | וישלח אבשלום מרגלים בכל-שבטי ישראל לאמר כשמעכם את-קול השפר ואמרתם מלך אבשלום בחברון | But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel saying 'As soon as ye hear the sound of the horn then ye shall say Absalom is king in Hebron'
text_en: Then came the word of the LORD unto Samuel, saying:
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, דְּבַר-יְהוָה, אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל, לֵאמֹר. | Then came the word of the LORD unto Samuel, saying: | וַיִּשְׁלַח אַבְשָׁלוֹם מְרַגְּלִים, בְּכָל-שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר: כְּשָׁמְעֲכֶם, אֶת-קוֹל הַשֹּׁפָר, וַאֲמַרְתֶּם, מָלַךְ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּחֶבְרוֹן. | But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying: 'As soon as ye hear the sound of the horn, then ye shall say: Absalom is king in Hebron.'

text_he: נחמתי כי-המלכתי את-שאול למלך--כי-שב מאחרי ואת-דברי לא הקים ויחר לשמואל ויזעק אל-יהוה כל-הלילה | 'It repenteth Me that I have set up Saul to be king for he is turned back from following Me and hath not performed My commandments' And it grieved Samuel and he cried unto the LORD all night | ואת-אבשלום הלכו מאתים איש מירושלם קראים והלכים לתמם ולא ידעו כל-דבר | And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem that were invited and went in their simplicity and they knew not any thing
text_en: 'It repenteth Me that I have set up Saul to be king; for he is turned back from following Me, and hath not performed My commandments.' And it grieved Samuel; and he cried unto the LORD all night.
text_pisuk: נִחַמְתִּי, כִּי-הִמְלַכְתִּי אֶת-שָׁאוּל לְמֶלֶךְ--כִּי-שָׁב מֵאַחֲרַי, וְאֶת-דְּבָרַי לֹא הֵקִים; וַיִּחַר, לִשְׁמוּאֵל, וַיִּזְעַק אֶל-יְהוָה, כָּל-הַלָּיְלָה. | 'It repenteth Me that I have set up Saul to be king; for he is turned back from following Me, and hath not performed My commandments.' And it grieved Samuel; and he cried unto the LORD all night. | וְאֶת-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, הָלְכוּ מָאתַיִם אִישׁ מִירוּשָׁלִַם, קְרֻאִים, וְהֹלְכִים לְתֻמָּם; וְלֹא יָדְעוּ, כָּל-דָּבָר. | And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, that were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they knew not any thing.

text_he: וישכם שמואל לקראת שאול בקר ויגד לשמואל לאמר בא-שאול הכרמלה והנה מציב לו יד ויסב ויעבר וירד הגלגל | And Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning and it was told Samuel saying 'Saul came to Carmel and behold he is setting him up a monument and is gone about and passed on and gone down to Gilgal' | וישלח אבשלום את-אחיתפל הגילני יועץ דוד מעירו מגלה בזבחו את-הזבחים ויהי הקשר אמץ והעם הולך ורב את-אבשלום | And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite David's counsellor from his city even from Giloh while he offered the sacrifices And the conspiracy was strong for the people increased continually with Absalom
text_en: And Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying: 'Saul came to Carmel, and, behold, he is setting him up a monument, and is gone about, and passed on, and gone down to Gilgal.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּשְׁכֵּם שְׁמוּאֵל לִקְרַאת שָׁאוּל, בַּבֹּקֶר; וַיֻּגַּד לִשְׁמוּאֵל לֵאמֹר, בָּא-שָׁאוּל הַכַּרְמֶלָה וְהִנֵּה מַצִּיב לוֹ יָד, וַיִּסֹּב וַיַּעֲבֹר, וַיֵּרֶד הַגִּלְגָּל. | And Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying: 'Saul came to Carmel, and, behold, he is setting him up a monument, and is gone about, and passed on, and gone down to Gilgal.' | וַיִּשְׁלַח אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת-אֲחִיתֹפֶל הַגִּילֹנִי יוֹעֵץ דָּוִד, מֵעִירוֹ מִגִּלֹה, בְּזָבְחוֹ, אֶת-הַזְּבָחִים; וַיְהִי הַקֶּשֶׁר אַמִּץ, וְהָעָם הוֹלֵךְ וָרָב אֶת-אַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counsellor, from his city, even from Giloh, while he offered the sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.

text_he: ויבא שמואל אל-שאול ויאמר לו שאול ברוך אתה ליהוה--הקימתי את-דבר יהוה | And Samuel came to Saul and Saul said unto him 'Blessed be thou of the LORD I have performed the commandment of the LORD' | ויבא המגיד אל-דוד לאמר היה לב-איש ישראל אחרי אבשלום | And there came a messenger to David saying 'The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom'
text_en: And Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said unto him: 'Blessed be thou of the LORD; I have performed the commandment of the LORD.'
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא שְׁמוּאֵל, אֶל-שָׁאוּל; וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ שָׁאוּל, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה לַיהוָה--הֲקִימֹתִי, אֶת-דְּבַר יְהוָה. | And Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said unto him: 'Blessed be thou of the LORD; I have performed the commandment of the LORD.' | וַיָּבֹא, הַמַּגִּיד, אֶל-דָּוִד, לֵאמֹר: הָיָה לֶב-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אַחֲרֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And there came a messenger to David, saying: 'The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.'

text_he: ויאמר שמואל ומה קול-הצאן הזה באזני וקול הבקר אשר אנכי שמע | And Samuel said 'What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears and the lowing of the oxen which I hear' | ויאמר דוד לכל-עבדיו אשר-אתו בירושלם קומו ונברחה--כי לא-תהיה-לנו פליטה מפני אבשלם מהרו לכת פן-ימהר והשגנו והדיח עלינו את-הרעה והכה העיר לפי-חרב | And David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem 'Arise and let us flee for else none of us shall escape from Absalom make speed to depart lest he overtake us quickly and bring down evil upon us and smite the city with the edge of the sword'
text_en: And Samuel said: 'What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל, וּמֶה קוֹל-הַצֹּאן הַזֶּה בְּאָזְנָי, וְקוֹל הַבָּקָר, אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי שֹׁמֵעַ. | And Samuel said: 'What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?' | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לְכָל-עֲבָדָיו אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ בִירוּשָׁלִַם, קוּמוּ וְנִבְרָחָה--כִּי לֹא-תִהְיֶה-לָּנוּ פְלֵיטָה, מִפְּנֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם; מַהֲרוּ לָלֶכֶת, פֶּן-יְמַהֵר וְהִשִּׂגָנוּ וְהִדִּיחַ עָלֵינוּ אֶת-הָרָעָה, וְהִכָּה הָעִיר, לְפִי-חָרֶב. | And David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem: 'Arise, and let us flee; for else none of us shall escape from Absalom; make speed to depart, lest he overtake us quickly, and bring down evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.'

text_he: ויאמר שאול מעמלקי הביאום אשר חמל העם על-מיטב הצאן והבקר למען זבח ליהוה אלהיך ואת-היותר החרמנו | And Saul said 'They have brought them from the Amalekites for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God and the rest we have utterly destroyed' | ויאמרו עבדי-המלך אל-המלך כל אשר-יבחר אדני המלך הנה עבדיך | And the king's servants said unto the king 'Behold thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord the king shall choose'
text_en: And Saul said: 'They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל מֵעֲמָלֵקִי הֱבִיאוּם, אֲשֶׁר חָמַל הָעָם עַל-מֵיטַב הַצֹּאן וְהַבָּקָר, לְמַעַן זְבֹחַ, לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ; וְאֶת-הַיּוֹתֵר, הֶחֱרַמְנוּ. | And Saul said: 'They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.' | וַיֹּאמְרוּ עַבְדֵי-הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ: כְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יִבְחַר אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ, הִנֵּה עֲבָדֶיךָ. | And the king's servants said unto the king: 'Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord the king shall choose.'

text_he: ויאמר שמואל אל-שאול הרף ואגידה לך את אשר דבר יהוה אלי הלילה ויאמרו (ויאמר) לו דבר | Then Samuel said unto Saul 'Stay and I will tell thee what the LORD hath said to me this night' And he said unto him 'Say on'{S} | ויצא המלך וכל-ביתו ברגליו ויעזב המלך את עשר נשים פלגשים--לשמר הבית | And the king went forth and all his household after him And the king left ten women that were concubines to keep the house
text_en: Then Samuel said unto Saul: 'Stay, and I will tell thee what the LORD hath said to me this night.' And he said unto him: 'Say on.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֶל-שָׁאוּל, הֶרֶף וְאַגִּידָה לְּךָ, אֵת אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה אֵלַי הַלָּיְלָה; ויאמרו (וַיֹּאמֶר) לוֹ, דַּבֵּר. | Then Samuel said unto Saul: 'Stay, and I will tell thee what the LORD hath said to me this night.' And he said unto him: 'Say on.'{S} | וַיֵּצֵא הַמֶּלֶךְ וְכָל-בֵּיתוֹ, בְּרַגְלָיו; וַיַּעֲזֹב הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֵת עֶשֶׂר נָשִׁים פִּלַגְשִׁים--לִשְׁמֹר הַבָּיִת. | And the king went forth, and all his household after him. And the king left ten women, that were concubines, to keep the house.

text_he: ויאמר שמואל--הלוא אם-קטן אתה בעיניך ראש שבטי ישראל אתה וימשחך יהוה למלך על-ישראל | And Samuel said 'Though thou be little in thine own sight art thou not head of the tribes of Israel And the LORD anointed thee king over Israel | ויצא המלך וכל-העם ברגליו ויעמדו בית המרחק | And the king went forth and all the people after him and they tarried in Beth-merhak
text_en: And Samuel said: 'Though thou be little in thine own sight, art thou not head of the tribes of Israel? And the LORD anointed thee king over Israel;
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל--הֲלוֹא אִם-קָטֹן אַתָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, רֹאשׁ שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָתָּה; וַיִּמְשָׁחֲךָ יְהוָה לְמֶלֶךְ, עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And Samuel said: 'Though thou be little in thine own sight, art thou not head of the tribes of Israel? And the LORD anointed thee king over Israel; | וַיֵּצֵא הַמֶּלֶךְ וְכָל-הָעָם, בְּרַגְלָיו; וַיַּעַמְדוּ, בֵּית הַמֶּרְחָק. | And the king went forth, and all the people after him; and they tarried in Beth-merhak.

text_he: וישלחך יהוה בדרך ויאמר לך והחרמתה את-החטאים את-עמלק ונלחמת בו עד כלותם אתם | and the LORD sent thee on a journey and said Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites and fight against them until they be consumed | וכל-עבדיו עברים על-ידו וכל-הכרתי וכל-הפלתי וכל-הגתים ש-מאות איש אשר-באו ברגלו מגת עברים על-פני המלך | And all his servants passed on beside him and all the Cherethites and all the Pelethites and all the Gittites six hundred men that came after him from Gath passed on before the king{S}
text_en: and the LORD sent thee on a journey, and said: Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלָחֲךָ יְהוָה, בְּדָרֶךְ; וַיֹּאמֶר, לֵךְ וְהַחֲרַמְתָּה אֶת-הַחַטָּאִים אֶת-עֲמָלֵק, וְנִלְחַמְתָּ בוֹ, עַד כַּלּוֹתָם אֹתָם. | and the LORD sent thee on a journey, and said: Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed. | וְכָל-עֲבָדָיו עֹבְרִים עַל-יָדוֹ, וְכָל-הַכְּרֵתִי וְכָל-הַפְּלֵתִי; וְכָל-הַגִּתִּים שֵׁשׁ-מֵאוֹת אִישׁ, אֲשֶׁר-בָּאוּ בְרַגְלוֹ מִגַּת, עֹבְרִים, עַל-פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And all his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men that came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.{S}

text_he: ולמה לא-שמעת בקול יהוה ותעט אל-השל ותעש הרע בעיני יהוה | Wherefore then didst thou not hearken to the voice of the LORD but didst fly upon the spoil and didst that which was evil in the sight of the LORD'{S} | ויאמר המלך אל-אתי הגתי למה תלך גם-אתה אתנו שוב ושב עם-המלך כי-נכרי אתה וגם-גלה אתה למקומך | Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite 'Wherefore goest thou also with us return and abide with the king for thou art a foreigner and also an exile from thine own place
text_en: Wherefore then didst thou not hearken to the voice of the LORD, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst that which was evil in the sight of the LORD?'{S}
text_pisuk: וְלָמָּה לֹא-שָׁמַעְתָּ, בְּקוֹל יְהוָה; וַתַּעַט, אֶל-הַשָּׁלָל, וַתַּעַשׂ הָרַע, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה. | Wherefore then didst thou not hearken to the voice of the LORD, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst that which was evil in the sight of the LORD?'{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-אִתַּי הַגִּתִּי, לָמָּה תֵלֵךְ גַּם-אַתָּה אִתָּנוּ; שׁוּב וְשֵׁב עִם-הַמֶּלֶךְ כִּי-נָכְרִי אַתָּה, וְגַם-גֹּלֶה אַתָּה לִמְקוֹמֶךָ. | Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite: 'Wherefore goest thou also with us? return, and abide with the king; for thou art a foreigner, and also an exile from thine own place.

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-שמואל אשר שמעתי בקול יהוה ואלך בדרך אשר-שלחני יהוה ואביא את-אג מלך עמלק ואת-עמלק החרמתי | And Saul said unto Samuel 'Yea I have hearkened to the voice of the LORD and have gone the way which the LORD sent me and have brought Agag the king of Amalek and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites | תמול בואך והיום אנועך (אניעך) עמנו לכת ואני הולך על אשר-אני הולך שוב והשב את-אחיך עמך חסד ואמת | Whereas thou camest but yesterday should I this day make thee go up and down with us seeing I go whither I may return thou and take back thy brethren with thee in kindness and truth'
text_en: And Saul said unto Samuel: 'Yea, I have hearkened to the voice of the LORD, and have gone the way which the LORD sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּקוֹל יְהוָה, וָאֵלֵךְ, בַּדֶּרֶךְ אֲשֶׁר-שְׁלָחַנִי יְהוָה; וָאָבִיא, אֶת-אֲגַג מֶלֶךְ עֲמָלֵק, וְאֶת-עֲמָלֵק, הֶחֱרַמְתִּי. | And Saul said unto Samuel: 'Yea, I have hearkened to the voice of the LORD, and have gone the way which the LORD sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites. | תְּמוֹל בּוֹאֶךָ, וְהַיּוֹם אנועך (אֲנִיעֲךָ) עִמָּנוּ לָלֶכֶת, וַאֲנִי הוֹלֵךְ, עַל אֲשֶׁר-אֲנִי הוֹלֵךְ; שׁוּב וְהָשֵׁב אֶת-אַחֶיךָ עִמָּךְ, חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת. | Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us, seeing I go whither I may? return thou, and take back thy brethren with thee in kindness and truth.'

text_he: ויקח העם מהשל צאן ובקר ראשית החרם לזבח ליהוה אלהיך בגלגל | But the people took of the spoil sheep and oxen the chief of the devoted things to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God in Gilgal'{S} | ויען אתי את-המלך ויאמר חי-יהוה וחי אדני המלך כי אם ( ) במקום אשר יהיה-שם אדני המלך אם-למות אם-לחים כי-שם יהיה עבדך | And Ittai answered the king and said 'As the LORD liveth and as my lord the king liveth surely in what place my lord the king shall be whether for death or for life even there also will thy servant be'
text_en: But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the devoted things, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God in Gilgal.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח הָעָם מֵהַשָּׁלָל צֹאן וּבָקָר, רֵאשִׁית הַחֵרֶם, לִזְבֹּחַ לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ, בַּגִּלְגָּל. | But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the devoted things, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God in Gilgal.'{S} | וַיַּעַן אִתַּי אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיֹּאמַר: חַי-יְהוָה, וְחֵי אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ, כִּי אם ( ) בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה-שָּׁם אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ אִם-לְמָוֶת אִם-לְחַיִּים, כִּי-שָׁם יִהְיֶה עַבְדֶּךָ. | And Ittai answered the king, and said: 'As the LORD liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether for death or for life, even there also will thy servant be.'

text_he: ויאמר שמואל החפץ ליהוה בעלות וזבחים כשמע בקול יהוה הנה שמע מזבח טוב להקשיב מחלב אילים | And Samuel said 'Hath the LORD as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices as in hearkening to the voice of the LORD Behold to obey is better than sacrifice and to hearken than the fat of rams | ויאמר דוד אל-אתי לך ועבר ויעבר אתי הגתי וכל-אנשיו וכל-הטף אשר אתו | And David said to Ittai 'Go and pass over' And Ittai the Gittite passed over and all his men and all the little ones that were with him
text_en: And Samuel said: 'Hath the LORD as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices, as in hearkening to the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל, הַחֵפֶץ לַיהוָה בְּעֹלוֹת וּזְבָחִים, כִּשְׁמֹעַ, בְּקוֹל יְהוָה: הִנֵּה שְׁמֹעַ מִזֶּבַח טוֹב, לְהַקְשִׁיב מֵחֵלֶב אֵילִים. | And Samuel said: 'Hath the LORD as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices, as in hearkening to the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams. | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אִתַּי, לֵךְ וַעֲבֹר; וַיַּעֲבֹר אִתַּי הַגִּתִּי, וְכָל-אֲנָשָׁיו, וְכָל-הַטַּף, אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ. | And David said to Ittai: 'Go and pass over.' And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones that were with him.

text_he: כי חטאת-קסם מרי ואון ותרפים הפצר יען מאסת את-דבר יהוה וימאסך מלך | For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD He hath also rejected thee from being king'{S} | וכל-הארץ בוכים קול גדול וכל-העם עברים והמלך עבר בנחל קדרון וכל-העם עברים על-פני-דרך את-המדבר | And all the country wept with a loud voice as all the people passed over and as the king passed over the brook Kidron all the people passed over toward the way of the wilderness
text_en: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, He hath also rejected thee from being king.'{S}
text_pisuk: כִּי חַטַּאת-קֶסֶם מֶרִי, וְאָוֶן וּתְרָפִים הַפְצַר: יַעַן, מָאַסְתָּ אֶת-דְּבַר יְהוָה, וַיִּמְאָסְךָ, מִמֶּלֶךְ. | For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, He hath also rejected thee from being king.'{S} | וְכָל-הָאָרֶץ, בּוֹכִים קוֹל גָּדוֹל, וְכָל-הָעָם, עֹבְרִים; וְהַמֶּלֶךְ, עֹבֵר בְּנַחַל קִדְרוֹן, וְכָל-הָעָם עֹבְרִים, עַל-פְּנֵי-דֶרֶךְ אֶת-הַמִּדְבָּר. | And all the country wept with a loud voice, as all the people passed over; and as the king passed over the brook Kidron, all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness.

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-שמואל חטאתי כי-עברתי את-פי-יהוה ואת-דבריך כי יראתי את-העם ואשמע בקולם | And Saul said unto Samuel 'I have sinned for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD and thy words because I feared the people and hearkened to their voice | והנה גם-צדוק וכל-הלוים אתו נשאים את-ארון ברית האלהים ויצקו את-ארון האלהים ויעל אביתר--עד-תם כל-העם לעבור מן-העיר | And lo Zadok also came and all the Levites with him bearing the ark of the covenant of God and they set down the ark of God--but Abiathar went up--until all the people had done passing out of the city{S}
text_en: And Saul said unto Samuel: 'I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD, and thy words; because I feared the people, and hearkened to their voice.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל חָטָאתִי, כִּי-עָבַרְתִּי אֶת-פִּי-יְהוָה וְאֶת-דְּבָרֶיךָ: כִּי יָרֵאתִי אֶת-הָעָם, וָאֶשְׁמַע בְּקוֹלָם. | And Saul said unto Samuel: 'I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD, and thy words; because I feared the people, and hearkened to their voice. | וְהִנֵּה גַם-צָדוֹק וְכָל-הַלְוִיִּם אִתּוֹ, נֹשְׂאִים אֶת-אֲרוֹן בְּרִית הָאֱלֹהִים, וַיַּצִּקוּ אֶת-אֲרוֹן הָאֱלֹהִים, וַיַּעַל אֶבְיָתָר--עַד-תֹּם כָּל-הָעָם, לַעֲבוֹר מִן-הָעִיר. | And, lo, Zadok also came, and all the Levites with him, bearing the ark of the covenant of God; and they set down the ark of God--but Abiathar went up--until all the people had done passing out of the city.{S}

text_he: ועתה שא נא את-חטאתי ושוב עמי ואשתחוה ליהוה | Now therefore I pray thee pardon my sin and return with me that I may worship the LORD' | ויאמר המלך לצדוק השב את-ארון האלהים העיר אם-אמצא חן בעיני יהוה--והשבני והראני אתו ואת-נוהו | And the king said unto Zadok 'Carry back the ark of God into the city if I shall find favour in the eyes of the LORD He will bring me back and show me both it and His habitation
text_en: Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD.'
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה, שָׂא נָא אֶת-חַטָּאתִי; וְשׁוּב עִמִּי, וְאֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לַיהוָה. | Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD.' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לְצָדוֹק, הָשֵׁב אֶת-אֲרוֹן הָאֱלֹהִים הָעִיר: אִם-אֶמְצָא חֵן, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה--וֶהֱשִׁבַנִי, וְהִרְאַנִי אֹתוֹ וְאֶת-נָוֵהוּ. | And the king said unto Zadok: 'Carry back the ark of God into the city; if I shall find favour in the eyes of the LORD, He will bring me back, and show me both it, and His habitation;

text_he: ויאמר שמואל אל-שאול לא אשוב עמך כי מאסתה את-דבר יהוה וימאסך יהוה מהיות מלך על-ישראל | And Samuel said unto Saul 'I will not return with thee for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel'{S} | ואם כה יאמר לא חפצתי בך הני--יעשה-לי כאשר טוב בעיניו | but if He say thus I have no delight in thee behold here am I let Him do to me as seemeth good unto Him'{S}
text_en: And Samuel said unto Saul: 'I will not return with thee; for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל-שָׁאוּל, לֹא אָשׁוּב עִמָּךְ: כִּי מָאַסְתָּה, אֶת-דְּבַר יְהוָה, וַיִּמְאָסְךָ יְהוָה, מִהְיוֹת מֶלֶךְ עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And Samuel said unto Saul: 'I will not return with thee; for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.'{S} | וְאִם כֹּה יֹאמַר, לֹא חָפַצְתִּי בָּךְ: הִנְנִי--יַעֲשֶׂה-לִּי, כַּאֲשֶׁר טוֹב בְּעֵינָיו. | but if He say thus: I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let Him do to me as seemeth good unto Him.'{S}

text_he: ויסב שמואל לכת ויחזק בכנף-מעילו ויקרע | And as Samuel turned about to go away he laid hold upon the skirt of his robe and it rent{S} | ויאמר המלך אל-צדוק הכהן הרואה אתה שבה העיר בשלום ואחימעץ בנך ויהונתן בן-אביתר שני בניכם--אתכם | The king said also unto Zadok the priest 'Seest thou return into the city in peace and your two sons with you Ahimaaz thy son and Jonathan the son of Abiathar
text_en: And as Samuel turned about to go away, he laid hold upon the skirt of his robe, and it rent.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּסֹּב שְׁמוּאֵל, לָלֶכֶת; וַיַּחֲזֵק בִּכְנַף-מְעִילוֹ, וַיִּקָּרַע. | And as Samuel turned about to go away, he laid hold upon the skirt of his robe, and it rent.{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶל-צָדוֹק הַכֹּהֵן, הֲרוֹאֶה אַתָּה, שֻׁבָה הָעִיר בְּשָׁלוֹם; וַאֲחִימַעַץ בִּנְךָ וִיהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-אֶבְיָתָר, שְׁנֵי בְנֵיכֶם--אִתְּכֶם. | The king said also unto Zadok the priest: 'Seest thou? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.

text_he: ויאמר אליו שמואל קרע יהוה את-מלכות ישראל מעליך היום ונתנה לרעך הטוב מך | And Samuel said unto him 'The LORD hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day and hath given it to a neighbour of thine that is better than thou{S} | ראו אנכי מתמהמה בעברות (בערבות) המדבר--עד בוא דבר מעמכם להגיד לי | See I will tarry in the plains of the wilderness until there come word from you to announce unto me'
text_en: And Samuel said unto him: 'The LORD hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbour of thine, that is better than thou.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו, שְׁמוּאֵל, קָרַע יְהוָה אֶת-מַמְלְכוּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵעָלֶיךָ, הַיּוֹם; וּנְתָנָהּ, לְרֵעֲךָ הַטּוֹב מִמֶּךָּ. | And Samuel said unto him: 'The LORD hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbour of thine, that is better than thou.{S} | רְאוּ אָנֹכִי מִתְמַהְמֵהַּ, בעברות (בְּעַרְבוֹת) הַמִּדְבָּר--עַד בּוֹא דָבָר מֵעִמָּכֶם, לְהַגִּיד לִי. | See, I will tarry in the plains of the wilderness, until there come word from you to announce unto me.'

text_he: וגם נצח ישראל לא ישקר ולא ינחם כי לא אדם הוא להנחם | And also the Glory of Israel will not lie nor repent for He is not a man that He should repent' | וישב צדוק ואביתר את-ארון האלהים ירושלם וישבו שם | Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God back to Jerusalem and they abode there
text_en: And also the Glory of Israel will not lie nor repent; for He is not a man, that He should repent.'
text_pisuk: וְגַם נֵצַח יִשְׂרָאֵל, לֹא יְשַׁקֵּר וְלֹא יִנָּחֵם: כִּי לֹא אָדָם הוּא, לְהִנָּחֵם. | And also the Glory of Israel will not lie nor repent; for He is not a man, that He should repent.' | וַיָּשֶׁב צָדוֹק וְאֶבְיָתָר אֶת-אֲרוֹן הָאֱלֹהִים, יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וַיֵּשְׁבוּ, שָׁם. | Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God back to Jerusalem; and they abode there.

text_he: ויאמר חטאתי--עתה כבדני נא נגד זקני-עמי ונגד ישראל ושוב עמי והשתחויתי ליהוה אלהיך | Then he said 'I have sinned yet honour me now I pray thee before the elders of my people and before Israel and return with me that I may worship the LORD thy God' | ודוד עלה במעלה הזיתים עלה ובוכה וראש לו חפוי והוא הלך יחף וכל-העם אשר-אתו חפו איש ראשו ועלו עלה ובכה | And David went up by the ascent of the mount of Olives and wept as he went up and he had his head covered and went barefoot and all the people that were with him covered every man his head and they went up weeping as they went up
text_en: Then he said: 'I have sinned; yet honour me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD thy God.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר חָטָאתִי--עַתָּה כַּבְּדֵנִי נָא נֶגֶד זִקְנֵי-עַמִּי, וְנֶגֶד יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְשׁוּב עִמִּי, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֵיתִי לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ. | Then he said: 'I have sinned; yet honour me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD thy God.' | וְדָוִד עֹלֶה בְמַעֲלֵה הַזֵּיתִים עֹלֶה וּבוֹכֶה, וְרֹאשׁ לוֹ חָפוּי, וְהוּא, הֹלֵךְ יָחֵף; וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, חָפוּ אִישׁ רֹאשׁוֹ, וְעָלוּ עָלֹה, וּבָכֹה. | And David went up by the ascent of the mount of Olives, and wept as he went up; and he had his head covered, and went barefoot; and all the people that were with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.

text_he: וישב שמואל אחרי שאול וישתחו שאול ליהוה | So Samuel returned after Saul and Saul worshipped the LORD{S} | ודוד הגיד לאמר אחיתפל בקשרים עם-אבשלום ויאמר דוד סכל-נא את-עצת אחיתפל יהוה | And one told David saying 'Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom' And David said 'O LORD I pray Thee turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness'
text_en: So Samuel returned after Saul; and Saul worshipped the LORD.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּשָׁב שְׁמוּאֵל, אַחֲרֵי שָׁאוּל; וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ שָׁאוּל, לַיהוָה. | So Samuel returned after Saul; and Saul worshipped the LORD.{S} | וְדָוִד הִגִּיד לֵאמֹר, אֲחִיתֹפֶל בַּקֹּשְׁרִים עִם-אַבְשָׁלוֹם; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, סַכֶּל-נָא אֶת-עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל יְהוָה. | And one told David, saying: 'Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom.' And David said: 'O LORD, I pray Thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.'

text_he: ויאמר שמואל הגישו אלי את-אג מלך עמלק וילך אליו אג מעדנת ויאמר אג אכן סר מר-המות | Then said Samuel 'Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites' And Agag came unto him in chains And Agag said 'Surely the bitterness of death is at hand'{S} | ויהי דוד בא עד-הראש אשר-ישתחוה שם לאלהים והנה לקראתו חושי הארכי קרוע כתנתו ואדמה על-ראשו | And it came to pass that when David was come to the top of the ascent where God was wont to be worshipped behold Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent and earth upon his head
text_en: Then said Samuel: 'Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites.' And Agag came unto him in chains. And Agag said: 'Surely the bitterness of death is at hand.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל, הַגִּישׁוּ אֵלַי אֶת-אֲגַג מֶלֶךְ עֲמָלֵק, וַיֵּלֶךְ אֵלָיו, אֲגַג מַעֲדַנֹּת; וַיֹּאמֶר אֲגָג, אָכֵן סָר מַר-הַמָּוֶת. | Then said Samuel: 'Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites.' And Agag came unto him in chains. And Agag said: 'Surely the bitterness of death is at hand.'{S} | וַיְהִי דָוִד בָּא עַד-הָרֹאשׁ, אֲשֶׁר-יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה שָׁם לֵאלֹהִים; וְהִנֵּה לִקְרָאתוֹ, חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי, קָרוּעַ כֻּתָּנְתּוֹ, וַאֲדָמָה עַל-רֹאשׁוֹ. | And it came to pass, that when David was come to the top of the ascent, where God was wont to be worshipped, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent, and earth upon his head.

text_he: ויאמר שמואל--כאשר שכלה נשים חרבך כן-תשכל מנשים אמך וישסף שמואל את-אג לפני יהוה בגלגל | And Samuel said As thy sword hath made women childless so shall thy mother be childless among women And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal{S} | ויאמר לו דוד אם עברת אתי והית עלי למשא | And David said unto him 'If thou passest on with me then thou wilt be a burden unto Me
text_en: And Samuel said: As thy sword hath made women childless, so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל--כַּאֲשֶׁר שִׁכְּלָה נָשִׁים חַרְבֶּךָ, כֵּן-תִּשְׁכַּל מִנָּשִׁים אִמֶּךָ; וַיְשַׁסֵּף שְׁמוּאֵל אֶת-אֲגָג לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, בַּגִּלְגָּל. | And Samuel said: As thy sword hath made women childless, so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, דָּוִד: אִם עָבַרְתָּ אִתִּי, וְהָיִתָ עָלַי לְמַשָּׂא. | And David said unto him: 'If thou passest on with me, then thou wilt be a burden unto Me;

text_he: וילך שמואל הרמתה ושאול עלה אל-ביתו גבעת שאול | Then Samuel went to Ramah and Saul went up to his house to Gibeath-shaul | ואם-העיר תשוב ואמרת לאבשלום עבדך אני המלך אהיה--עבד אביך ואני מאז ועתה ואני עבדך והפרתה לי את עצת אחיתפל | but if thou return to the city and say unto Absalom I will be thy servant O king as I have been thy father's servant in time past so will I now be thy servant then wilt thou defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel
text_en: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeath-shaul.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ שְׁמוּאֵל, הָרָמָתָה; וְשָׁאוּל עָלָה אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ, גִּבְעַת שָׁאוּל. | Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeath-shaul. | וְאִם-הָעִיר תָּשׁוּב, וְאָמַרְתָּ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם עַבְדְּךָ אֲנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶהְיֶה--עֶבֶד אָבִיךָ וַאֲנִי מֵאָז, וְעַתָּה וַאֲנִי עַבְדֶּךָ; וְהֵפַרְתָּה לִי, אֵת עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל. | but if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom: I will be thy servant, O king; as I have been thy father's servant in time past, so will I now be thy servant; then wilt thou defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel.

text_he: ולא-יסף שמואל לראות את-שאול עד-יום מותו כי-התאבל שמואל אל-שאול ויהוה נחם כי-המליך את-שאול על-ישראל | And Samuel never beheld Saul again until the day of his death for Samuel mourned for Saul and the LORD repented that He had made Saul king over Israel | והלוא עמך שם צדוק ואביתר הכהנים והיה כל-הדבר אשר תשמע מבית המלך--תגיד לצדוק ולאביתר הכהנים | And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests therefore it shall be that what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king's house thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests
text_en: And Samuel never beheld Saul again until the day of his death; for Samuel mourned for Saul; and the LORD repented that He had made Saul king over Israel.
text_pisuk: וְלֹא-יָסַף שְׁמוּאֵל לִרְאוֹת אֶת-שָׁאוּל, עַד-יוֹם מוֹתוֹ, כִּי-הִתְאַבֵּל שְׁמוּאֵל, אֶל-שָׁאוּל; וַיהוָה נִחָם, כִּי-הִמְלִיךְ אֶת-שָׁאוּל עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And Samuel never beheld Saul again until the day of his death; for Samuel mourned for Saul; and the LORD repented that He had made Saul king over Israel. | וַהֲלוֹא עִמְּךָ שָׁם, צָדוֹק וְאֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֲנִים; וְהָיָה, כָּל-הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁמַע מִבֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ--תַּגִּיד, לְצָדוֹק וּלְאֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֲנִים. | And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, that what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king's house, thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.

text_he: ויאמר יהוה אל-שמואל עד-מתי אתה מתאבל אל-שאול ואני מאסתיו מלך על-ישראל מלא קרנך שמן ולך אשלחך אל-ישי בית-הלחמי--כי-ראיתי בניו לי מלך | And the LORD said unto Samuel 'How long wilt thou mourn for Saul seeing I have rejected him from being king over Israel fill thy horn with oil and go I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite for I have provided Me a king among his sons' | ודוד עבר מעט מהראש והנה ציבא נער מפיבשת לקראתו וצמד חמרים חבשים ועליהם מאתים לחם ומאה צמוקים ומאה קיץ--ונבל ין | And when David was a little past the top behold Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him with a couple of asses saddled and upon them two hundred loaves of bread and a hundred clusters of raisins and a hundred of summer fruits and a bottle of wine
text_en: And the LORD said unto Samuel: 'How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from being king over Israel? fill thy horn with oil, and go, I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite; for I have provided Me a king among his sons.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל, עַד-מָתַי אַתָּה מִתְאַבֵּל אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וַאֲנִי מְאַסְתִּיו, מִמְּלֹךְ עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל; מַלֵּא קַרְנְךָ שֶׁמֶן, וְלֵךְ אֶשְׁלָחֲךָ אֶל-יִשַׁי בֵּית-הַלַּחְמִי--כִּי-רָאִיתִי בְּבָנָיו לִי, מֶלֶךְ. | And the LORD said unto Samuel: 'How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from being king over Israel? fill thy horn with oil, and go, I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite; for I have provided Me a king among his sons.' | וְדָוִד, עָבַר מְעַט מֵהָרֹאשׁ, וְהִנֵּה צִיבָא נַעַר מְפִיבֹשֶׁת, לִקְרָאתוֹ; וְצֶמֶד חֲמֹרִים חֲבֻשִׁים, וַעֲלֵיהֶם מָאתַיִם לֶחֶם וּמֵאָה צִמּוּקִים וּמֵאָה קַיִץ--וְנֵבֶל יָיִן. | And when David was a little past the top, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred clusters of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.

text_he: ויאמר שמואל איך אלך ושמע שאול והרגני ויאמר יהוה עגלת בקר תקח בידך ואמרת לזבח ליהוה באתי | And Samuel said 'How can I go if Saul hear it he will kill me' And the LORD said 'Take a heifer with thee and say I am come to sacrifice to the LORD | ויאמר המלך אל-ציבא מה-אלה לך ויאמר ציבא החמורים לבית-המלך לרכב ולהלחם (והלחם) והקיץ לאכול הנערים והין לשתות היעף במדבר | And the king said unto Ziba 'What meanest thou by these' And Ziba said 'The asses are for the king's household to ride on and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat and the wine that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink'
text_en: And Samuel said: 'How can I go? if Saul hear it, he will kill me.' And the LORD said: 'Take a heifer with thee, and say: I am come to sacrifice to the LORD.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ, וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי; וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, עֶגְלַת בָּקָר תִּקַּח בְּיָדֶךָ, וְאָמַרְתָּ, לִזְבֹּחַ לַיהוָה בָּאתִי. | And Samuel said: 'How can I go? if Saul hear it, he will kill me.' And the LORD said: 'Take a heifer with thee, and say: I am come to sacrifice to the LORD. | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-צִיבָא, מָה-אֵלֶּה לָּךְ; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא הַחֲמוֹרִים לְבֵית-הַמֶּלֶךְ לִרְכֹּב, ולהלחם (וְהַלֶּחֶם) וְהַקַּיִץ לֶאֱכוֹל הַנְּעָרִים, וְהַיַּיִן, לִשְׁתּוֹת הַיָּעֵף בַּמִּדְבָּר. | And the king said unto Ziba: 'What meanest thou by these?' And Ziba said: 'The asses are for the king's household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.'

text_he: וקראת לישי בזבח ואנכי אודיעך את אשר-תעשה ומשחת לי את אשר-אמר אליך | And call Jesse to the sacrifice and I will tell thee what thou shalt do and thou shalt anoint unto Me him whom I name unto thee' | ויאמר המלך ואיה בן-אדניך ויאמר ציבא אל-המלך הנה יושב בירושלם--כי אמר היום ישיבו לי בית ישראל את מלכות אבי | And the king said 'And where is thy master's son' And Ziba said unto the king 'Behold he abideth at Jerusalem for he said To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father'
text_en: And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will tell thee what thou shalt do; and thou shalt anoint unto Me him whom I name unto thee.'
text_pisuk: וְקָרָאתָ לְיִשַׁי, בַּזָּבַח; וְאָנֹכִי, אוֹדִיעֲךָ אֵת אֲשֶׁר-תַּעֲשֶׂה, וּמָשַׁחְתָּ לִי, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-אֹמַר אֵלֶיךָ. | And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will tell thee what thou shalt do; and thou shalt anoint unto Me him whom I name unto thee.' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְאַיֵּה בֶּן-אֲדֹנֶיךָ; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, הִנֵּה יוֹשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִַם--כִּי אָמַר, הַיּוֹם יָשִׁיבוּ לִי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵת מַמְלְכוּת אָבִי. | And the king said: 'And where is thy master's son?' And Ziba said unto the king: 'Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem; for he said: To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.'

text_he: ויעש שמואל את אשר דבר יהוה ויבא בית לחם ויחרדו זקני העיר לקראתו ויאמר שלם בואך | And Samuel did that which the LORD spoke and came to Beth-lehem And the elders of the city came to meet him trembling and said 'Comest thou peaceably' | ויאמר המלך לצבא הנה לך כל אשר למפיבשת ויאמר ציבא השתחויתי אמצא-חן בעיניך אדני המלך | Then said the king to Ziba 'Behold thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth' And Ziba said 'I prostrate myself let me find favour in thy sight my lord O king'
text_en: And Samuel did that which the LORD spoke, and came to Beth-lehem. And the elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said: 'Comest thou peaceably?'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַשׂ שְׁמוּאֵל, אֵת אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה, וַיָּבֹא, בֵּית לָחֶם; וַיֶּחֶרְדוּ זִקְנֵי הָעִיר, לִקְרָאתוֹ, וַיֹּאמֶר, שָׁלֹם בּוֹאֶךָ. | And Samuel did that which the LORD spoke, and came to Beth-lehem. And the elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said: 'Comest thou peaceably?' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, לְצִבָא, הִנֵּה לְךָ, כֹּל אֲשֶׁר לִמְפִיבֹשֶׁת; וַיֹּאמֶר צִיבָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוֵיתִי, אֶמְצָא-חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | Then said the king to Ziba: 'Behold, thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth.' And Ziba said: 'I prostrate myself; let me find favour in thy sight, my lord, O king.'

text_he: ויאמר שלום לזבח ליהוה באתי התקדשו ובאתם אתי בזבח ויקדש את-ישי ואת-בניו ויקרא להם לזבח | And he said 'Peaceably I am come to sacrifice unto the LORD sanctify yourselves and come with me to the sacrifice' And he sanctified Jesse and his sons and called them to the sacrifice | ובא המלך דוד עד-בחורים והנה משם איש יוצא משפחת בית-שאול ושמו שמעי בן-גרא יצא יצוא ומקל | And when king David came to Bahurim behold there came out thence a man of the family of the house of Saul whose name was Shimei the son of Gera he came out and kept on cursing as he came
text_en: And he said: 'Peaceably; I am come to sacrifice unto the LORD; sanctify yourselves and come with me to the sacrifice.' And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁלוֹם, לִזְבֹּחַ לַיהוָה בָּאתִי, הִתְקַדְּשׁוּ, וּבָאתֶם אִתִּי בַּזָּבַח; וַיְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת-יִשַׁי וְאֶת-בָּנָיו, וַיִּקְרָא לָהֶם לַזָּבַח. | And he said: 'Peaceably; I am come to sacrifice unto the LORD; sanctify yourselves and come with me to the sacrifice.' And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice. | וּבָא הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד, עַד-בַּחוּרִים; וְהִנֵּה מִשָּׁם אִישׁ יוֹצֵא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית-שָׁאוּל, וּשְׁמוֹ שִׁמְעִי בֶן-גֵּרָא, יֹצֵא יָצוֹא, וּמְקַלֵּל. | And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, there came out thence a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera; he came out, and kept on cursing as he came.

text_he: ויהי בואם וירא את-אליאב ויאמר אך נגד יהוה משיחו | And it came to pass when they were come that he beheld Eliab and said 'Surely the LORD'S anointed is before Him'{S} | ויסקל באבנים את-דוד ואת-כל-עבדי המלך דוד וכל-העם וכל-הגברים מימינו ומשמאלו | And he cast stones at David and at all the servants of king David and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left
text_en: And it came to pass, when they were come, that he beheld Eliab, and said: 'Surely the LORD'S anointed is before Him.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי בְּבוֹאָם, וַיַּרְא אֶת-אֱלִיאָב; וַיֹּאמֶר, אַךְ נֶגֶד יְהוָה מְשִׁיחוֹ. | And it came to pass, when they were come, that he beheld Eliab, and said: 'Surely the LORD'S anointed is before Him.'{S} | וַיְסַקֵּל בָּאֲבָנִים אֶת-דָּוִד, וְאֶת-כָּל-עַבְדֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד; וְכָל-הָעָם, וְכָל-הַגִּבֹּרִים, מִימִינוֹ, וּמִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. | And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David; and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.

text_he: ויאמר יהוה אל-שמואל אל-תבט אל-מראהו ואל-גבה קומתו--כי מאסתיהו כי לא אשר יראה האדם--כי האדם יראה לעינים ויהוה יראה לב | But the LORD said unto Samuel 'Look not on his countenance or on the height of his stature because I have rejected him for it is not as man seeth for man looketh on the outward appearance but the LORD looketh on the heart' | וכה-אמר שמעי בקלו צא צא איש הדמים ואיש הבליעל | And thus said Shimei when he cursed 'Begone begone thou man of blood and base fellow
text_en: But the LORD said unto Samuel: 'Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him; for it is not as man seeth: for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל, אַל-תַּבֵּט אֶל-מַרְאֵהוּ וְאֶל-גְּבֹהַּ קוֹמָתוֹ--כִּי מְאַסְתִּיהוּ: כִּי לֹא, אֲשֶׁר יִרְאֶה הָאָדָם--כִּי הָאָדָם יִרְאֶה לַעֵינַיִם, וַיהוָה יִרְאֶה לַלֵּבָב. | But the LORD said unto Samuel: 'Look not on his countenance, or on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him; for it is not as man seeth: for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.' | וְכֹה-אָמַר שִׁמְעִי, בְּקַלְלוֹ; צֵא צֵא אִישׁ הַדָּמִים, וְאִישׁ הַבְּלִיָּעַל. | And thus said Shimei when he cursed: 'Begone, begone, thou man of blood, and base fellow;

text_he: ויקרא ישי אל-אבינדב ויעברהו לפני שמואל ויאמר גם-בזה לא-בחר יהוה | Then Jesse called Abinadab and made him pass before Samuel And he said 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this' | השיב עליך יהוה כל דמי בית-שאול אשר מלכת תחתו ויתן יהוה את-המלוכה ביד אבשלום בנך והנך ברעתך כי איש דמים אתה | the LORD hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul in whose stead thou hast reigned and the LORD hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son and behold thou art taken in thine own mischief because thou art a man of blood'
text_en: Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said: 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּקְרָא יִשַׁי אֶל-אֲבִינָדָב, וַיַּעֲבִרֵהוּ לִפְנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל; וַיֹּאמֶר, גַּם-בָּזֶה לֹא-בָחַר יְהוָה. | Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said: 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this.' | הֵשִׁיב עָלֶיךָ יְהוָה כֹּל דְּמֵי בֵית-שָׁאוּל, אֲשֶׁר מָלַכְתָּ תַּחְתָּו, וַיִּתֵּן יְהוָה אֶת-הַמְּלוּכָה, בְּיַד אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנֶךָ; וְהִנְּךָ, בְּרָעָתֶךָ, כִּי אִישׁ דָּמִים, אָתָּה. | the LORD hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and the LORD hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son; and, behold, thou art taken in thine own mischief, because thou art a man of blood.'

text_he: ויעבר ישי שמה ויאמר גם-בזה לא-בחר יהוה | Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by And he said 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this' | ויאמר אבישי בן-צרויה אל-המלך למה יקל הכלב המת הזה את-אדני המלך אעברה-נא ואסירה את-ראשו | Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king 'Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king let me go over I pray thee and take off his head'{S}
text_en: Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said: 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲבֵר יִשַׁי, שַׁמָּה; וַיֹּאמֶר, גַּם-בָּזֶה לֹא-בָחַר יְהוָה. | Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said: 'Neither hath the LORD chosen this.' | וַיֹּאמֶר אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, לָמָּה יְקַלֵּל הַכֶּלֶב הַמֵּת הַזֶּה, אֶת-אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ; אֶעְבְּרָה-נָּא, וְאָסִירָה אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ. | Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king: 'Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.'{S}

text_he: ויעבר ישי שבעת בניו לפני שמואל ויאמר שמואל אל-ישי לא-בחר יהוה באלה | And Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel And Samuel said unto Jesse 'The LORD hath not chosen these' | ויאמר המלך מה-לי ולכם בני צריה כי (כה) יקל וכי (כי) יהוה אמר לו קל את-דוד ומי יאמר מדוע עשיתה כן | And the king said 'What have I to do with you ye sons of Zeruiah So let him curse because the LORD hath said unto him Curse David who then shall say Wherefore hast thou done so'{S}
text_en: And Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'The LORD hath not chosen these.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲבֵר יִשַׁי שִׁבְעַת בָּנָיו, לִפְנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל; וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל-יִשַׁי, לֹא-בָחַר יְהוָה בָּאֵלֶּה. | And Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'The LORD hath not chosen these.' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, מַה-לִּי וְלָכֶם בְּנֵי צְרֻיָה; כי (כֹּה) יְקַלֵּל, וכי (כִּי) יְהוָה אָמַר לוֹ קַלֵּל אֶת-דָּוִד, וּמִי יֹאמַר, מַדּוּעַ עָשִׂיתָה כֵּן. | And the king said: 'What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? So let him curse, because the LORD hath said unto him: Curse David; who then shall say: Wherefore hast thou done so?'{S}

text_he: ויאמר שמואל אל-ישי התמו הנערים ויאמר עוד שאר הקטן והנה רעה בצאן ויאמר שמואל אל-ישי שלחה וקחנו כי לא-נסב עד-באו פה | And Samuel said unto Jesse 'Are here all thy children' And he said 'There remaineth yet the youngest and behold he keepeth the sheep' And Samuel said unto Jesse 'Send and fetch him for we will not sit down till he come hither' | ויאמר דוד אל-אבישי ואל-כל-עבדיו הנה בני אשר-יצא מעי מבקש את-נפשי ואף כי-עתה בן-הימיני הנחו לו ויקל--כי אמר-לו יהוה | And David said to Abishai and to all his servants 'Behold my son who came forth of my body seeketh my life how much more this Benjamite now let him alone and let him curse for the LORD hath bidden him
text_en: And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'Are here all thy children?' And he said: 'There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he keepeth the sheep.' And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'Send and fetch him; for we will not sit down till he come hither.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל-יִשַׁי, הֲתַמּוּ הַנְּעָרִים, וַיֹּאמֶר עוֹד שָׁאַר הַקָּטָן, וְהִנֵּה רֹעֶה בַּצֹּאן; וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל-יִשַׁי שִׁלְחָה וְקָחֶנּוּ, כִּי לֹא-נָסֹב עַד-בֹּאוֹ פֹה. | And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'Are here all thy children?' And he said: 'There remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he keepeth the sheep.' And Samuel said unto Jesse: 'Send and fetch him; for we will not sit down till he come hither.' | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-אֲבִישַׁי וְאֶל-כָּל-עֲבָדָיו, הִנֵּה בְנִי אֲשֶׁר-יָצָא מִמֵּעַי מְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-נַפְשִׁי; וְאַף כִּי-עַתָּה בֶּן-הַיְמִינִי, הַנִּחוּ לוֹ וִיקַלֵּל--כִּי אָמַר-לוֹ, יְהוָה. | And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants: 'Behold, my son, who came forth of my body, seeketh my life; how much more this Benjamite now? let him alone, and let him curse; for the LORD hath bidden him.

text_he: וישלח ויביאהו והוא אדמוני עם-יפה עינים וטוב ראי ויאמר יהוה קום משחהו כי-זה הוא | And he sent and brought him in Now he was ruddy and withal of beautiful eyes and goodly to look uponAnd the LORD said 'Arise anoint him for this is he' | אולי יראה יהוה בעוני (בעיני) והשיב יהוה לי טובה תחת קלתו היום הזה | It may be that the LORD will look on mine eye and that the LORD will requite me good for his cursing of me this day'
text_en: And he sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and withal of beautiful eyes, and goodly to look upon.And the LORD said: 'Arise, anoint him; for this is he.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח וַיְבִיאֵהוּ וְהוּא אַדְמוֹנִי, עִם-יְפֵה עֵינַיִם וְטוֹב רֹאִי; וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה קוּם מְשָׁחֵהוּ, כִּי-זֶה הוּא. | And he sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and withal of beautiful eyes, and goodly to look upon.And the LORD said: 'Arise, anoint him; for this is he.' | אוּלַי יִרְאֶה יְהוָה, בעוני (בְּעֵינִי); וְהֵשִׁיב יְהוָה לִי טוֹבָה, תַּחַת קִלְלָתוֹ הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. | It may be that the LORD will look on mine eye, and that the LORD will requite me good for his cursing of me this day.'

text_he: ויקח שמואל את-קרן השמן וימשח אתו בקרב אחיו ותצלח רוח-יהוה אל-דוד מהיום הוא ומעלה ויקם שמואל וילך הרמתה | Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the midst of his brethren and the spirit of the LORD came mightily upon David from that day forward So Samuel rose up and went to Ramah | וילך דוד ואנשיו בדרך ושמעי הלך בצלע הר לעמתו הלוך ויקל ויסקל באבנים לעמתו ועפר בעפר | So David and his men went by the way{S}and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against him and cursed as he went and threw stones at him and cast dust
text_en: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren; and the spirit of the LORD came mightily upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח שְׁמוּאֵל אֶת-קֶרֶן הַשֶּׁמֶן, וַיִּמְשַׁח אֹתוֹ בְּקֶרֶב אֶחָיו, וַתִּצְלַח רוּחַ-יְהוָה אֶל-דָּוִד, מֵהַיּוֹם הַהוּא וָמָעְלָה; וַיָּקָם שְׁמוּאֵל, וַיֵּלֶךְ הָרָמָתָה. | Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren; and the spirit of the LORD came mightily upon David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah. | וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו, בַּדָּרֶךְ;  וְשִׁמְעִי הֹלֵךְ בְּצֵלַע הָהָר לְעֻמָּתוֹ, הָלוֹךְ וַיְקַלֵּל, וַיְסַקֵּל בָּאֲבָנִים לְעֻמָּתוֹ, וְעִפַּר בֶּעָפָר. | So David and his men went by the way;{S}and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.

text_he: ורוח יהוה סרה מעם שאול ובעתו רוח-רעה מאת יהוה | Now the spirit of the LORD had departed from Saul and an evil spirit from the LORD terrified him | ויבא המלך וכל-העם אשר-אתו עיפים וינפש שם | And the king and all the people that were with him came weary and he refreshed himself there
text_en: Now the spirit of the LORD had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD terrified him.
text_pisuk: וְרוּחַ יְהוָה סָרָה, מֵעִם שָׁאוּל; וּבִעֲתַתּוּ רוּחַ-רָעָה, מֵאֵת יְהוָה. | Now the spirit of the LORD had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD terrified him. | וַיָּבֹא הַמֶּלֶךְ וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, עֲיֵפִים; וַיִּנָּפֵשׁ, שָׁם. | And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary; and he refreshed himself there.

text_he: ויאמרו עבדי-שאול אליו הנה-נא רוח-אלהים רעה מבעתך | And Saul's servants said unto him 'Behold now an evil spirit from God terrifieth thee | ואבשלום וכל-העם איש ישראל באו ירושלם ואחיתפל אתו | And Absalom and all the people the men of Israel came to Jerusalem and Ahithophel with him
text_en: And Saul's servants said unto him: 'Behold now, an evil spirit from God terrifieth thee.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמְרוּ עַבְדֵי-שָׁאוּל, אֵלָיו: הִנֵּה-נָא רוּחַ-אֱלֹהִים רָעָה, מְבַעִתֶּךָ. | And Saul's servants said unto him: 'Behold now, an evil spirit from God terrifieth thee. | וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם, וְכָל-הָעָם אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּאוּ, יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל, אִתּוֹ. | And Absalom, and all the people, the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.

text_he: יאמר-נא אדנו עבדיך לפניך--יבקשו איש ידע מנגן בכנור והיה בהיות עליך רוח-אלהים רעה--ונגן בידו וטוב לך | Let our lord now command thy servants that are before thee to seek out a man who is a skilful player on the harp and it shall be when the evil spirit from God cometh upon thee that he shall play with his hand and thou shalt be well' | ויהי כאשר-בא חושי הארכי רעה דוד--אל-אבשלום ויאמר חושי אל-אבשלום יחי המלך יחי המלך | And it came to pass when Hushai the Archite David's friend was come unto Absalom that Hushai said unto Absalom 'Long live the king long live the king'
text_en: Let our lord now command thy servants, that are before thee, to seek out a man who is a skilful player on the harp; and it shall be, when the evil spirit from God cometh upon thee, that he shall play with his hand, and thou shalt be well.'
text_pisuk: יֹאמַר-נָא אֲדֹנֵנוּ, עֲבָדֶיךָ לְפָנֶיךָ--יְבַקְשׁוּ, אִישׁ יֹדֵעַ מְנַגֵּן בַּכִּנּוֹר; וְהָיָה, בִּהְיוֹת עָלֶיךָ רוּחַ-אֱלֹהִים רָעָה--וְנִגֵּן בְּיָדוֹ, וְטוֹב לָךְ. | Let our lord now command thy servants, that are before thee, to seek out a man who is a skilful player on the harp; and it shall be, when the evil spirit from God cometh upon thee, that he shall play with his hand, and thou shalt be well.' | וַיְהִי, כַּאֲשֶׁר-בָּא חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי רֵעֶה דָוִד--אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם; וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, יְחִי הַמֶּלֶךְ יְחִי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David's friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Long live the king, long live the king.'

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-עבדיו ראו-נא לי איש מיטיב לנגן והביאותם אלי | And Saul said unto his servants 'Provide me now a man that can play well and bring him to me' | ויאמר אבשלום אל-חושי זה חסדך את-רעך למה לא-הלכת את-רעך | And Absalom said to Hushai 'Is this thy kindness to thy friend why wentest thou not with thy friend'
text_en: And Saul said unto his servants: 'Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring him to me.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, אֶל-עֲבָדָיו: רְאוּ-נָא לִי, אִישׁ מֵיטִיב לְנַגֵּן, וַהֲבִיאוֹתֶם, אֵלָי. | And Saul said unto his servants: 'Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring him to me.' | וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-חוּשַׁי, זֶה חַסְדְּךָ אֶת-רֵעֶךָ; לָמָּה לֹא-הָלַכְתָּ, אֶת-רֵעֶךָ. | And Absalom said to Hushai: 'Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?'

text_he: ויען אחד מהנערים ויאמר הנה ראיתי בן לישי בית הלחמי ידע נגן וגבור חיל ואיש מלחמה ונבון דבר ואיש תאר ויהוה עמו | Then answered one of the young men and said 'Behold I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite that is skilful in playing and a mighty man of valour and a man of war and prudent in affairs and a comely person and the LORD is with him' | ויאמר חושי אל-אבשלם לא כי אשר בחר יהוה והעם הזה וכל-איש ישראל--לא (לו) אהיה ואתו אשב | And Hushai said unto Absalom 'Nay but whom the LORD and this people and all the men of Israel have chosen his will I be and with him will I abide
text_en: Then answered one of the young men, and said: 'Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite, that is skilful in playing, and a mighty man of valour, and a man of war, and prudent in affairs, and a comely person, and the LORD is with him.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן אֶחָד מֵהַנְּעָרִים וַיֹּאמֶר, הִנֵּה רָאִיתִי בֵּן לְיִשַׁי בֵּית הַלַּחְמִי, יֹדֵעַ נַגֵּן וְגִבּוֹר חַיִל וְאִישׁ מִלְחָמָה וּנְבוֹן דָּבָר, וְאִישׁ תֹּאַר; וַיהוָה, עִמּוֹ. | Then answered one of the young men, and said: 'Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite, that is skilful in playing, and a mighty man of valour, and a man of war, and prudent in affairs, and a comely person, and the LORD is with him.' | וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלֹם, לֹא, כִּי אֲשֶׁר בָּחַר יְהוָה וְהָעָם הַזֶּה וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל--לא (לוֹ) אֶהְיֶה, וְאִתּוֹ אֵשֵׁב. | And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'Nay; but whom the LORD, and this people, and all the men of Israel have chosen, his will I be, and with him will I abide.

text_he: וישלח שאול מלאכים אל-ישי ויאמר שלחה אלי את-דוד בנך אשר בצאן | Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse and said 'Send me David thy son who is with the sheep' | והשנית למי אני אעבד--הלוא לפני בנו כאשר עבדתי לפני אביך כן אהיה לפניך | And again whom should I serve should I not serve in the presence of his son as I have served in thy father's presence so will I be in thy presence'
text_en: Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse, and said: 'Send me David thy son, who is with the sheep.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל מַלְאָכִים, אֶל-יִשָׁי; וַיֹּאמֶר, שִׁלְחָה אֵלַי אֶת-דָּוִד בִּנְךָ אֲשֶׁר בַּצֹּאן. | Wherefore Saul sent messengers unto Jesse, and said: 'Send me David thy son, who is with the sheep.' | וְהַשֵּׁנִית, לְמִי אֲנִי אֶעֱבֹד--הֲלוֹא, לִפְנֵי בְנוֹ: כַּאֲשֶׁר עָבַדְתִּי לִפְנֵי אָבִיךָ, כֵּן אֶהְיֶה לִפָנֶיךָ. | And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father's presence, so will I be in thy presence.'

text_he: ויקח ישי חמור לחם ונאד ין וגדי עזים אחד וישלח ביד-דוד בנו אל-שאול | And Jesse took an ass laden with bread and a bottle of wine and a kid and sent them by David his son unto Saul | ויאמר אבשלום אל-אחיתפל הבו לכם עצה מה-נעשה | Then said Absalom to Ahithophel 'Give your counsel what we shall do'
text_en: And Jesse took an ass laden with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son unto Saul.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח יִשַׁי חֲמוֹר לֶחֶם, וְנֹאד יַיִן, וּגְדִי עִזִּים, אֶחָד; וַיִּשְׁלַח בְּיַד-דָּוִד בְּנוֹ, אֶל-שָׁאוּל. | And Jesse took an ass laden with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son unto Saul. | וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אֶל-אֲחִיתֹפֶל: הָבוּ לָכֶם עֵצָה, מַה-נַּעֲשֶׂה. | Then said Absalom to Ahithophel: 'Give your counsel what we shall do.'

text_he: ויבא דוד אל-שאול ויעמד לפניו ויאהבהו מאד ויהי-לו נשא כלים | And David came to Saul and stood before him and he loved him greatly and he became his armour-bearer | ויאמר אחיתפל אל-אבשלם בוא אל-פלגשי אביך אשר הניח לשמור הבית ושמע כל-ישראל כי-נבאשת את-אביך וחזקו ידי כל-אשר אתך | And Ahithophel said unto Absalom 'Go in unto thy father's concubines that he hath left to keep the house and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy father then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong'
text_en: And David came to Saul, and stood before him; and he loved him greatly; and he became his armour-bearer.
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא דָוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וַיַּעֲמֹד לְפָנָיו; וַיֶּאֱהָבֵהוּ מְאֹד, וַיְהִי-לוֹ נֹשֵׂא כֵלִים. | And David came to Saul, and stood before him; and he loved him greatly; and he became his armour-bearer. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלֹם, בּוֹא אֶל-פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיךָ, אֲשֶׁר הִנִּיחַ לִשְׁמוֹר הַבָּיִת; וְשָׁמַע כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, כִּי-נִבְאַשְׁתָּ אֶת-אָבִיךָ, וְחָזְקוּ, יְדֵי כָּל-אֲשֶׁר אִתָּךְ. | And Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Go in unto thy father's concubines, that he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy father; then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong.'

text_he: וישלח שאול אל-ישי לאמר יעמד-נא דוד לפני כי-מצא חן בעיני | And Saul sent to Jesse saying 'Let David I pray thee stand before me for he hath found favour in my sight' | ויטו לאבשלום האהל על-הג ויבא אבשלום אל-פלגשי אביו לעיני כל-ישראל | So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house and Absalom went in unto his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel--
text_en: And Saul sent to Jesse, saying: 'Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favour in my sight.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל, אֶל-יִשַׁי לֵאמֹר: יַעֲמָד-נָא דָוִד לְפָנַי, כִּי-מָצָא חֵן בְּעֵינָי. | And Saul sent to Jesse, saying: 'Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favour in my sight.' | וַיַּטּוּ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם הָאֹהֶל, עַל-הַגָּג; וַיָּבֹא אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו, לְעֵינֵי כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel.--

text_he: והיה בהיות רוח-אלהים אל-שאול ולקח דוד את-הכנור ונגן בידו ורוח לשאול וטוב לו וסרה מעליו רוח הרעה | And it came to pass when the spirit from God was upon Saul that David took the harp and played with his hand so Saul found relief and it was well with him and the evil spirit departed from him | ועצת אחיתפל אשר יעץ בימים הם כאשר ישאל- (איש) בדבר האלהים כן כל-עצת אחיתפל גם-לדוד גם לאבשלם | Now the counsel of Ahithophel which he counselled in those days was as if a man inquired of the word of God so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom{S}
text_en: And it came to pass, when the spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took the harp, and played with his hand; so Saul found relief, and it was well with him, and the evil spirit departed from him.
text_pisuk: וְהָיָה, בִּהְיוֹת רוּחַ-אֱלֹהִים אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וְלָקַח דָּוִד אֶת-הַכִּנּוֹר, וְנִגֵּן בְּיָדוֹ; וְרָוַח לְשָׁאוּל וְטוֹב לוֹ, וְסָרָה מֵעָלָיו רוּחַ הָרָעָה. | And it came to pass, when the spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took the harp, and played with his hand; so Saul found relief, and it was well with him, and the evil spirit departed from him. | וַעֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֲשֶׁר יָעַץ בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִשְׁאַל- (אִישׁ), בִּדְבַר הָאֱלֹהִים; כֵּן כָּל-עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל, גַּם-לְדָוִד גַּם לְאַבְשָׁלֹם. | Now the counsel of Ahithophel, which he counselled in those days, was as if a man inquired of the word of God; so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.{S}

text_he: ויאספו פלשתים את-מחניהם למלחמה ויאספו שכה אשר ליהודה ויחנו בין-שוכה ובין-עזקה באפס דמים | Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle and they were gathered together at Socoh which belongeth to Judah and pitched between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes-dammim | ויאמר אחיתפל אל-אבשלום אבחרה נא שנים-עשר אלף איש ואקומה וארדפה אחרי-דוד הלילה | Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom 'Let me now choose out twelve thousand men and I will arise and pursue after David this night
text_en: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim.
text_pisuk: וַיַּאַסְפוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים אֶת-מַחֲנֵיהֶם, לַמִּלְחָמָה, וַיֵּאָסְפוּ, שֹׂכֹה אֲשֶׁר לִיהוּדָה; וַיַּחֲנוּ בֵּין-שׂוֹכֹה וּבֵין-עֲזֵקָה, בְּאֶפֶס דַּמִּים. | Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם: אֶבְחֲרָה נָּא, שְׁנֵים-עָשָׂר אֶלֶף אִישׁ, וְאָקוּמָה וְאֶרְדְּפָה אַחֲרֵי-דָוִד, הַלָּיְלָה. | Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom: 'Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night;

text_he: ושאול ואיש-ישראל נאספו ויחנו בעמק האלה ויערכו מלחמה לקראת פלשתים | And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together and pitched in the vale of Elah and set the battle in array against the Philistines | ואבוא עליו והוא יגע ורפה ידים והחרדתי אתו ונס כל-העם אשר-אתו והכיתי את-המלך לבדו | and I will come upon him while he is weary and weak-handed and will make him afraid and all the people that are with him shall flee and I will smite the king only
text_en: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and pitched in the vale of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.
text_pisuk: וְשָׁאוּל וְאִישׁ-יִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶסְפוּ, וַיַּחֲנוּ בְּעֵמֶק הָאֵלָה; וַיַּעַרְכוּ מִלְחָמָה, לִקְרַאת פְּלִשְׁתִּים. | And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and pitched in the vale of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines. | וְאָבוֹא עָלָיו, וְהוּא יָגֵעַ וּרְפֵה יָדַיִם, וְהַחֲרַדְתִּי אֹתוֹ, וְנָס כָּל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ; וְהִכֵּיתִי אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, לְבַדּוֹ. | and I will come upon him while he is weary and weak-handed, and will make him afraid; and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only;

text_he: ופלשתים עמדים אל-הר מזה וישראל עמדים אל-הר מזה והגיא ביניהם | And the Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side and there was a valley between them | ואשיבה כל-העם אליך כשוב הכל--האיש אשר אתה מבקש כל-העם יהיה שלום | and I will bring back all the people unto thee when all shall have returned the man whom thou seekest all the people will be in peace'
text_en: And the Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side; and there was a valley between them.
text_pisuk: וּפְלִשְׁתִּים עֹמְדִים אֶל-הָהָר, מִזֶּה, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל עֹמְדִים אֶל-הָהָר, מִזֶּה; וְהַגַּיְא, בֵּינֵיהֶם. | And the Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side; and there was a valley between them. | וְאָשִׁיבָה כָל-הָעָם, אֵלֶיךָ: כְּשׁוּב הַכֹּל--הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ, כָּל-הָעָם יִהְיֶה שָׁלוֹם. | and I will bring back all the people unto thee; when all shall have returned, the man whom thou seekest, all the people will be in peace.'

text_he: ויצא איש-הבנים מחנות פלשתים גלית שמו מגת גבהו ש אמות וזרת | And there went out a champion from the camp of the Philistines named Goliath of Gath whose height was six cubits and a span | וישר הדבר בעיני אבשלם ובעיני כל-זקני ישראל | And the saying pleased Absalom well and all the elders of Israel{S}
text_en: And there went out a champion from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּצֵא אִישׁ-הַבֵּנַיִם מִמַּחֲנוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים, גָּלְיָת שְׁמוֹ מִגַּת: גָּבְהוֹ, שֵׁשׁ אַמּוֹת וָזָרֶת. | And there went out a champion from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span. | וַיִּישַׁר הַדָּבָר, בְּעֵינֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם, וּבְעֵינֵי, כָּל-זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.{S}

text_he: וכובע נחשת על-ראשו ושריון קשקשים הוא לבוש ומשקל השריון--חמשת-אלפים שקלים נחשת | And he had a helmet of brass upon his head and he was clad with a coat of mail and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass | ויאמר אבשלום קרא נא גם לחושי הארכי ונשמעה מה-בפיו גם-הוא | Then said Absalom 'Call now Hushai the Archite also and let us hear likewise what he saith'
text_en: And he had a helmet of brass upon his head, and he was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.
text_pisuk: וְכוֹבַע נְחֹשֶׁת עַל-רֹאשׁוֹ, וְשִׁרְיוֹן קַשְׂקַשִּׂים הוּא לָבוּשׁ; וּמִשְׁקַל, הַשִּׁרְיוֹן--חֲמֵשֶׁת-אֲלָפִים שְׁקָלִים, נְחֹשֶׁת. | And he had a helmet of brass upon his head, and he was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass. | וַיֹּאמֶר, אַבְשָׁלוֹם, קְרָא נָא, גַּם לְחוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי; וְנִשְׁמְעָה מַה-בְּפִיו, גַּם-הוּא. | Then said Absalom: 'Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.'

text_he: ומצחת נחשת על-רגליו וכידון נחשת בין כתפיו | And he had greaves of brass upon his legs and a javelin of brass between his shoulders | ויבא חושי אל-אבשלום ויאמר אבשלום אליו לאמר כדבר הזה דבר אחיתפל הנעשה את-דברו אם-אין אתה דבר | And when Hushai was come to Absalom Absalom spoke unto him saying 'Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner shall we do after his saying if not speak thou'{S}
text_en: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a javelin of brass between his shoulders.
text_pisuk: וּמִצְחַת נְחֹשֶׁת, עַל-רַגְלָיו; וְכִידוֹן נְחֹשֶׁת, בֵּין כְּתֵפָיו. | And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a javelin of brass between his shoulders. | וַיָּבֹא חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֵלָיו לֵאמֹר כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה דִּבֶּר אֲחִיתֹפֶל, הֲנַעֲשֶׂה אֶת-דְּבָרוֹ; אִם-אַיִן, אַתָּה דַבֵּר. | And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spoke unto him, saying: 'Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner; shall we do after his saying? if not, speak thou.'{S}

text_he: וחץ (ועץ) חניתו כמנור ארגים ולהבת חניתו ש-מאות שקלים ברזל ונשא הצנה הלך לפניו | And the shaft of his spear was like a weaver's beam and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron and his shield-bearer went before him | ויאמר חושי אל-אבשלום לא-טובה העצה אשר-יעץ אחיתפל בפעם הזאת | And Hushai said unto Absalom 'The counsel that Ahithophel hath given this time is not good'
text_en: And the shaft of his spear was like a weaver's beam; and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron; and his shield-bearer went before him.
text_pisuk: וחץ (וְעֵץ) חֲנִיתוֹ, כִּמְנוֹר אֹרְגִים, וְלַהֶבֶת חֲנִיתוֹ, שֵׁשׁ-מֵאוֹת שְׁקָלִים בַּרְזֶל; וְנֹשֵׂא הַצִּנָּה, הֹלֵךְ לְפָנָיו. | And the shaft of his spear was like a weaver's beam; and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron; and his shield-bearer went before him. | וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם: לֹא-טוֹבָה הָעֵצָה אֲשֶׁר-יָעַץ אֲחִיתֹפֶל, בַּפַּעַם הַזֹּאת. | And Hushai said unto Absalom: 'The counsel that Ahithophel hath given this time is not good.'

text_he: ויעמד ויקרא אל-מערכת ישראל ויאמר להם למה תצאו לערך מלחמה הלוא אנכי הפלשתי ואתם עבדים לשאול--ברו-לכם איש וירד אלי | And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel and said unto them 'Why do ye come out to set your battle in array am not I a Philistine and ye servants to Saul choose you a man for you and let him come down to me | ויאמר חושי אתה ידעת את-אביך ואת-אנשיו כי גברים המה ומרי נפש המה כדב שכול בשדה ואביך איש מלחמה ולא ילין את-העם | Hushai said moreover 'Thou knowest thy father and his men that they are mighty men and they are embittered in their minds as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field and thy father is a man of war and will not lodge with the people
text_en: And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them: 'Why do ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲמֹד, וַיִּקְרָא אֶל-מַעַרְכֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַיֹּאמֶר לָהֶם, לָמָּה תֵצְאוּ לַעֲרֹךְ מִלְחָמָה: הֲלוֹא אָנֹכִי הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וְאַתֶּם עֲבָדִים לְשָׁאוּל--בְּרוּ-לָכֶם אִישׁ, וְיֵרֵד אֵלָי. | And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them: 'Why do ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me. | וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ אֶת-אָבִיךָ וְאֶת-אֲנָשָׁיו כִּי גִבֹּרִים הֵמָּה וּמָרֵי נֶפֶשׁ הֵמָּה, כְּדֹב שַׁכּוּל, בַּשָּׂדֶה; וְאָבִיךָ אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה, וְלֹא יָלִין אֶת-הָעָם. | Hushai said moreover: 'Thou knowest thy father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are embittered in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field; and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.

text_he: אם-יוכל להלחם אתי והכני--והינו לכם לעבדים ואם-אני אוכל-לו והכיתיו--והיתם לנו לעבדים ועבדתם אתנו | If he be able to fight with me and kill me then will we be your servants but if I prevail against him and kill him then shall ye be our servants and serve us' | הנה עתה הוא-נחבא באחת הפחתים או באחד המקומת והיה כנפל בהם בתחלה ושמע השמע ואמר היתה מגפה בעם אשר אחרי אבשלם | Behold he is hid now in some pit or in some place and it will come to pass when they fall upon them at the first and whosoever heareth it shall say There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom
text_en: If he be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.'
text_pisuk: אִם-יוּכַל לְהִלָּחֵם אִתִּי, וְהִכָּנִי--וְהָיִינוּ לָכֶם, לַעֲבָדִים; וְאִם-אֲנִי אוּכַל-לוֹ, וְהִכִּיתִיו--וִהְיִיתֶם לָנוּ לַעֲבָדִים, וַעֲבַדְתֶּם אֹתָנוּ. | If he be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.' | הִנֵּה עַתָּה הוּא-נֶחְבָּא בְּאַחַת הַפְּחָתִים, אוֹ בְּאַחַד הַמְּקוֹמֹת; וְהָיָה, כִּנְפֹל בָּהֶם בַּתְּחִלָּה, וְשָׁמַע הַשֹּׁמֵעַ וְאָמַר, הָיְתָה מַגֵּפָה בָּעָם אֲשֶׁר אַחֲרֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם. | Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some place; and it will come to pass, when they fall upon them at the first, and whosoever heareth it shall say: There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom;

text_he: ויאמר הפלשתי אני חרפתי את-מערכות ישראל היום הזה תנו-לי איש ונלחמה יחד | And the Philistine said 'I do taunt the armies of Israel this day give me a man that we may fight together' | והוא גם-בן-חיל אשר לבו כלב האריה--המס ימס כי-ידע כל-ישראל כי-גבור אביך ובני-חיל אשר אתו | then even he that is valiant whose heart is as the heart of a lion will utterly melt for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man and they that are with him are valiant men
text_en: And the Philistine said: 'I do taunt the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר, הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אֲנִי חֵרַפְתִּי אֶת-מַעַרְכוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה; תְּנוּ-לִי אִישׁ, וְנִלָּחֲמָה יָחַד. | And the Philistine said: 'I do taunt the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.' | וְהוּא גַם-בֶּן-חַיִל, אֲשֶׁר לִבּוֹ כְּלֵב הָאַרְיֵה--הִמֵּס יִמָּס: כִּי-יֹדֵעַ כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי-גִבּוֹר אָבִיךָ, וּבְנֵי-חַיִל אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ. | then even he that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt; for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they that are with him are valiant men.

text_he: וישמע שאול וכל-ישראל את-דברי הפלשתי האלה ויחתו ויראו מאד | And when Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine they were dismayed and greatly afraid | כי יעצתי האסף יאסף עליך כל-ישראל מדן ועד-באר שבע כחול אשר-על-הים לרב ופניך הלכים בקרב | But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together unto thee from Dan even to Beer-sheba as the sand that is by the sea for multitude and that thou go to battle in thine own person
text_en: And when Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁמַע שָׁאוּל וְכָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֶת-דִּבְרֵי הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הָאֵלֶּה; וַיֵּחַתּוּ וַיִּרְאוּ, מְאֹד. | And when Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid. | כִּי יָעַצְתִּי, הֵאָסֹף יֵאָסֵף עָלֶיךָ כָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל מִדָּן וְעַד-בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע, כַּחוֹל אֲשֶׁר-עַל-הַיָּם, לָרֹב; וּפָנֶיךָ הֹלְכִים, בַּקְרָב. | But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together unto thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person.

text_he: ודוד בן-איש אפרתי הזה מבית לחם יהודה ושמו ישי ולו שמנה בנים והאיש בימי שאול זקן בא באנשים | Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem in Judah whose name was Jesse and he had eight sons and the man was an old man in the days of Saul stricken in years among men | ובאנו אליו באחת (באחד) המקומת אשר נמצא שם ונחנו עליו כאשר יפל הטל על-האדמה ולא-נותר בו ובכל-האנשים אשר-אתו גם-אחד | So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground and of him and of all the men that are with him we will not leave so much as one
text_en: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem in Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons; and the man was an old man in the days of Saul, stricken in years among men.
text_pisuk: וְדָוִד בֶּן-אִישׁ אֶפְרָתִי הַזֶּה, מִבֵּית לֶחֶם יְהוּדָה, וּשְׁמוֹ יִשַׁי, וְלוֹ שְׁמֹנָה בָנִים; וְהָאִישׁ בִּימֵי שָׁאוּל, זָקֵן בָּא בַאֲנָשִׁים. | Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem in Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons; and the man was an old man in the days of Saul, stricken in years among men. | וּבָאנוּ אֵלָיו, באחת (בְּאַחַד) הַמְּקוֹמֹת אֲשֶׁר נִמְצָא שָׁם, וְנַחְנוּ עָלָיו, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִפֹּל הַטַּל עַל-הָאֲדָמָה; וְלֹא-נוֹתַר בּוֹ וּבְכָל-הָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, גַּם-אֶחָד. | So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground; and of him and of all the men that are with him we will not leave so much as one.

text_he: וילכו שלשת בני-ישי הגדלים--הלכו אחרי-שאול למלחמה ושם שלשת בניו אשר הלכו במלחמה--אליאב הבכור ומשנהו אבינדב והשלשי שמה | And the three eldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born and next unto him Abinadab and the third Shammah | ואם-אל-עיר יאסף--והשיאו כל-ישראל אל-העיר היא חבלים וסחבנו אתו עד-הנחל עד אשר-לא-נמצא שם גם-צרור | Moreover if he withdraw himself into a city then shall all Israel bring up ropes to that city and we will draw it into the valley until there be not one small stone found there'
text_en: And the three eldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle; and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
