text_pisuk: וַיֵּלְכוּ שְׁלֹשֶׁת בְּנֵי-יִשַׁי, הַגְּדֹלִים--הָלְכוּ אַחֲרֵי-שָׁאוּל, לַמִּלְחָמָה; וְשֵׁם שְׁלֹשֶׁת בָּנָיו, אֲשֶׁר הָלְכוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָה--אֱלִיאָב הַבְּכוֹר וּמִשְׁנֵהוּ אֲבִינָדָב, וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁי שַׁמָּה. | And the three eldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle; and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah. | וְאִם-אֶל-עִיר, יֵאָסֵף--וְהִשִּׂיאוּ כָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל-הָעִיר הַהִיא, חֲבָלִים; וְסָחַבְנוּ אֹתוֹ עַד-הַנַּחַל, עַד אֲשֶׁר-לֹא-נִמְצָא שָׁם גַּם-צְרוֹר. | Moreover, if he withdraw himself into a city, then shall all Israel bring up ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the valley until there be not one small stone found there.'

text_he: ודוד הוא הקטן ושלשה הגדלים הלכו אחרי שאול | And David was the youngest and the three eldest followed Saul--{S} | ויאמר אבשלום וכל-איש ישראל טובה עצת חושי הארכי מעצת אחיתפל ויהוה צוה להפר את-עצת אחיתפל הטובה לבעבור הביא יהוה אל-אבשלום את-הרעה | And Absalom and all the men of Israel said 'The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel'{S}--For the LORD had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom{S}
text_en: And David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.--{S}
text_pisuk: וְדָוִד, הוּא הַקָּטָן; וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, הַגְּדֹלִים, הָלְכוּ, אַחֲרֵי שָׁאוּל. | And David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.--{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, טוֹבָה עֲצַת חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי, מֵעֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל;  וַיהוָה צִוָּה, לְהָפֵר אֶת-עֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל הַטּוֹבָה, לְבַעֲבוּר הָבִיא יְהוָה אֶל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אֶת-הָרָעָה. | And Absalom and all the men of Israel said: 'The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel.'{S}--For the LORD had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom.{S}

text_he: ודוד הלך ושב מעל שאול לרעות את-צאן אביו בית-לחם | Now David went to and fro from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Beth-lehem-- | ויאמר חושי אל-צדוק ואל-אביתר הכהנים כזאת וכזאת יעץ אחיתפל את-אבשלם ואת זקני ישראל וכזאת וכזאת יעצתי אני | Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests 'Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel and thus and thus have I counselled
text_en: Now David went to and fro from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Beth-lehem.--
text_pisuk: וְדָוִד הֹלֵךְ וָשָׁב, מֵעַל שָׁאוּל, לִרְעוֹת אֶת-צֹאן אָבִיו, בֵּית-לָחֶם. | Now David went to and fro from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Beth-lehem.-- | וַיֹּאמֶר חוּשַׁי, אֶל-צָדוֹק וְאֶל-אֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֲנִים, כָּזֹאת וְכָזֹאת יָעַץ אֲחִיתֹפֶל אֶת-אַבְשָׁלֹם, וְאֵת זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְכָזֹאת וְכָזֹאת, יָעַצְתִּי אָנִי. | Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests: 'Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled.

text_he: ויגש הפלשתי השכם והערב ויתיצב ארבעים יום | And the Philistine drew near morning and evening and presented himself forty days | ועתה שלחו מהרה והגידו לדוד לאמר אל-תלן הלילה בערבות המדבר וגם עבור תעבור--פן יבלע למלך ולכל-העם אשר אתו | Now therefore send quickly and tell David saying Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness but in any wise pass over lest the king be swallowed up and all the people that are with him'
text_en: And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
text_pisuk: וַיִּגַּשׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, הַשְׁכֵּם וְהַעֲרֵב; וַיִּתְיַצֵּב, אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם. | And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days. | וְעַתָּה שִׁלְחוּ מְהֵרָה וְהַגִּידוּ לְדָוִד לֵאמֹר, אַל-תָּלֶן הַלַּיְלָה בְּעַרְבוֹת הַמִּדְבָּר, וְגַם, עָבוֹר תַּעֲבוֹר--פֶּן יְבֻלַּע לַמֶּלֶךְ, וּלְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ. | Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying: Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but in any wise pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.'

text_he: ויאמר ישי לדוד בנו קח-נא לאחיך איפת הקליא הזה ועשרה לחם הזה והרץ המחנה לאחיך | And Jesse said unto David his son 'Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn and these ten loaves and carry them quickly to the camp to thy brethren | ויהונתן ואחימעץ עמדים בעין-רגל והלכה השפחה והגידה להם והם ילכו והגידו למלך דוד כי לא יוכלו להראות לבוא העירה | Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by En-rogel and a maid-servant used to go and tell them and they went and told king David for they might not be seen to come into the city
text_en: And Jesse said unto David his son: 'Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to thy brethren.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יִשַׁי לְדָוִד בְּנוֹ, קַח-נָא לְאַחֶיךָ אֵיפַת הַקָּלִיא הַזֶּה, וַעֲשָׂרָה לֶחֶם, הַזֶּה; וְהָרֵץ הַמַּחֲנֶה, לְאַחֶיךָ. | And Jesse said unto David his son: 'Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to thy brethren. | וִיהוֹנָתָן וַאֲחִימַעַץ עֹמְדִים בְּעֵין-רֹגֵל, וְהָלְכָה הַשִּׁפְחָה וְהִגִּידָה לָהֶם, וְהֵם יֵלְכוּ, וְהִגִּידוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד: כִּי לֹא יוּכְלוּ לְהֵרָאוֹת, לָבוֹא הָעִירָה. | Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by En-rogel; and a maid-servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told king David; for they might not be seen to come into the city.

text_he: ואת עשרת חרצי החלב האלה תביא לשר-האלף ואת-אחיך תפקד לשלום ואת-ערבתם תקח | And bring these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand and to thy brethren shalt thou bring greetings and take their pledge | וירא אתם נער ויגד לאבשלם וילכו שניהם מהרה ויבאו אל-בית-איש בחורים ולו באר בחצרו--וירדו שם | But a lad saw them and told Absalom and they went both of them away quickly and came to the house of a man in Bahurim who had a well in his court and they went down thither
text_en: And bring these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and to thy brethren shalt thou bring greetings, and take their pledge;
text_pisuk: וְאֵת עֲשֶׂרֶת חֲרִצֵי הֶחָלָב, הָאֵלֶּה, תָּבִיא, לְשַׂר-הָאָלֶף; וְאֶת-אַחֶיךָ תִּפְקֹד לְשָׁלוֹם, וְאֶת-עֲרֻבָּתָם תִּקָּח. | And bring these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and to thy brethren shalt thou bring greetings, and take their pledge; | וַיַּרְא אֹתָם נַעַר, וַיַּגֵּד לְאַבְשָׁלֹם; וַיֵּלְכוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מְהֵרָה וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶל-בֵּית-אִישׁ בְּבַחוּרִים, וְלוֹ בְאֵר בַּחֲצֵרוֹ--וַיֵּרְדוּ שָׁם. | But a lad saw them, and told Absalom; and they went both of them away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; and they went down thither.

text_he: ושאול והמה וכל-איש ישראל בעמק האלה נלחמים עם-פלשתים | now Saul and they and all the men of Israel are in the vale of Elah fighting with the Philistines'{S} | ותקח האשה ותפרש את-המסך על-פני הבאר ותשטח עליו הרפות ולא נודע דבר | And the woman took and spread the covering over the well's mouth and strewed groats thereon and nothing was known
text_en: now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, are in the vale of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְשָׁאוּל וְהֵמָּה וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּעֵמֶק הָאֵלָה; נִלְחָמִים, עִם-פְּלִשְׁתִּים. | now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, are in the vale of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.'{S} | וַתִּקַּח הָאִשָּׁה, וַתִּפְרֹשׂ אֶת-הַמָּסָךְ עַל-פְּנֵי הַבְּאֵר, וַתִּשְׁטַח עָלָיו, הָרִפוֹת; וְלֹא נוֹדַע, דָּבָר. | And the woman took and spread the covering over the well's mouth, and strewed groats thereon; and nothing was known.

text_he: וישכם דוד בקר ויטש את-הצאן על-שמר וישא וילך כאשר צוהו ישי ויבא המעגלה והחיל היצא אל-המערכה והרעו במלחמה | And David rose up early in the morning and left the sheep with a keeper and took and went as Jesse had commanded him and he came to the barricade as the host which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle | ויבאו עבדי אבשלום אל-האשה הביתה ויאמרו איה אחימעץ ויהונתן ותאמר להם האשה עברו מיכל המים ויבקשו ולא מצאו וישבו ירושלם | And Absalom's servants came to the woman to the house and they said 'Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan' And the woman said unto them 'They are gone over the brook of water' And when they had sought and could not find them they returned to Jerusalem{S}
text_en: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the barricade, as the host which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle.
text_pisuk: וַיַּשְׁכֵּם דָּוִד בַּבֹּקֶר, וַיִּטֹּשׁ אֶת-הַצֹּאן עַל-שֹׁמֵר, וַיִּשָּׂא וַיֵּלֶךְ, כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּהוּ יִשָׁי; וַיָּבֹא, הַמַּעְגָּלָה, וְהַחַיִל הַיֹּצֵא אֶל-הַמַּעֲרָכָה, וְהֵרֵעוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָה. | And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the barricade, as the host which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle. | וַיָּבֹאוּ עַבְדֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל-הָאִשָּׁה הַבַּיְתָה, וַיֹּאמְרוּ אַיֵּה אֲחִימַעַץ וִיהוֹנָתָן, וַתֹּאמֶר לָהֶם הָאִשָּׁה, עָבְרוּ מִיכַל הַמָּיִם; וַיְבַקְשׁוּ וְלֹא מָצָאוּ, וַיָּשֻׁבוּ יְרוּשָׁלִָם. | And Absalom's servants came to the woman to the house; and they said: 'Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?' And the woman said unto them: 'They are gone over the brook of water.' And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.{S}

text_he: ותערך ישראל ופלשתים מערכה לקראת מערכה | And Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array army against army | ויהי אחרי לכתם ויעלו מהבאר וילכו ויגדו למלך דוד ויאמרו אל-דוד קומו ועברו מהרה את-המים--כי-כה יעץ עליכם אחיתפל | And it came to pass after they were departed that they came up out of the well and went and told king David and they said unto David 'Arise ye and pass quickly over the water for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you'
text_en: And Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.
text_pisuk: וַתַּעֲרֹךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפְלִשְׁתִּים, מַעֲרָכָה לִקְרַאת מַעֲרָכָה. | And Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army. | וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי לֶכְתָּם, וַיַּעֲלוּ מֵהַבְּאֵר, וַיֵּלְכוּ, וַיַּגִּדוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד; וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֶל-דָּוִד, קוּמוּ וְעִבְרוּ מְהֵרָה אֶת-הַמַּיִם--כִּי-כָכָה יָעַץ עֲלֵיכֶם, אֲחִיתֹפֶל. | And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David; and they said unto David: 'Arise ye, and pass quickly over the water; for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.'

text_he: ויטש דוד את-הכלים מעליו על-יד שומר הכלים וירץ המערכה ויבא וישאל לאחיו לשלום | And David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage and ran to the army and came and greeted his brethren | ויקם דוד וכל-העם אשר אתו ויעברו את-הירדן עד-אור הבקר עד-אחד לא נעדר אשר לא-עבר את-הירדן | Then David arose and all the people that were with him and they passed over the Jordan by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over the Jordan
text_en: And David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brethren.
text_pisuk: וַיִּטֹּשׁ דָּוִד אֶת-הַכֵּלִים מֵעָלָיו, עַל-יַד שׁוֹמֵר הַכֵּלִים, וַיָּרָץ, הַמַּעֲרָכָה; וַיָּבֹא, וַיִּשְׁאַל לְאֶחָיו לְשָׁלוֹם. | And David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brethren. | וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ, וַיַּעַבְרוּ, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן: עַד-אוֹר הַבֹּקֶר, עַד-אַחַד לֹא נֶעְדָּר, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-עָבַר, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן. | Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over the Jordan; by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over the Jordan.

text_he: והוא מדבר עמם והנה איש הבנים עולה גלית הפלשתי שמו מגת מערות (מערכות) פלשתים וידבר כדברים האלה וישמע דוד | And as he talked with them behold there came up the champion the Philistine of Gath Goliath by name out of the ranks of the Philistines and spoke according to the same words and David heard them | ואחיתפל ראה כי לא נעשתה עצתו ויחבש את-החמור ויקם וילך אל-ביתו אל-עירו ויצו אל-ביתו ויחנק וימת ויקבר בקבר אביו | And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed he saddled his ass and arose and got him home unto his city and set his house in order and strangled himself and he died and was buried in the sepulchre of his father{S}
text_en: And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the ranks of the Philistines, and spoke according to the same words; and David heard them.
text_pisuk: וְהוּא מְדַבֵּר עִמָּם, וְהִנֵּה אִישׁ הַבֵּנַיִם עוֹלֶה גָּלְיָת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי שְׁמוֹ מִגַּת ממערות (מִמַּעַרְכוֹת) פְּלִשְׁתִּים, וַיְדַבֵּר, כַּדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה; וַיִּשְׁמַע, דָּוִד. | And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the ranks of the Philistines, and spoke according to the same words; and David heard them. | וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל רָאָה, כִּי לֹא נֶעֶשְׂתָה עֲצָתוֹ, וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת-הַחֲמוֹר וַיָּקָם וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ אֶל-עִירוֹ, וַיְצַו אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ וַיֵּחָנַק; וַיָּמָת, וַיִּקָּבֵר בְּקֶבֶר אָבִיו. | And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and got him home, unto his city, and set his house in order, and strangled himself; and he died, and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.{S}

text_he: וכל איש ישראל בראותם את-האיש וינסו מפניו ויראו מאד | And all the men of Israel when they saw the man fled from him and were sore afraid | ודוד בא מחנימה ואבשלם עבר את-הירדן--הוא וכל-איש ישראל עמו | When David was come to Mahanaim Absalom passed over the Jordan he and all the men of Israel with him
text_en: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.
text_pisuk: וְכֹל אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בִּרְאוֹתָם אֶת-הָאִישׁ; וַיָּנֻסוּ, מִפָּנָיו, וַיִּירְאוּ, מְאֹד. | And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid. | וְדָוִד, בָּא מַחֲנָיְמָה; וְאַבְשָׁלֹם, עָבַר אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן--הוּא, וְכָל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ. | When David was come to Mahanaim, Absalom passed over the Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.

text_he: ויאמר איש ישראל הראיתם האיש העלה הזה--כי לחרף את-ישראל עלה והיה האיש אשר-יכנו יעשרנו המלך עשר גדול ואת-בתו יתן-לו ואת בית אביו יעשה חפשי בישראל | And the men of Israel said 'Have ye seen this man that is come up surely to taunt Israel is he come up and it shall be that the man who killeth him the king will enrich him with great riches and will give him his daughter and make his father's house free in Israel' | ואת-עמשא שם אבשלם תחת יואב--על-הצבא ועמשא בן-איש ושמו יתרא הישראלי אשר-בא אל-אביגל בת-נחש אחות צרויה אם יואב | And Absalom had set Amasa over the host instead of Joab Now Amasa was the son of a man whose name was Ithra the Jesraelite that went in to Abigal the daughter of Nahash sister to Zeruiah Joab's mother
text_en: And the men of Israel said: 'Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to taunt Israel is he come up; and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father's house free in Israel.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַרְּאִיתֶם הָאִישׁ הָעֹלֶה הַזֶּה--כִּי לְחָרֵף אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל, עֹלֶה; וְהָיָה הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר-יַכֶּנּוּ יַעְשְׁרֶנּוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ עֹשֶׁר גָּדוֹל, וְאֶת-בִּתּוֹ יִתֶּן-לוֹ, וְאֵת בֵּית אָבִיו, יַעֲשֶׂה חָפְשִׁי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. | And the men of Israel said: 'Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to taunt Israel is he come up; and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father's house free in Israel.' | וְאֶת-עֲמָשָׂא, שָׂם אַבְשָׁלֹם תַּחַת יוֹאָב--עַל-הַצָּבָא; וַעֲמָשָׂא בֶן-אִישׁ, וּשְׁמוֹ יִתְרָא הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִי, אֲשֶׁר-בָּא אֶל-אֲבִיגַל בַּת-נָחָשׁ, אֲחוֹת צְרוּיָה אֵם יוֹאָב. | And Absalom had set Amasa over the host instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Ithra the Jesraelite, that went in to Abigal the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab's mother.

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-האנשים העמדים עמו לאמר מה-יעשה לאיש אשר יכה את-הפלשתי הלז והסיר חרפה מעל ישראל כי מי הפלשתי הערל הזה כי חרף מערכות אלהים חים | And David spoke to the men that stood by him saying 'What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine and taketh away the taunt from Israel for who is this uncircumcised Philistine that he should have taunted the armies of the living God' | ויחן ישראל ואבשלם ארץ הגלעד | And Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead{S}
text_en: And David spoke to the men that stood by him, saying: 'What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the taunt from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should have taunted the armies of the living God?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, אֶל-הָאֲנָשִׁים הָעֹמְדִים עִמּוֹ לֵאמֹר, מַה-יֵּעָשֶׂה לָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַכֶּה אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הַלָּז, וְהֵסִיר חֶרְפָּה מֵעַל יִשְׂרָאֵל: כִּי מִי, הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הֶעָרֵל הַזֶּה, כִּי חֵרֵף, מַעַרְכוֹת אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים. | And David spoke to the men that stood by him, saying: 'What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the taunt from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should have taunted the armies of the living God?' | וַיִּחַן יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאַבְשָׁלֹם, אֶרֶץ הַגִּלְעָד. | And Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead.{S}

text_he: ויאמר לו העם כדבר הזה לאמר כה יעשה לאיש אשר יכנו | And the people answered him after this manner saying 'So shall it be done to the man that killeth him' | ויהי כבוא דוד מחנימה ושבי בן-נחש מרבת בני-עמון ומכיר בן-עמיאל מלא דבר וברזלי הגלעדי מרגלים | And it came to pass when David was come to Mahanaim that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim
text_en: And the people answered him after this manner, saying: 'So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ הָעָם, כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה לֵאמֹר: כֹּה יֵעָשֶׂה, לָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַכֶּנּוּ. | And the people answered him after this manner, saying: 'So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.' | וַיְהִי, כְּבוֹא דָוִד מַחֲנָיְמָה; וְשֹׁבִי בֶן-נָחָשׁ מֵרַבַּת בְּנֵי-עַמּוֹן, וּמָכִיר בֶּן-עַמִּיאֵל מִלֹּא דְבָר, וּבַרְזִלַּי הַגִּלְעָדִי, מֵרֹגְלִים. | And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,

text_he: וישמע אליאב אחיו הגדול בדברו אל-האנשים ויחר-אף אליאב בדוד ויאמר למה-זה ירדת ועל-מי נטשת מעט הצאן הנה במדבר--אני ידעתי את-זדנך ואת רע לבך כי למען ראות המלחמה ירדת | And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke unto the men and Eliab's anger was kindled against David and he said 'Why art thou come down and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness I know thy presumptuousness and the naughtiness of thy heart for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle' | משכב וספות וכלי יוצר וחטים ושערים וקמח וקלי ופול ועדשים וקלי | brought beds and basins and earthen vessels and wheat and barley and meal and parched corn and beans and lentils and parched pulse
text_en: And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke unto the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said: 'Why art thou come down? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy presumptuousness, and the naughtiness of thy heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁמַע אֱלִיאָב אָחִיו הַגָּדוֹל, בְּדַבְּרוֹ אֶל-הָאֲנָשִׁים; וַיִּחַר-אַף אֱלִיאָב בְּדָוִד וַיֹּאמֶר לָמָּה-זֶּה יָרַדְתָּ, וְעַל-מִי נָטַשְׁתָּ מְעַט הַצֹּאן הָהֵנָּה בַּמִּדְבָּר--אֲנִי יָדַעְתִּי אֶת-זְדֹנְךָ וְאֵת רֹעַ לְבָבֶךָ, כִּי לְמַעַן רְאוֹת הַמִּלְחָמָה יָרָדְתָּ. | And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke unto the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said: 'Why art thou come down? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy presumptuousness, and the naughtiness of thy heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.' | מִשְׁכָּב וְסַפּוֹת וּכְלִי יוֹצֵר, וְחִטִּים וּשְׂעֹרִים וְקֶמַח וְקָלִי, וּפוֹל וַעֲדָשִׁים, וְקָלִי. | brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and meal, and parched corn, and beans, and lentils, and parched pulse,

text_he: ויאמר דוד מה עשיתי עתה הלוא דבר הוא | And David said 'What have I now done Was it not but a word' | ודבש וחמאה וצאן ושפות בקר הגישו לדוד ולעם אשר-אתו לאכול כי אמרו--העם רעב ועיף וצמא במדבר | and honey and curd and sheep and cheese of kine for David and for the people that were with him to eat for they said 'The people is hungry and faint and thirsty in the wilderness'{S}
text_en: And David said: 'What have I now done? Was it not but a word?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, מֶה עָשִׂיתִי עָתָּה; הֲלוֹא, דָּבָר הוּא. | And David said: 'What have I now done? Was it not but a word?' | וּדְבַשׁ וְחֶמְאָה, וְצֹאן וּשְׁפוֹת בָּקָר, הִגִּישׁוּ לְדָוִד וְלָעָם אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, לֶאֱכוֹל: כִּי אָמְרוּ--הָעָם רָעֵב וְעָיֵף וְצָמֵא, בַּמִּדְבָּר. | and honey, and curd, and sheep, and cheese of kine, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat; for they said: 'The people is hungry, and faint, and thirsty, in the wilderness.'{S}

text_he: ויסב מאצלו אל-מול אחר ויאמר כדבר הזה וישבהו העם דבר כדבר הראשון
text_en: And he turned away from him toward another, and spoke after the same manner; and the people answered him after the former manner.
text_pisuk: וַיִּסֹּב מֵאֶצְלוֹ אֶל-מוּל אַחֵר, וַיֹּאמֶר כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה; וַיְשִׁבֻהוּ הָעָם דָּבָר, כַּדָּבָר הָרִאשׁוֹן.

text_he: וישמעו הדברים אשר דבר דוד ויגדו לפני-שאול ויקחהו
text_en: And when the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he was taken to him.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשָּׁמְעוּ, הַדְּבָרִים, אֲשֶׁר, דִּבֶּר דָּוִד; וַיַּגִּדוּ לִפְנֵי-שָׁאוּל, וַיִּקָּחֵהוּ.

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-שאול אל-יפל לב-אדם עליו עבדך ילך ונלחם עם-הפלשתי הזה
text_en: And David said to Saul: 'Let no man's heart fail within him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל, אַל-יִפֹּל לֵב-אָדָם עָלָיו; עַבְדְּךָ יֵלֵךְ, וְנִלְחַם עִם-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הַזֶּה.

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-דוד לא תוכל לכת אל-הפלשתי הזה להלחם עמו כי-נער אתה והוא איש מלחמה מנעריו
text_en: And Saul said to David: 'Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-דָּוִד, לֹא תוּכַל לָלֶכֶת אֶל-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הַזֶּה, לְהִלָּחֵם, עִמּוֹ: כִּי-נַעַר אַתָּה, וְהוּא אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה מִנְּעֻרָיו.

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-שאול רעה היה עבדך לאביו בצאן ובא הארי ואת-הדוב ונשא שה מהעדר
text_en: And David said unto Saul: 'Thy servant kept his father's sheep; and when there came a lion, or a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock,
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל, רֹעֶה הָיָה עַבְדְּךָ לְאָבִיו בַּצֹּאן; וּבָא הָאֲרִי וְאֶת-הַדּוֹב, וְנָשָׂא שֶׂה מֵהָעֵדֶר.

text_he: ויצאתי אחריו והכתיו והצלתי מפיו ויקם עלי--והחזקתי בזקנו והכתיו והמיתיו
text_en: I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth; and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.
text_pisuk: וְיָצָאתִי אַחֲרָיו וְהִכִּתִיו, וְהִצַּלְתִּי מִפִּיו; וַיָּקָם עָלַי--וְהֶחֱזַקְתִּי בִּזְקָנוֹ, וְהִכִּתִיו וַהֲמִיתִּיו.

text_he: גם את-הארי גם-הדב הכה עבדך והיה הפלשתי הערל הזה כאחד מהם כי חרף מערכת אלהים חים
text_en: Thy servant smote both the lion and the bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath taunted the armies of the living God.'{S}
text_pisuk: גַּם אֶת-הָאֲרִי גַּם-הַדֹּב, הִכָּה עַבְדֶּךָ; וְהָיָה הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הֶעָרֵל הַזֶּה, כְּאַחַד מֵהֶם, כִּי חֵרֵף, מַעַרְכֹת אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים.

text_he: ויאמר דוד יהוה אשר הצלני מיד הארי ומיד הדב הוא יצילני מיד הפלשתי הזה ויאמר שאול אל-דוד לך ויהוה יהיה עמך
text_en: And David said: 'The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, He will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.'{S}And Saul said unto David: 'Go, and the LORD shall be with thee.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר, דָּוִד, יְהוָה אֲשֶׁר הִצִּלַנִי מִיַּד הָאֲרִי וּמִיַּד הַדֹּב, הוּא יַצִּילֵנִי מִיַּד הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הַזֶּה;  וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-דָּוִד לֵךְ, וַיהוָה יִהְיֶה עִמָּךְ.

text_he: וילבש שאול את-דוד מדיו ונתן קובע נחשת על-ראשו וילבש אתו שריון
text_en: And Saul clad David with his apparel, and he put a helmet of brass upon his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.
text_pisuk: וַיַּלְבֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל אֶת-דָּוִד מַדָּיו, וְנָתַן קוֹבַע נְחֹשֶׁת עַל-רֹאשׁוֹ; וַיַּלְבֵּשׁ אֹתוֹ, שִׁרְיוֹן.

text_he: ויחגר דוד את-חרבו מעל למדיו ויאל לכת כי לא-נסה ויאמר דוד אל-שאול לא אוכל לכת באלה כי לא נסיתי ויסרם דוד מעליו
text_en: And David girded his sword upon his apparel, and he essayed to go; for he had not tried it. And David said unto Saul: 'I cannot go with these; for I have not tried them.' And David put them off him.
text_pisuk: וַיַּחְגֹּר דָּוִד אֶת-חַרְבּוֹ מֵעַל לְמַדָּיו וַיֹּאֶל לָלֶכֶת, כִּי לֹא-נִסָּה, וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל לֹא אוּכַל לָלֶכֶת בָּאֵלֶּה, כִּי לֹא נִסִּיתִי; וַיְסִרֵם דָּוִד, מֵעָלָיו.

text_he: ויקח מקלו בידו ויבחר-לו חמשה חלקי-אבנים מן-הנחל וישם אתם בכלי הרעים אשר-לו ובילקוט--וקלעו בידו ויגש אל-הפלשתי
text_en: And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the shepherd's bag which he had, even in his scrip; and his sling was in his hand; and he drew near to the Philistine.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח מַקְלוֹ בְּיָדוֹ, וַיִּבְחַר-לוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה חַלֻּקֵי-אֲבָנִים מִן-הַנַּחַל וַיָּשֶׂם אֹתָם בִּכְלִי הָרֹעִים אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ וּבַיַּלְקוּט--וְקַלְעוֹ בְיָדוֹ; וַיִּגַּשׁ, אֶל-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי.

text_he: וילך הפלשתי הלך וקרב אל-דוד והאיש נשא הצנה לפניו
text_en: And the Philistine came nearer and nearer unto David; and the man that bore the shield went before him.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ, הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, הֹלֵךְ וְקָרֵב, אֶל-דָּוִד; וְהָאִישׁ נֹשֵׂא הַצִּנָּה, לְפָנָיו.

text_he: ויבט הפלשתי ויראה את-דוד ויבזהו כי-היה נער ואדמני עם-יפה מראה
text_en: And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and withal of a fair countenance.
text_pisuk: וַיַּבֵּט הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וַיִּרְאֶה אֶת-דָּוִד, וַיִּבְזֵהוּ: כִּי-הָיָה נַעַר, וְאַדְמֹנִי עִם-יְפֵה מַרְאֶה.

text_he: ויאמר הפלשתי אל-דוד הכלב אנכי כי-אתה בא-אלי במקלות ויקל הפלשתי את-דוד באלהיו
text_en: And the Philistine said unto David: 'Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves?' And the Philistine cursed David by his god.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אֶל-דָּוִד, הֲכֶלֶב אָנֹכִי, כִּי-אַתָּה בָא-אֵלַי בַּמַּקְלוֹת; וַיְקַלֵּל הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי אֶת-דָּוִד, בֵּאלֹהָיו.

text_he: ויאמר הפלשתי אל-דוד לכה אלי--ואתנה את-בשרך לעוף השמים ולבהמת השדה
text_en: And the Philistine said to David: 'Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אֶל-דָּוִד: לְכָה אֵלַי--וְאֶתְּנָה אֶת-בְּשָׂרְךָ, לְעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם וּלְבֶהֱמַת הַשָּׂדֶה.

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-הפלשתי אתה בא אלי בחרב ובחנית ובכידון ואנכי בא-אליך בשם יהוה צבאות אלהי מערכות ישראל אשר חרפת
text_en: Then said David to the Philistine: 'Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a javelin; but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast taunted.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, אֶל-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אַתָּה בָּא אֵלַי, בְּחֶרֶב וּבַחֲנִית וּבְכִידוֹן; וְאָנֹכִי בָא-אֵלֶיךָ, בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת, אֱלֹהֵי מַעַרְכוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲשֶׁר חֵרַפְתָּ.

text_he: היום הזה יסגרך יהוה בידי והכיתך והסרתי את-ראשך מעליך ונתי פגר מחנה פלשתים היום הזה לעוף השמים ולחית הארץ וידעו כל-הארץ כי יש אלהים לישראל
text_en: This day will the LORD deliver thee into my hand; and I will smite thee, and take thy head from off thee; and I will give the carcasses of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel;
text_pisuk: הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְסַגֶּרְךָ יְהוָה בְּיָדִי וְהִכִּיתִךָ, וַהֲסִרֹתִי אֶת-רֹאשְׁךָ מֵעָלֶיךָ, וְנָתַתִּי פֶּגֶר מַחֲנֵה פְלִשְׁתִּים הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, לְעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם וּלְחַיַּת הָאָרֶץ; וְיֵדְעוּ, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ, כִּי יֵשׁ אֱלֹהִים, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.

text_he: וידעו כל-הקהל הזה כי-לא בחרב ובחנית יהושיע יהוה כי ליהוה המלחמה ונתן אתכם בידנו
text_en: and that all this assembly may know that the LORD saveth not with sword and spear; for the battle is the LORD'S, and He will give you into our hand.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְיֵדְעוּ כָּל-הַקָּהָל הַזֶּה, כִּי-לֹא בְּחֶרֶב וּבַחֲנִית יְהוֹשִׁיעַ יְהוָה: כִּי לַיהוָה הַמִּלְחָמָה, וְנָתַן אֶתְכֶם בְּיָדֵנוּ.

text_he: והיה כי-קם הפלשתי וילך ויקרב לקראת דוד וימהר דוד וירץ המערכה לקראת הפלשתי
text_en: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
text_pisuk: וְהָיָה כִּי-קָם הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּקְרַב לִקְרַאת דָּוִד; וַיְמַהֵר דָּוִד, וַיָּרָץ הַמַּעֲרָכָה לִקְרַאת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי.

text_he: וישלח דוד את-ידו אל-הכלי ויקח משם אבן ויקלע ויך את-הפלשתי אל-מצחו ותטבע האבן במצחו ויפל על-פניו ארצה
text_en: And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slung it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell upon his face to the earth.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח דָּוִד אֶת-יָדוֹ אֶל-הַכֶּלִי, וַיִּקַּח מִשָּׁם אֶבֶן וַיְקַלַּע, וַיַּךְ אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אֶל-מִצְחוֹ; וַתִּטְבַּע הָאֶבֶן בְּמִצְחוֹ, וַיִּפֹּל עַל-פָּנָיו אָרְצָה.

text_he: ויחזק דוד מן-הפלשתי בקלע ובאבן ויך את-הפלשתי וימתהו וחרב אין ביד-דוד
text_en: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
text_pisuk: וַיֶּחֱזַק דָּוִד מִן-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי בַּקֶּלַע וּבָאֶבֶן, וַיַּךְ אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וַיְמִתֵהוּ; וְחֶרֶב, אֵין בְּיַד-דָּוִד.

text_he: וירץ דוד ויעמד אל-הפלשתי ויקח את-חרבו וישלפה מתערה וימתהו ויכרת-בה את-ראשו ויראו הפלשתים כי-מת גבורם וינסו
text_en: And David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw that their mighty man was dead, they fled.
text_pisuk: וַיָּרָץ דָּוִד וַיַּעֲמֹד אֶל-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וַיִּקַּח אֶת-חַרְבּוֹ וַיִּשְׁלְפָהּ מִתַּעְרָהּ, וַיְמֹתְתֵהוּ, וַיִּכְרָת-בָּהּ, אֶת-רֹאשׁוֹ; וַיִּרְאוּ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּים כִּי-מֵת גִּבּוֹרָם, וַיָּנֻסוּ.

text_he: ויקמו אנשי ישראל ויהודה וירעו וירדפו את-הפלשתים עד-בואך גיא ועד שערי עקרון ויפלו חלי פלשתים בדרך שערים ועד-גת ועד-עקרון
text_en: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou comest to Gai, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקֻמוּ אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוּדָה וַיָּרִעוּ, וַיִּרְדְּפוּ אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּים, עַד-בּוֹאֲךָ גַיְא, וְעַד שַׁעֲרֵי עֶקְרוֹן; וַיִּפְּלוּ חַלְלֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים, בְּדֶרֶךְ שַׁעֲרַיִם, וְעַד-גַּת, וְעַד-עֶקְרוֹן.

text_he: וישבו בני ישראל מדלק אחרי פלשתים וישסו את-מחניהם
text_en: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their camp.
text_pisuk: וַיָּשֻׁבוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִדְּלֹק אַחֲרֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים; וַיָּשֹׁסּוּ, אֶת-מַחֲנֵיהֶם.

text_he: ויקח דוד את-ראש הפלשתי ויבאהו ירושלם ואת-כליו שם באהלו
text_en: And David took the head of the philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armour in his tent.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח דָּוִד אֶת-רֹאשׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וַיְבִאֵהוּ יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וְאֶת-כֵּלָיו, שָׂם בְּאָהֳלוֹ.

text_he: וכראות שאול את-דוד יצא לקראת הפלשתי אמר אל-אבנר שר הצבא בן-מי-זה הנער אבנר ויאמר אבנר חי-נפשך המלך אם-ידעתי
text_en: And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner, the captain of the host: 'Abner, whose son is this youth?' And Abner said: 'As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.'
text_pisuk: וְכִרְאוֹת שָׁאוּל אֶת-דָּוִד, יֹצֵא לִקְרַאת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, אָמַר אֶל-אַבְנֵר שַׂר הַצָּבָא, בֶּן-מִי-זֶה הַנַּעַר אַבְנֵר; וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְנֵר, חֵי-נַפְשְׁךָ הַמֶּלֶךְ אִם-יָדָעְתִּי.

text_he: ויאמר המלך שאל אתה בן-מי-זה העלם
text_en: And the king said: 'Inquire thou whose son the stripling is.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר, הַמֶּלֶךְ: שְׁאַל אַתָּה, בֶּן-מִי-זֶה הָעָלֶם.

text_he: וכשוב דוד מהכות את-הפלשתי ויקח אתו אבנר ויבאהו לפני שאול וראש הפלשתי בידו
text_en: And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
text_pisuk: וּכְשׁוּב דָּוִד, מֵהַכּוֹת אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וַיִּקַּח אֹתוֹ אַבְנֵר, וַיְבִאֵהוּ לִפְנֵי שָׁאוּל; וְרֹאשׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, בְּיָדוֹ.

text_he: ויאמר אליו שאול בן-מי אתה הנער ויאמר דוד בן-עבדך ישי בית הלחמי
text_en: And Saul said to him: 'Whose son art thou, thou young man?' And David answered: 'I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Beth-lehemite.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו שָׁאוּל, בֶּן-מִי אַתָּה הַנָּעַר; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, בֶּן-עַבְדְּךָ יִשַׁי בֵּית הַלַּחְמִי.

text_he: ויהי כלתו לדבר אל-שאול ונפש יהונתן נקשרה בנפש דוד ויאהבו (ויאהבהו) יהונתן כנפשו | And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David and Jonathan loved him as his own soul | ויפקד דוד את-העם אשר אתו וישם עליהם שרי אלפים ושרי מאות | And David numbered the people that were with him and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them
text_en: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, כְּכַלֹּתוֹ לְדַבֵּר אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וְנֶפֶשׁ יְהוֹנָתָן, נִקְשְׁרָה בְּנֶפֶשׁ דָּוִד; ויאהבו (וַיֶּאֱהָבֵהוּ) יְהוֹנָתָן, כְּנַפְשׁוֹ. | And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul. | וַיִּפְקֹד דָּוִד, אֶת-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ; וַיָּשֶׂם עֲלֵיהֶם, שָׂרֵי אֲלָפִים וְשָׂרֵי מֵאוֹת. | And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.

text_he: ויקחהו שאול ביום הוא ולא נתנו לשוב בית אביו | And Saul took him that day and would let him go no more home to his father's house | וישלח דוד את-העם השלשית ביד-יואב והשלשית ביד אבישי בן-צרויה אחי יואב והשלשת ביד אתי הגתי ויאמר המלך אל-העם יצא אצא גם-אני עמכם | And David sent forth the people a third part under the hand of Joab and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah Joab's brother and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite{S}And the king said unto the people 'I will surely go forth with you myself also'
text_en: And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father's house.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקָּחֵהוּ שָׁאוּל, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא; וְלֹא נְתָנוֹ, לָשׁוּב בֵּית אָבִיו. | And Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father's house. | וַיְשַׁלַּח דָּוִד אֶת-הָעָם, הַשְּׁלִשִׁית בְּיַד-יוֹאָב וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁית בְּיַד אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה אֲחִי יוֹאָב, וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁת, בְּיַד אִתַּי הַגִּתִּי;  וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-הָעָם, יָצֹא אֵצֵא גַּם-אֲנִי עִמָּכֶם. | And David sent forth the people, a third part under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite.{S}And the king said unto the people: 'I will surely go forth with you myself also.'

text_he: ויכרת יהונתן ודוד ברית באהבתו אתו כנפשו | Then Jonathan made a covenant with David because he loved him as his own soul | ויאמר העם לא תצא כי אם-נס נוס לא-ישימו אלינו לב ואם-ימתו חצינו לא-ישימו אלינו לב--כי-עתה כמנו עשרה אלפים ועתה טוב כי-תהיה-לנו מעיר לעזיר (לעזור) | But the people said 'Thou shalt not go forth for if we flee away they will not care for us neither if half of us die will they care for us but thou art worth ten thousand of us therefore now it is better that thou be ready to succour us out of the city'{S}
text_en: Then Jonathan made a covenant with David, because he loved him as his own soul.
text_pisuk: וַיִּכְרֹת יְהוֹנָתָן וְדָוִד, בְּרִית, בְּאַהֲבָתוֹ אֹתוֹ, כְּנַפְשׁוֹ. | Then Jonathan made a covenant with David, because he loved him as his own soul. | וַיֹּאמֶר הָעָם לֹא תֵצֵא, כִּי אִם-נֹס נָנוּס לֹא-יָשִׂימוּ אֵלֵינוּ לֵב וְאִם-יָמֻתוּ חֶצְיֵנוּ לֹא-יָשִׂימוּ אֵלֵינוּ לֵב--כִּי-עַתָּה כָמֹנוּ, עֲשָׂרָה אֲלָפִים; וְעַתָּה טוֹב, כִּי-תִהְיֶה-לָּנוּ מֵעִיר לעזיר (לַעְזוֹר). | But the people said: 'Thou shalt not go forth; for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us; but thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou be ready to succour us out of the city.'{S}

text_he: ויתפשט יהונתן את-המעיל אשר עליו ויתנהו לדוד ומדיו ועד-חרבו ועד-קשתו ועד-חגרו | And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was upon him and gave it to David and his apparel even to his sword and to his bow and to his girdle | ויאמר אליהם המלך אשר-יטב בעיניכם אעשה ויעמד המלך אל-יד השער וכל-העם יצאו למאות ולאלפים | And the king said unto them 'What seemeth you best I will do' And the king stood by the gate-side and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands
text_en: And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was upon him, and gave it to David, and his apparel, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle.
text_pisuk: וַיִּתְפַּשֵּׁט יְהוֹנָתָן, אֶת-הַמְּעִיל אֲשֶׁר עָלָיו, וַיִּתְּנֵהוּ, לְדָוִד; וּמַדָּיו, וְעַד-חַרְבּוֹ וְעַד-קַשְׁתּוֹ וְעַד-חֲגֹרוֹ. | And Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was upon him, and gave it to David, and his apparel, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֲשֶׁר-יִיטַב בְּעֵינֵיכֶם אֶעֱשֶׂה; וַיַּעֲמֹד הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶל-יַד הַשַּׁעַר, וְכָל-הָעָם יָצְאוּ, לְמֵאוֹת וְלַאֲלָפִים. | And the king said unto them: 'What seemeth you best I will do.' And the king stood by the gate-side, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.

text_he: ויצא דוד בכל אשר ישלחנו שאול ישכיל וישמהו שאול על אנשי המלחמה ויטב בעיני כל-העם וגם בעיני עבדי שאול | And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him he had good success and Saul set him over the men of war and it was good in the sight of all the people and also in the sight of Saul's servants | ויצו המלך את-יואב ואת-אבישי ואת-אתי לאמר לאט-לי לנער לאבשלום וכל-העם שמעו בצות המלך את-כל-השרים--על-דבר אבשלום | And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai saying 'Deal gently for my sake with the young man even with Absalom' And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom
text_en: And David went out; whithersoever Saul sent him, he had good success; and Saul set him over the men of war; and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּצֵא דָוִד בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁלָחֶנּוּ שָׁאוּל, יַשְׂכִּיל, וַיְשִׂמֵהוּ שָׁאוּל, עַל אַנְשֵׁי הַמִּלְחָמָה; וַיִּיטַב, בְּעֵינֵי כָל-הָעָם, וְגַם, בְּעֵינֵי עַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל. | And David went out; whithersoever Saul sent him, he had good success; and Saul set him over the men of war; and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants. | וַיְצַו הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת-יוֹאָב וְאֶת-אֲבִישַׁי וְאֶת-אִתַּי, לֵאמֹר, לְאַט-לִי, לַנַּעַר לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם; וְכָל-הָעָם שָׁמְעוּ, בְּצַוּת הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת-כָּל-הַשָּׂרִים--עַל-דְּבַר אַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying: 'Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom.' And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.

text_he: ויהי בואם בשוב דוד מהכות את-הפלשתי ותצאנה הנשים מכל-ערי ישראל לשור (לשיר) והמחלות לקראת שאול המלך--בתפים בשמחה ובשלשים | And it came to pass as they came when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine that the women came out of all the cities of Israel singing and dancing to meet king Saul with timbrels with joy and with three-stringed instruments | ויצא העם השדה לקראת ישראל ותהי המלחמה ביער אפרים | So the people went out into the field against Israel and the battle was in the forest of Ephraim
text_en: And it came to pass as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with timbrels, with joy, and with three-stringed instruments.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי בְּבוֹאָם, בְּשׁוּב דָּוִד מֵהַכּוֹת אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וַתֵּצֶאנָה הַנָּשִׁים מִכָּל-עָרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לשור (לָשִׁיר) וְהַמְּחֹלוֹת, לִקְרַאת שָׁאוּל הַמֶּלֶךְ--בְּתֻפִּים בְּשִׂמְחָה, וּבְשָׁלִשִׁים. | And it came to pass as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with timbrels, with joy, and with three-stringed instruments. | וַיֵּצֵא הָעָם הַשָּׂדֶה, לִקְרַאת יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַתְּהִי הַמִּלְחָמָה, בְּיַעַר אֶפְרָיִם. | So the people went out into the field against Israel; and the battle was in the forest of Ephraim.

text_he: ותענינה הנשים המשחקות ותאמרן הכה שאול באלפו ודוד ברבתיו | And the women sang one to another in their play and said Saul hath slain his thousands and David his ten thousands | וינגפו שם עם ישראל לפני עבדי דוד ותהי-שם המגפה גדולה ביום הוא--עשרים אלף | And the people of Israel were smitten there before the servants of David and there was a great slaughter there that day of twenty thousand men
text_en: And the women sang one to another in their play, and said: Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands.
text_pisuk: וַתַּעֲנֶינָה הַנָּשִׁים הַמְשַׂחֲקוֹת, וַתֹּאמַרְןָ: הִכָּה שָׁאוּל בַּאֲלָפָו, וְדָוִד בְּרִבְבֹתָיו. | And the women sang one to another in their play, and said: Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands. | וַיִּנָּגְפוּ שָׁם עַם יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד; וַתְּהִי-שָׁם הַמַּגֵּפָה גְדוֹלָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא--עֶשְׂרִים אָלֶף. | And the people of Israel were smitten there before the servants of David, and there was a great slaughter there that day of twenty thousand men.

text_he: ויחר לשאול מאד וירע בעיניו הדבר הזה ויאמר נתנו לדוד רבות ולי נתנו האלפים ועוד לו אך המלוכה | And Saul was very wroth and this saying displeased him and he said 'They have ascribed unto David ten thousands and to me they have ascribed but thousands and all he lacketh is the kingdom' | ותהי-שם המלחמה נפצות (נפוצת) על-פני כל-הארץ וירב היער לאכל בעם מאשר אכלה החרב ביום הוא | For the battle was there spread over the face of all the country and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured
text_en: And Saul was very wroth, and this saying displeased him; and he said: 'They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands; and all he lacketh is the kingdom!'
text_pisuk: וַיִּחַר לְשָׁאוּל מְאֹד, וַיֵּרַע בְּעֵינָיו הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה, וַיֹּאמֶר נָתְנוּ לְדָוִד רְבָבוֹת, וְלִי נָתְנוּ הָאֲלָפִים; וְעוֹד לוֹ, אַךְ הַמְּלוּכָה. | And Saul was very wroth, and this saying displeased him; and he said: 'They have ascribed unto David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands; and all he lacketh is the kingdom!' | וַתְּהִי-שָׁם הַמִּלְחָמָה נפצות (נָפוֹצֶת), עַל-פְּנֵי כָל-הָאָרֶץ; וַיֶּרֶב הַיַּעַר לֶאֱכֹל בָּעָם, מֵאֲשֶׁר אָכְלָה הַחֶרֶב בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא. | For the battle was there spread over the face of all the country; and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.

text_he: ויהי שאול עון (עוין) את-דוד מהיום הוא והלאה | And Saul eyed David from that day and forward{S} | ויקרא אבשלום לפני עבדי דוד ואבשלום רכב על-הפרד ויבא הפרד תחת שובך האלה הגדולה ויחזק ראשו באלה ויתן בין השמים ובין הארץ והפרד אשר-תחתיו עבר | And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David And Absalom was riding upon his mule and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth and his head caught hold of the terebinth and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth and the mule that was under him went on
text_en: And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי שָׁאוּל, עון (עוֹיֵן) אֶת-דָּוִד, מֵהַיּוֹם הַהוּא, וָהָלְאָה. | And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.{S} | וַיִּקָּרֵא, אַבְשָׁלוֹם, לִפְנֵי, עַבְדֵי דָוִד; וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל-הַפֶּרֶד, וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ, וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר-תַּחְתָּיו, עָבָר. | And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on.

text_he: ויהי מחרת ותצלח רוח אלהים רעה אל-שאול ויתנבא בתוך-הבית ודוד מנגן בידו כיום ביום והחנית ביד-שאול | And it came to pass on the morrow that an evil spirit from God came mightily upon Saul and he raved in the midst of the house and David played with his hand as he did day by day and Saul had his spear in his hand | וירא איש אחד ויגד ליואב ויאמר הנה ראיתי את-אבשלם תלוי באלה | And a certain man saw it and told Joab and said 'Behold I saw Absalom hanging in a terebinth'
text_en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that an evil spirit from God came mightily upon Saul, and he raved in the midst of the house; and David played with his hand, as he did day by day; and Saul had his spear in his hand.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי מִמָּחֳרָת, וַתִּצְלַח רוּחַ אֱלֹהִים רָעָה אֶל-שָׁאוּל וַיִּתְנַבֵּא בְתוֹךְ-הַבַּיִת, וְדָוִד מְנַגֵּן בְּיָדוֹ, כְּיוֹם בְּיוֹם; וְהַחֲנִית, בְּיַד-שָׁאוּל. | And it came to pass on the morrow, that an evil spirit from God came mightily upon Saul, and he raved in the midst of the house; and David played with his hand, as he did day by day; and Saul had his spear in his hand. | וַיַּרְא אִישׁ אֶחָד, וַיַּגֵּד לְיוֹאָב; וַיֹּאמֶר, הִנֵּה רָאִיתִי אֶת-אַבְשָׁלֹם, תָּלוּי, בָּאֵלָה. | And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said: 'Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in a terebinth.'

text_he: ויטל שאול את-החנית ויאמר אכה בדוד ובקיר ויסב דוד מפניו פעמים | And Saul cast the spear for he said 'I will smite David even to the wall' And David stepped aside out of his presence twice | ויאמר יואב לאיש המגיד לו והנה ראית ומדוע לא-הכיתו שם ארצה ועלי לת לך עשרה כסף וחגרה אחת | And Joab said unto the man that told him 'And behold thou sawest it and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground and I would have had to give thee ten pieces of silver and a girdle'
text_en: And Saul cast the spear; for he said: 'I will smite David even to the wall.' And David stepped aside out of his presence twice.
text_pisuk: וַיָּטֶל שָׁאוּל, אֶת-הַחֲנִית, וַיֹּאמֶר, אַכֶּה בְדָוִד וּבַקִּיר; וַיִּסֹּב דָּוִד מִפָּנָיו, פַּעֲמָיִם. | And Saul cast the spear; for he said: 'I will smite David even to the wall.' And David stepped aside out of his presence twice. | וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב, לָאִישׁ הַמַּגִּיד לוֹ, וְהִנֵּה רָאִיתָ, וּמַדּוּעַ לֹא-הִכִּיתוֹ שָׁם אָרְצָה; וְעָלַי, לָתֶת לְךָ עֲשָׂרָה כֶסֶף, וַחֲגֹרָה, אֶחָת. | And Joab said unto the man that told him: 'And, behold, thou sawest it, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have had to give thee ten pieces of silver, and a girdle.'

text_he: וירא שאול מלפני דוד כי-היה יהוה עמו ומעם שאול סר | And Saul was afraid of David because the LORD was with him and was departed from Saul | ויאמר האיש אל-יואב ולא (ולוא) אנכי שקל על-כפי אלף כסף לא-אשלח ידי אל-בן-המלך כי באזנינו צוה המלך אתך ואת-אבישי ואת-אתי לאמר שמרו-מי בנער באבשלום | And the man said unto Joab 'Though I should receive a thousand pieces of silver in my hand yet would I not put forth my hand against the king's son for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai saying Beware that none touch the young man Absalom
text_en: And Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with him, and was departed from Saul.
text_pisuk: וַיִּרָא שָׁאוּל, מִלִּפְנֵי דָוִד: כִּי-הָיָה יְהוָה עִמּוֹ, וּמֵעִם שָׁאוּל סָר. | And Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with him, and was departed from Saul. | וַיֹּאמֶר הָאִישׁ, אֶל-יוֹאָב, ולא (וְלוּא) אָנֹכִי שֹׁקֵל עַל-כַּפַּי אֶלֶף כֶּסֶף, לֹא-אֶשְׁלַח יָדִי אֶל-בֶּן-הַמֶּלֶךְ: כִּי בְאָזְנֵינוּ צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֹתְךָ וְאֶת-אֲבִישַׁי וְאֶת-אִתַּי לֵאמֹר, שִׁמְרוּ-מִי, בַּנַּעַר בְּאַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And the man said unto Joab: 'Though I should receive a thousand pieces of silver in my hand, yet would I not put forth my hand against the king's son; for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying: Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.

text_he: ויסרהו שאול מעמו וישמהו לו שר-אלף ויצא ויבא לפני העם | Therefore Saul removed him from him and made him his captain over a thousand and he went out and came in before the people{S} | או-עשיתי בנפשו (בנפשי) שקר וכל-דבר לא-יכחד מן-המלך ואתה תיצב מנגד | Otherwise if I had dealt falsely against mine own life--and there is no matter hid from the king--then thou thyself wouldest have stood aloof'
text_en: Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְסִרֵהוּ שָׁאוּל מֵעִמּוֹ, וַיְשִׂמֵהוּ לוֹ שַׂר-אָלֶף; וַיֵּצֵא וַיָּבֹא, לִפְנֵי הָעָם. | Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.{S} | אוֹ-עָשִׂיתִי בנפשו (בְנַפְשִׁי) שֶׁקֶר, וְכָל-דָּבָר לֹא-יִכָּחֵד מִן-הַמֶּלֶךְ; וְאַתָּה, תִּתְיַצֵּב מִנֶּגֶד. | Otherwise if I had dealt falsely against mine own life--and there is no matter hid from the king--then thou thyself wouldest have stood aloof.'

text_he: ויהי דוד לכל-דרכו משכיל ויהוה עמו | And David had great success in all his ways and the LORD was with him | ויאמר יואב לא-כן אחילה לפניך ויקח שלשה שבטים בכפו ויתקעם בלב אבשלום--עודנו חי בלב האלה | Then said Joab 'I may not tarry thus with thee' And he took three darts in his hand and thrust them through the heart of Absalom while he was yet alive in the midst of the terebinth
text_en: And David had great success in all his ways; and the LORD was with him.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי דָוִד לְכָל-דְּרָכָו, מַשְׂכִּיל; וַיהוָה, עִמּוֹ. | And David had great success in all his ways; and the LORD was with him. | וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב, לֹא-כֵן אֹחִילָה לְפָנֶיךָ; וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ, וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם--עוֹדֶנּוּ חַי, בְּלֵב הָאֵלָה. | Then said Joab: 'I may not tarry thus with thee.' And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the terebinth.

text_he: וירא שאול אשר-הוא משכיל מאד ויגר מפניו | And when Saul saw that he had great success he stood in awe of him | ויסבו עשרה נערים נשאי כלי יואב ויכו את-אבשלום וימתהו | And ten young men that bore Joab's armour compassed about and smote Absalom and slew him
text_en: And when Saul saw that he had great success, he stood in awe of him.
text_pisuk: וַיַּרְא שָׁאוּל, אֲשֶׁר-הוּא מַשְׂכִּיל מְאֹד; וַיָּגָר, מִפָּנָיו. | And when Saul saw that he had great success, he stood in awe of him. | וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה נְעָרִים, נֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב; וַיַּכּוּ אֶת-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וַיְמִתֻהוּ. | And ten young men that bore Joab's armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.

text_he: וכל-ישראל ויהודה אהב את-דוד כי-הוא יוצא ובא לפניהם | But all Israel and Judah loved David for he went out and came in before them | ויתקע יואב בשפר וישב העם מרדף אחרי ישראל כי-חשך יואב את-העם | And Joab blew the horn and the people returned from pursuing after Israel for Joab held back the people
text_en: But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them.
text_pisuk: וְכָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוּדָה, אֹהֵב אֶת-דָּוִד: כִּי-הוּא יוֹצֵא וָבָא, לִפְנֵיהֶם. | But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them. | וַיִּתְקַע יוֹאָב, בַּשֹּׁפָר, וַיָּשָׁב הָעָם, מִרְדֹף אַחֲרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל: כִּי-חָשַׂךְ יוֹאָב, אֶת-הָעָם. | And Joab blew the horn, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel; for Joab held back the people.

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-דוד הנה בתי הגדולה מרב אתה אתן-לך לאשה--אך היה-לי לבן-חיל והלחם מלחמות יהוה ושאול אמר אל-תהי ידי בו ותהי-בו יד-פלשתים | And Saul said to David 'Behold my elder daughter Merab her will I give thee to wife only be thou valiant for me and fight the LORD'S battles' For Saul said 'Let not my hand be upon him but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him'{S} | ויקחו את-אבשלום וישלכו אתו ביער אל-הפחת הגדול ויצבו עליו גל-אבנים גדול מאד וכל-ישראל--נסו איש לאהלו | And they took Absalom and cast him into the great pit in the forest and raised over him a very great heap of stones and all Israel fled every one to his tent--
text_en: And Saul said to David: 'Behold my elder daughter Merab, her will I give thee to wife; only be thou valiant for me, and fight the LORD'S battles.' For Saul said: 'Let not my hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-דָּוִד, הִנֵּה בִתִּי הַגְּדוֹלָה מֵרַב אֹתָהּ אֶתֶּן-לְךָ לְאִשָּׁה--אַךְ הֱיֵה-לִי לְבֶן-חַיִל, וְהִלָּחֵם מִלְחֲמוֹת יְהוָה; וְשָׁאוּל אָמַר, אַל-תְּהִי יָדִי בּוֹ, וּתְהִי-בוֹ, יַד-פְּלִשְׁתִּים. | And Saul said to David: 'Behold my elder daughter Merab, her will I give thee to wife; only be thou valiant for me, and fight the LORD'S battles.' For Saul said: 'Let not my hand be upon him, but let the hand of the Philistines be upon him.'{S} | וַיִּקְחוּ אֶת-אַבְשָׁלוֹם, וַיַּשְׁלִכוּ אֹתוֹ בַיַּעַר אֶל-הַפַּחַת הַגָּדוֹל, וַיַּצִּבוּ עָלָיו גַּל-אֲבָנִים, גָּדוֹל מְאֹד; וְכָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל--נָסוּ, אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָו. | And they took Absalom, and cast him into the great pit in the forest, and raised over him a very great heap of stones; and all Israel fled every one to his tent.--

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-שאול מי אנכי ומי חי משפחת אבי בישראל--כי-אהיה חתן למלך | And David said unto Saul 'Who am I and what is my life or my father's family in Israel that I should be son-in-law to the king' | ואבשלם לקח ויצב-לו בחיו את-מצבת אשר בעמק-המלך--כי אמר אין-לי בן בעבור הזכיר שמי ויקרא למצבת על-שמו ויקרא לה יד אבשלום עד היום הזה | Now Absalom in his life-time had taken and reared up for himself the pillar which is in the king's dale for he said 'I have no son to keep my name in remembrance' and he called the pillar after his own name and it is called Absalom's monument unto this day{S}
text_en: And David said unto Saul: 'Who am I, and what is my life, or my father's family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל, מִי אָנֹכִי וּמִי חַיַּי, מִשְׁפַּחַת אָבִי, בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל--כִּי-אֶהְיֶה חָתָן, לַמֶּלֶךְ. | And David said unto Saul: 'Who am I, and what is my life, or my father's family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?' | וְאַבְשָׁלֹם לָקַח, וַיַּצֶּב-לוֹ בְחַיָּו אֶת-מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק-הַמֶּלֶךְ--כִּי אָמַר אֵין-לִי בֵן, בַּעֲבוּר הַזְכִּיר שְׁמִי; וַיִּקְרָא לַמַּצֶּבֶת, עַל-שְׁמוֹ, וַיִּקָּרֵא לָהּ יַד אַבְשָׁלוֹם, עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה. | Now Absalom in his life-time had taken and reared up for himself the pillar, which is in the king's dale; for he said: 'I have no son to keep my name in remembrance'; and he called the pillar after his own name; and it is called Absalom's monument unto this day.{S}

text_he: ויהי בעת ת את-מרב בת-שאול--לדוד והיא נתנה לעדריאל המחלתי לאשה | But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's daughter should have been given to David that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife | ואחימעץ בן-צדוק אמר ארוצה נא ואבשרה את-המלך כי-שפטו יהוה מיד איביו | Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok 'Let me now run and bear the king tidings how that the LORD hath avenged him of his enemies'
text_en: But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's daughter should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, בְּעֵת תֵּת אֶת-מֵרַב בַּת-שָׁאוּל--לְדָוִד; וְהִיא נִתְּנָה לְעַדְרִיאֵל הַמְּחֹלָתִי, לְאִשָּׁה. | But it came to pass at the time when Merab Saul's daughter should have been given to David, that she was given unto Adriel the Meholathite to wife. | וַאֲחִימַעַץ בֶּן-צָדוֹק, אָמַר, אָרוּצָה נָּא, וַאֲבַשְּׂרָה אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ: כִּי-שְׁפָטוֹ יְהוָה, מִיַּד אֹיְבָיו. | Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok: 'Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the LORD hath avenged him of his enemies.'

text_he: ותאהב מיכל בת-שאול את-דוד ויגדו לשאול וישר הדבר בעיניו | And Michal Saul's daughter loved David and they told Saul and the thing pleased him | ויאמר לו יואב לא איש בשרה אתה היום הזה ובשרת ביום אחר והיום הזה לא תבשר כי-על- (כן) בן-המלך מת | And Joab said unto him 'Thou shalt not be the bearer of tidings this day but thou shalt bear tidings another day but this day thou shalt bear no tidings forasmuch as the king's son is dead'
text_en: And Michal Saul's daughter loved David; and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.
text_pisuk: וַתֶּאֱהַב מִיכַל בַּת-שָׁאוּל, אֶת-דָּוִד; וַיַּגִּדוּ לְשָׁאוּל, וַיִּשַׁר הַדָּבָר בְּעֵינָיו. | And Michal Saul's daughter loved David; and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him. | וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ יוֹאָב, לֹא אִישׁ בְּשֹׂרָה אַתָּה הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה, וּבִשַּׂרְתָּ, בְּיוֹם אַחֵר; וְהַיּוֹם הַזֶּה לֹא תְבַשֵּׂר, כִּי-עַל- (כֵּן) בֶּן-הַמֶּלֶךְ מֵת. | And Joab said unto him: 'Thou shalt not be the bearer of tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day; but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, forasmuch as the king's son is dead.'

text_he: ויאמר שאול אתנה לו ותהי-לו למוקש ותהי-בו יד-פלשתים ויאמר שאול אל-דוד בשתים תחתן בי היום | And Saul said 'I will give him her that she may be a snare to him and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him' Wherefore Saul said to David 'Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law through the one of the twain' | ויאמר יואב לכושי לך הגד למלך אשר ראיתה וישתחו כושי ליואב וירץ | Then said Joab to the Cushite 'Go tell the king what thou hast seen' And the Cushite bowed down unto Joab and ran
text_en: And Saul said: 'I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him.' Wherefore Saul said to David: 'Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law through the one of the twain.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶתְּנֶנָּה לּוֹ, וּתְהִי-לוֹ לְמוֹקֵשׁ, וּתְהִי-בוֹ, יַד-פְּלִשְׁתִּים; וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-דָּוִד, בִּשְׁתַּיִם תִּתְחַתֵּן בִּי הַיּוֹם. | And Saul said: 'I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him.' Wherefore Saul said to David: 'Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law through the one of the twain.' | וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב לַכּוּשִׁי, לֵךְ הַגֵּד לַמֶּלֶךְ אֲשֶׁר רָאִיתָה; וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ כוּשִׁי לְיוֹאָב, וַיָּרֹץ. | Then said Joab to the Cushite: 'Go tell the king what thou hast seen.' And the Cushite bowed down unto Joab, and ran.

text_he: ויצו שאול את-עבדו דברו אל-דוד בלט לאמר הנה חפץ בך המלך וכל-עבדיו אהבוך ועתה התחתן במלך | And Saul commanded his servants 'Speak with David secretly and say Behold the king hath delight in thee and all his servants love thee now therefore be the king's son-in-law' | ויסף עוד אחימעץ בן-צדוק ויאמר אל-יואב ויהי מה ארצה-נא גם-אני אחרי הכושי ויאמר יואב למה-זה אתה רץ בני ולכה אין-בשורה מצאת | Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab 'But come what may let me I pray thee also run after the Cushite' And Joab said 'Wherefore wilt thou run my son seeing that thou wilt have no reward for the tidings'
text_en: And Saul commanded his servants: 'Speak with David secretly, and say: Behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee; now therefore be the king's son-in-law.'
text_pisuk: וַיְצַו שָׁאוּל אֶת-עֲבָדָו, דַּבְּרוּ אֶל-דָּוִד בַּלָּט לֵאמֹר, הִנֵּה חָפֵץ בְּךָ הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְכָל-עֲבָדָיו אֲהֵבוּךָ; וְעַתָּה, הִתְחַתֵּן בַּמֶּלֶךְ. | And Saul commanded his servants: 'Speak with David secretly, and say: Behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his servants love thee; now therefore be the king's son-in-law.' | וַיֹּסֶף עוֹד אֲחִימַעַץ בֶּן-צָדוֹק, וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-יוֹאָב, וִיהִי מָה, אָרֻצָה-נָּא גַם-אָנִי אַחֲרֵי הַכּוּשִׁי; וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב, לָמָּה-זֶּה אַתָּה רָץ בְּנִי, וּלְכָה, אֵין-בְּשׂוֹרָה מֹצֵאת. | Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab: 'But come what may, let me, I pray thee, also run after the Cushite.' And Joab said: 'Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou wilt have no reward for the tidings?'

text_he: וידברו עבדי שאול באזני דוד את-הדברים האלה ויאמר דוד הנקלה בעיניכם התחתן במלך ואנכי איש-רש ונקלה | And Saul's servants spoke those words in the ears of David And David said 'Seemeth it to you a light thing to be the king's son-in-law seeing that I am a poor man and lightly esteemed' | ויהי-מה ארוץ ויאמר לו רוץ וירץ אחימעץ דרך הכר ויעבר את-הכושי | 'But come what may I will run' And he said unto him 'Run' Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the Plain and overran the Cushite
text_en: And Saul's servants spoke those words in the ears of David. And David said: 'Seemeth it to you a light thing to be the king's son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?'
text_pisuk: וַיְדַבְּרוּ עַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל, בְּאָזְנֵי דָוִד, אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים, הָאֵלֶּה; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, הַנְקַלָּה בְעֵינֵיכֶם הִתְחַתֵּן בַּמֶּלֶךְ, וְאָנֹכִי, אִישׁ-רָשׁ וְנִקְלֶה. | And Saul's servants spoke those words in the ears of David. And David said: 'Seemeth it to you a light thing to be the king's son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?' | וִיהִי-מָה אָרוּץ, וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ רוּץ; וַיָּרָץ אֲחִימַעַץ דֶּרֶךְ הַכִּכָּר, וַיַּעֲבֹר אֶת-הַכּוּשִׁי. | 'But come what may, I will run.' And he said unto him: 'Run.' Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the Plain, and overran the Cushite.

text_he: ויגדו עבדי שאול לו--לאמר כדברים האלה דבר דוד | And the servants of Saul told him saying 'On this manner spoke David' | ודוד יושב בין-שני השערים וילך הצפה אל-ג השער אל-החומה וישא את-עיניו וירא והנה-איש רץ לבדו | Now David sat between the two gates and the watchman went up to the roof of the gate unto the wall and lifted up his eyes and looked and behold a man running alone
text_en: And the servants of Saul told him, saying: 'On this manner spoke David.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּגִּדוּ עַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל, לוֹ--לֵאמֹר: כַּדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה, דִּבֶּר דָּוִד. | And the servants of Saul told him, saying: 'On this manner spoke David.' | וְדָוִד יוֹשֵׁב, בֵּין-שְׁנֵי הַשְּׁעָרִים; וַיֵּלֶךְ הַצֹּפֶה אֶל-גַּג הַשַּׁעַר, אֶל-הַחוֹמָה, וַיִּשָּׂא אֶת-עֵינָיו וַיַּרְא, וְהִנֵּה-אִישׁ רָץ לְבַדּוֹ. | Now David sat between the two gates; and the watchman went up to the roof of the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.

text_he: ויאמר שאול כה-תאמרו לדוד אין-חפץ למלך במהר כי במאה ערלות פלשתים להנקם באיבי המלך ושאול חשב להפיל את-דוד ביד-פלשתים | And Saul said 'Thus shall ye say to David The king desireth not any dowry but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines to be avenged of the king's enemies' For Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines | ויקרא הצפה ויגד למלך ויאמר המלך אם-לבדו בשורה בפיו וילך הלוך וקרב | And the watchman cried and told the king And the king said 'If he be alone there is tidings in his mouth' And he came apace and drew near
text_en: And Saul said: 'Thus shall ye say to David: The king desireth not any dowry, but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king's enemies.' For Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל כֹּה-תֹאמְרוּ לְדָוִד, אֵין-חֵפֶץ לַמֶּלֶךְ בְּמֹהַר, כִּי בְּמֵאָה עָרְלוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים, לְהִנָּקֵם בְּאֹיְבֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ; וְשָׁאוּל חָשַׁב, לְהַפִּיל אֶת-דָּוִד בְּיַד-פְּלִשְׁתִּים. | And Saul said: 'Thus shall ye say to David: The king desireth not any dowry, but a hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king's enemies.' For Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines. | וַיִּקְרָא הַצֹּפֶה, וַיַּגֵּד לַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אִם-לְבַדּוֹ בְּשׂוֹרָה בְּפִיו; וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ, וְקָרֵב. | And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said: 'If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth.' And he came apace, and drew near.

text_he: ויגדו עבדיו לדוד את-הדברים האלה וישר הדבר בעיני דוד להתחתן במלך ולא מלאו הימים | And when his servants told David these words it pleased David well to be the king's son-in-law And the days were not expired | וירא הצפה איש-אחר רץ ויקרא הצפה אל-השער ויאמר הנה-איש רץ לבדו ויאמר המלך גם-זה מבשר | And the watchman saw another man running and the watchman called unto the porter and said 'Behold another man running alone' And the king said 'He also bringeth tidings'
text_en: And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king's son-in-law. And the days were not expired;
text_pisuk: וַיַּגִּדוּ עֲבָדָיו לְדָוִד, אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה, וַיִּשַׁר הַדָּבָר בְּעֵינֵי דָוִד, לְהִתְחַתֵּן בַּמֶּלֶךְ; וְלֹא מָלְאוּ, הַיָּמִים. | And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king's son-in-law. And the days were not expired; | וַיַּרְא הַצֹּפֶה, אִישׁ-אַחֵר רָץ, וַיִּקְרָא הַצֹּפֶה אֶל-הַשֹּׁעֵר, וַיֹּאמֶר הִנֵּה-אִישׁ רָץ לְבַדּוֹ; וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, גַּם-זֶה מְבַשֵּׂר. | And the watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called unto the porter, and said: 'Behold another man running alone.' And the king said: 'He also bringeth tidings.'

text_he: ויקם דוד וילך הוא ואנשיו ויך בפלשתים מאתים איש ויבא דוד את-ערלתיהם וימלאום למלך להתחתן במלך ויתן-לו שאול את-מיכל בתו לאשה | and David arose and went he and his men and slew of the Philistines two hundred men and David brought their foreskins and they gave them in full number to the king that he might be the king's son-in-law And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife{S} | ויאמר הצפה אני ראה את-מרוצת הראשון כמרצת אחימעץ בן-צדוק ויאמר המלך איש-טוב זה ואל-בשורה טובה יבוא | And the watchman said 'I think the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok' And the king said 'He is a good man and cometh with good tidings'
text_en: and David arose and went, he and his men, and slew of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king's son-in-law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד וַיֵּלֶךְ הוּא וַאֲנָשָׁיו, וַיַּךְ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים מָאתַיִם אִישׁ, וַיָּבֵא דָוִד אֶת-עָרְלֹתֵיהֶם, וַיְמַלְאוּם לַמֶּלֶךְ לְהִתְחַתֵּן בַּמֶּלֶךְ; וַיִּתֶּן-לוֹ שָׁאוּל אֶת-מִיכַל בִּתּוֹ, לְאִשָּׁה. | and David arose and went, he and his men, and slew of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king's son-in-law. And Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife.{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר, הַצֹּפֶה, אֲנִי רֹאֶה אֶת-מְרוּצַת הָרִאשׁוֹן, כִּמְרֻצַת אֲחִימַעַץ בֶּן-צָדוֹק; וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אִישׁ-טוֹב זֶה, וְאֶל-בְּשׂוֹרָה טוֹבָה יָבוֹא. | And the watchman said: 'I think the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok.' And the king said: 'He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.'

text_he: וירא שאול וידע כי יהוה עם-דוד ומיכל בת-שאול אהבתהו | And Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David and Michal Saul's daughter loved him | ויקרא אחימעץ ויאמר אל-המלך שלום וישתחו למלך לאפיו ארצה ויאמר ברוך יהוה אלהיך אשר סגר את-האנשים אשר-נשאו את-ידם באדני המלך | And Ahimaaz called and said unto the king 'All is well' And he bowed down before the king with his face to the earth{S}and said 'Blessed be the LORD thy God who hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king'{S}
text_en: And Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David; and Michal Saul's daughter loved him.
text_pisuk: וַיַּרְא שָׁאוּל וַיֵּדַע, כִּי יְהוָה עִם-דָּוִד; וּמִיכַל בַּת-שָׁאוּל, אֲהֵבַתְהוּ. | And Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David; and Michal Saul's daughter loved him. | וַיִּקְרָא אֲחִימַעַץ, וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ שָׁלוֹם, וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ לְאַפָּיו, אָרְצָה;  וַיֹּאמֶר, בָּרוּךְ יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ, אֲשֶׁר סִגַּר אֶת-הָאֲנָשִׁים, אֲשֶׁר-נָשְׂאוּ אֶת-יָדָם בַּאדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king: 'All is well.' And he bowed down before the king with his face to the earth,{S}and said: 'Blessed be the LORD thy God, who hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.'{S}

text_he: ויאסף שאול לרא מפני דוד--עוד ויהי שאול איב את-דוד כל-הימים | And Saul was yet the more afraid of David and Saul was David's enemy continually | ויאמר המלך שלום לנער לאבשלום ויאמר אחימעץ ראיתי המון הגדול לשלח את-עבד המלך יואב ואת-עבדך ולא ידעתי מה | And the king said 'Is it well with the young man Absalom' And Ahimaaz answered 'When Joab sent the king's servant and me thy servant I saw a great tumult but I knew not what it was'
text_en: And Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David's enemy continually.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאסֶף שָׁאוּל, לֵרֹא מִפְּנֵי דָוִד--עוֹד; וַיְהִי שָׁאוּל אֹיֵב אֶת-דָּוִד, כָּל-הַיָּמִים. | And Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David's enemy continually. | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, שָׁלוֹם לַנַּעַר לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם; וַיֹּאמֶר אֲחִימַעַץ רָאִיתִי הֶהָמוֹן הַגָּדוֹל לִשְׁלֹחַ אֶת-עֶבֶד הַמֶּלֶךְ יוֹאָב, וְאֶת-עַבְדֶּךָ, וְלֹא יָדַעְתִּי, מָה. | And the king said: 'Is it well with the young man Absalom?' And Ahimaaz answered: 'When Joab sent the king's servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.'

text_he: ויצאו שרי פלשתים ויהי מדי צאתם שכל דוד מכל עבדי שאול ויקר שמו מאד | Then the princes of the Philistines went forth and it came to pass as often as they went forth that David prospered more than all the servants of Saul so that his name was much set by{S} | ויאמר המלך סב התיצב כה ויסב ויעמד | And the king said 'Turn aside and stand here' And he turned aside and stood still
text_en: Then the princes of the Philistines went forth; and it came to pass, as often as they went forth, that David prospered more than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֵּצְאוּ, שָׂרֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים; וַיְהִי מִדֵּי צֵאתָם, שָׂכַל דָּוִד מִכֹּל עַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל, וַיִּיקַר שְׁמוֹ, מְאֹד. | Then the princes of the Philistines went forth; and it came to pass, as often as they went forth, that David prospered more than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by.{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, סֹב הִתְיַצֵּב כֹּה; וַיִּסֹּב, וַיַּעֲמֹד. | And the king said: 'Turn aside, and stand here.' And he turned aside, and stood still.

text_he: וידבר שאול אל-יונתן בנו ואל-כל-עבדיו להמית את-דוד ויהונתן בן-שאול חפץ בדוד מאד | And Saul spoke to Jonathan his son and to all his servants that they should slay David but Jonathan Saul's son delighted much in David | וירגז המלך ויעל על-עלית השער--ויבך וכה אמר בלכתו בני אבשלום בני בני אבשלום מי-יתן מותי אני תחתיך אבשלום בני בני | And the king was much moved and went up to the chamber over the gate and wept and as he went thus he said 'O my son Absalom my son my son Absalom would I had died for thee O Absalom my son my son'
text_en: And Saul spoke to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should slay David; but Jonathan Saul's son delighted much in David.
text_pisuk: וַיְדַבֵּר שָׁאוּל, אֶל-יוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ וְאֶל-כָּל-עֲבָדָיו, לְהָמִית, אֶת-דָּוִד; וִיהוֹנָתָן, בֶּן-שָׁאוּל, חָפֵץ בְּדָוִד, מְאֹד. | And Saul spoke to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should slay David; but Jonathan Saul's son delighted much in David. | וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיַּעַל עַל-עֲלִיַּת הַשַּׁעַר--וַיֵּבְךְּ; וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ, בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם, מִי-יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ, אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. | And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went, thus he said: 'O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!'

text_he: ויגד יהונתן לדוד לאמר מבקש שאול אבי להמיתך ועתה השמר-נא בקר וישבת בסתר ונחבאת | And Jonathan told David saying 'Saul my father seeketh to slay thee now therefore I pray thee take heed to thyself in the morning and abide in a secret place and hide thyself | ויגד ליואב הנה המלך בכה ויתאבל על-אבשלום | And it was told Joab 'Behold the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom'
text_en: And Jonathan told David, saying: 'Saul my father seeketh to slay thee; now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself in the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself.
text_pisuk: וַיַּגֵּד יְהוֹנָתָן לְדָוִד לֵאמֹר, מְבַקֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל אָבִי לַהֲמִיתֶךָ; וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמֶר-נָא בַבֹּקֶר, וְיָשַׁבְתָּ בַסֵּתֶר וְנַחְבֵּאתָ. | And Jonathan told David, saying: 'Saul my father seeketh to slay thee; now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself in the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself. | וַיֻּגַּד, לְיוֹאָב: הִנֵּה הַמֶּלֶךְ בֹּכֶה וַיִּתְאַבֵּל, עַל-אַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And it was told Joab: 'Behold, the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.'

text_he: ואני אצא ועמדתי ליד-אבי בשדה אשר אתה שם ואני אדבר בך אל-אבי וראיתי מה והגדתי לך | And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where thou art and I will speak with my father of thee and if I see aught I will tell thee'{S} | ותהי התשעה ביום הוא לאבל--לכל-העם כי-שמע העם ביום הוא לאמר נעצב המלך על-בנו | And the victory that day was turned into mourning unto all the people for the people heard say that day 'The king grieveth for his son'
text_en: And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where thou art, and I will speak with my father of thee; and if I see aught, I will tell thee.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַאֲנִי אֵצֵא וְעָמַדְתִּי לְיַד-אָבִי, בַּשָּׂדֶה אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה שָׁם, וַאֲנִי, אֲדַבֵּר בְּךָ אֶל-אָבִי; וְרָאִיתִי מָה, וְהִגַּדְתִּי לָךְ. | And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where thou art, and I will speak with my father of thee; and if I see aught, I will tell thee.'{S} | וַתְּהִי הַתְּשֻׁעָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, לְאֵבֶל--לְכָל-הָעָם: כִּי-שָׁמַע הָעָם, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא לֵאמֹר, נֶעֱצַב הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַל-בְּנוֹ. | And the victory that day was turned into mourning unto all the people; for the people heard say that day: 'The king grieveth for his son.'

text_he: וידבר יהונתן בדוד טוב אל-שאול אביו ויאמר אליו אל-יחטא המלך בעבדו בדוד כי לוא חטא לך וכי מעשיו טוב-לך מאד | And Jonathan spoke good of David unto Saul his father and said unto him 'Let not the king sin against his servant against David because he hath not sinned against thee and because his work hath been very good towards thee | ויתגנב העם ביום הוא לבוא העיר כאשר יתגנב העם הנכלמים--בנוסם במלחמה | And the people got them by stealth that day into the city as people that are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle
text_en: And Jonathan spoke good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him: 'Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his work hath been very good towards thee;
text_pisuk: וַיְדַבֵּר יְהוֹנָתָן בְּדָוִד טוֹב, אֶל-שָׁאוּל אָבִיו; וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו אַל-יֶחֱטָא הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּעַבְדּוֹ בְדָוִד, כִּי לוֹא חָטָא לָךְ, וְכִי מַעֲשָׂיו, טוֹב-לְךָ מְאֹד. | And Jonathan spoke good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him: 'Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his work hath been very good towards thee; | וַיִּתְגַּנֵּב הָעָם בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, לָבוֹא הָעִיר: כַּאֲשֶׁר יִתְגַּנֵּב, הָעָם הַנִּכְלָמִים--בְּנוּסָם, בַּמִּלְחָמָה. | And the people got them by stealth that day into the city, as people that are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.

text_he: וישם את-נפשו בכפו ויך את-הפלשתי ויעש יהוה תשועה גדולה לכל-ישראל--ראית ותשמח ולמה תחטא בדם נקי להמית את-דוד חנם | for he put his life in his hand and smote the Philistine and the LORD wrought a great victory for all Israel thou sawest it and didst rejoice wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood to slay David without a cause' | והמלך לאט את-פניו ויזעק המלך קול גדול בני אבשלום אבשלום בני בני | And the king covered his face and the king cried with a loud voice 'O my son Absalom O Absalom my son my son'{S}
text_en: for he put his life in his hand, and smote the Philistine, and the LORD wrought a great victory for all Israel; thou sawest it, and didst rejoice; wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?'
text_pisuk: וַיָּשֶׂם אֶת-נַפְשׁוֹ בְכַפּוֹ וַיַּךְ אֶת-הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי, וַיַּעַשׂ יְהוָה תְּשׁוּעָה גְדוֹלָה לְכָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל--רָאִיתָ, וַתִּשְׂמָח; וְלָמָּה תֶחֱטָא בְּדָם נָקִי, לְהָמִית אֶת-דָּוִד חִנָּם. | for he put his life in his hand, and smote the Philistine, and the LORD wrought a great victory for all Israel; thou sawest it, and didst rejoice; wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?' | וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת-פָּנָיו, וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל: בְּנִי, אַבְשָׁלוֹם, אַבְשָׁלוֹם, בְּנִי בְנִי. | And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: 'O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son!'{S}

text_he: וישמע שאול בקול יהונתן וישבע שאול חי-יהוה אם-יומת | And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan and Saul swore 'As the LORD liveth he shall not be put to death' | ויבא יואב אל-המלך הבית ויאמר הבשת היום את-פני כל-עבדיך המלטים את-נפשך היום ואת נפש בניך ובנתיך ונפש נשיך ונפש פלגשיך | And Joab came into the house to the king and said 'Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants who this day have saved thy life and the lives of thy sons and of thy daughters and the lives of thy wives and the lives of thy concubines
text_en: And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan; and Saul swore: 'As the LORD liveth, he shall not be put to death.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁמַע שָׁאוּל, בְּקוֹל יְהוֹנָתָן; וַיִּשָּׁבַע שָׁאוּל, חַי-יְהוָה אִם-יוּמָת. | And Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan; and Saul swore: 'As the LORD liveth, he shall not be put to death.' | וַיָּבֹא יוֹאָב אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, הַבָּיִת; וַיֹּאמֶר הֹבַשְׁתָּ הַיּוֹם אֶת-פְּנֵי כָל-עֲבָדֶיךָ, הַמְמַלְּטִים אֶת-נַפְשְׁךָ הַיּוֹם, וְאֵת נֶפֶשׁ בָּנֶיךָ וּבְנֹתֶיךָ, וְנֶפֶשׁ נָשֶׁיךָ וְנֶפֶשׁ פִּלַגְשֶׁיךָ. | And Joab came into the house to the king, and said: 'Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, who this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy sons and of thy daughters, and the lives of thy wives, and the lives of thy concubines;

text_he: ויקרא יהונתן לדוד ויגד-לו יהונתן את כל-הדברים האלה ויבא יהונתן את-דוד אל-שאול ויהי לפניו כאתמול שלשום | And Jonathan called David and Jonathan told him all those things And Jonathan brought David to Saul and he was in his presence as beforetime{S} | לאהבה את-שנאיך ולשנא את-אהביך כי הגדת היום כי אין לך שרים ועבדים--כי ידעתי היום כי לא (לוא) אבשלום חי וכלנו היום מתים כי-אז ישר בעיניך | in that thou lovest them that hate thee and hatest them that love thee For thou hast declared this day that princes and servants are nought unto thee for this day I perceive that if Absalom had lived and all we had died this day then it had pleased thee well
