text_en: And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan told him all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as beforetime.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּקְרָא יְהוֹנָתָן, לְדָוִד, וַיַּגֶּד-לוֹ יְהוֹנָתָן, אֵת כָּל-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה; וַיָּבֵא יְהוֹנָתָן אֶת-דָּוִד אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וַיְהִי לְפָנָיו כְּאֶתְמוֹל שִׁלְשׁוֹם. | And Jonathan called David, and Jonathan told him all those things. And Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as beforetime.{S} | לְאַהֲבָה, אֶת-שֹׂנְאֶיךָ, וְלִשְׂנֹא, אֶת-אֹהֲבֶיךָ: כִּי הִגַּדְתָּ הַיּוֹם, כִּי אֵין לְךָ שָׂרִים וַעֲבָדִים--כִּי יָדַעְתִּי הַיּוֹם כִּי לא (לוּא) אַבְשָׁלוֹם חַי וְכֻלָּנוּ הַיּוֹם מֵתִים, כִּי-אָז יָשָׁר בְּעֵינֶיךָ. | in that thou lovest them that hate thee, and hatest them that love thee. For thou hast declared this day, that princes and servants are nought unto thee; for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well.

text_he: ותוסף המלחמה להיות ויצא דוד וילחם בפלשתים ויך בהם מכה גדולה וינסו מפניו | And there was war again and David went out and fought with the Philistines and slew them with a great slaughter and they fled before him | ועתה קום צא ודבר על-לב עבדיך כי ביהוה נשבעתי כי-אינך יוצא אם-ילין איש אתך הלילה ורעה לך זאת מכל-הרעה אשר-באה עליך מנעריך עד-עתה | Now therefore arise go forth and speak to the heart of thy servants{S}for I swear by the LORD if thou go not forth there will not tarry a man with thee this night and that will be worse unto thee than all the evil that hath befallen thee from thy youth until now'{S}
text_en: And there was war again; and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled before him.
text_pisuk: וַתּוֹסֶף הַמִּלְחָמָה, לִהְיוֹת; וַיֵּצֵא דָוִד וַיִּלָּחֶם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים, וַיַּךְ בָּהֶם מַכָּה גְדוֹלָה, וַיָּנֻסוּ, מִפָּנָיו. | And there was war again; and David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled before him. | וְעַתָּה קוּם צֵא, וְדַבֵּר עַל-לֵב עֲבָדֶיךָ:  כִּי בַיהוָה נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי כִּי-אֵינְךָ יוֹצֵא, אִם-יָלִין אִישׁ אִתְּךָ הַלַּיְלָה, וְרָעָה לְךָ זֹאת מִכָּל-הָרָעָה אֲשֶׁר-בָּאָה עָלֶיךָ, מִנְּעֻרֶיךָ עַד-עָתָּה. | Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak to the heart of thy servants;{S}for I swear by the LORD, if thou go not forth, there will not tarry a man with thee this night; and that will be worse unto thee than all the evil that hath befallen thee from thy youth until now.'{S}

text_he: ותהי רוח יהוה רעה אל-שאול והוא ביתו ישב וחניתו בידו ודוד מנגן ביד | And an evil spirit from the LORD was upon Saul as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand and David was playing with his hand | ויקם המלך וישב בשער ולכל-העם הגידו לאמר הנה המלך יושב בשער ויבא כל-העם לפני המלך וישראל נס איש לאהליו | Then the king arose and sat in the gate And they told unto all the people saying 'Behold the king doth sit in the gate' and all the people came before the king Now Israel had fled every man to his tent{S}
text_en: And an evil spirit from the LORD was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing with his hand.
text_pisuk: וַתְּהִי רוּחַ יְהוָה רָעָה, אֶל-שָׁאוּל, וְהוּא בְּבֵיתוֹ יֹשֵׁב, וַחֲנִיתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ; וְדָוִד, מְנַגֵּן בְּיָד. | And an evil spirit from the LORD was upon Saul, as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing with his hand. | וַיָּקָם הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיֵּשֶׁב בַּשָּׁעַר; וּלְכָל-הָעָם הִגִּידוּ לֵאמֹר, הִנֵּה הַמֶּלֶךְ יוֹשֵׁב בַּשַּׁעַר, וַיָּבֹא כָל-הָעָם לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל נָס אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָיו. | Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. And they told unto all the people, saying: 'Behold, the king doth sit in the gate'; and all the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his tent.{S}

text_he: ויבקש שאול להכות בחנית בדוד ובקיר ויפטר מפני שאול ויך את-החנית בקיר ודוד נס וימלט בלילה הוא | And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the spear but he slipped away out of Saul's presence and he smote the spear into the wall and David fled and escaped that night | ויהי כל-העם נדון בכל-שבטי ישראל לאמר המלך הצילנו מכף איבינו והוא מלטנו מכף פלשתים ועתה ברח מן-הארץ מעל אבשלום | And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel saying 'The king delivered us out of the hand of our enemies and he saved us out of the hand of the Philistines and now he is fled out of the land from Absalom
text_en: And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the spear; but he slipped away out of Saul's presence, and he smote the spear into the wall; and David fled, and escaped that night.
text_pisuk: וַיְבַקֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל לְהַכּוֹת בַּחֲנִית, בְּדָוִד וּבַקִּיר, וַיִּפְטַר מִפְּנֵי שָׁאוּל, וַיַּךְ אֶת-הַחֲנִית בַּקִּיר; וְדָוִד נָס וַיִּמָּלֵט, בַּלַּיְלָה הוּא. | And Saul sought to smite David even to the wall with the spear; but he slipped away out of Saul's presence, and he smote the spear into the wall; and David fled, and escaped that night. | וַיְהִי כָל-הָעָם נָדוֹן, בְּכָל-שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר: הַמֶּלֶךְ הִצִּילָנוּ מִכַּף אֹיְבֵינוּ, וְהוּא מִלְּטָנוּ מִכַּף פְּלִשְׁתִּים, וְעַתָּה בָּרַח מִן-הָאָרֶץ, מֵעַל אַבְשָׁלוֹם. | And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying: 'The king delivered us out of the hand of our enemies, and he saved us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he is fled out of the land from Absalom.

text_he: וישלח שאול מלאכים אל-בית דוד לשמרו ולהמיתו בקר ותגד לדוד מיכל אשתו לאמר אם-אינך מלט את-נפשך הלילה מחר אתה מומת | And Saul sent messengers unto David's house to watch him and to slay him in the morning and Michal David's wife told him saying 'If thou save not thy life to-night to-morrow thou shalt be slain' | ואבשלום אשר משחנו עלינו מת במלחמה ועתה למה אתם מחרשים--להשיב את-המלך | And Absalom whom we anointed over us is dead in battle Now therefore why speak ye not a word of bringing the king back'{S}
text_en: And Saul sent messengers unto David's house, to watch him, and to slay him in the morning; and Michal David's wife told him, saying: 'If thou save not thy life to-night, to-morrow thou shalt be slain.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל מַלְאָכִים אֶל-בֵּית דָּוִד, לְשָׁמְרוֹ, וְלַהֲמִיתוֹ, בַּבֹּקֶר; וַתַּגֵּד לְדָוִד, מִיכַל אִשְׁתּוֹ לֵאמֹר, אִם-אֵינְךָ מְמַלֵּט אֶת-נַפְשְׁךָ הַלַּיְלָה, מָחָר אַתָּה מוּמָת. | And Saul sent messengers unto David's house, to watch him, and to slay him in the morning; and Michal David's wife told him, saying: 'If thou save not thy life to-night, to-morrow thou shalt be slain.' | וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם אֲשֶׁר מָשַׁחְנוּ עָלֵינוּ, מֵת בַּמִּלְחָמָה; וְעַתָּה, לָמָה אַתֶּם מַחֲרִשִׁים--לְהָשִׁיב אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now, therefore, why speak ye not a word of bringing the king back?'{S}

text_he: ותרד מיכל את-דוד בעד החלון וילך ויברח וימלט | So Michal let David down through the window and he went and fled and escaped | והמלך דוד שלח אל-צדוק ואל-אביתר הכהנים לאמר דברו אל-זקני יהודה לאמר למה תהיו אחרנים להשיב את-המלך אל-ביתו ודבר כל-ישראל בא אל-המלך אל-ביתו | And king David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests saying 'Speak unto the elders of Judah saying Why are ye the last to bring the king back to his house--For the speech of all Israel was come to the king to bring him to his house--
text_en: So Michal let David down through the window; and he went, and fled, and escaped.
text_pisuk: וַתֹּרֶד מִיכַל אֶת-דָּוִד, בְּעַד הַחַלּוֹן; וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּבְרַח, וַיִּמָּלֵט. | So Michal let David down through the window; and he went, and fled, and escaped. | וְהַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד, שָׁלַח אֶל-צָדוֹק וְאֶל-אֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֲנִים לֵאמֹר, דַּבְּרוּ אֶל-זִקְנֵי יְהוּדָה לֵאמֹר, לָמָּה תִהְיוּ אַחֲרֹנִים לְהָשִׁיב אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ; וּדְבַר, כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּא אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ. | And king David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying: 'Speak unto the elders of Judah, saying: Why are ye the last to bring the king back to his house?--For the speech of all Israel was come to the king, to bring him to his house.--

text_he: ותקח מיכל את-התרפים ותשם אל-המטה ואת כביר העזים שמה מראשתיו ותכס בגד | And Michal took the teraphim and laid it in the bed and put a quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof and covered it with a cloth{S} | אחי אתם עצמי ובשרי אתם ולמה תהיו אחרנים להשיב את-המלך | Ye are my brethren ye are my bone and my flesh wherefore then should ye be the last to bring back the king
text_en: And Michal took the teraphim, and laid it in the bed, and put a quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof, and covered it with a cloth.{S}
text_pisuk: וַתִּקַּח מִיכַל אֶת-הַתְּרָפִים, וַתָּשֶׂם אֶל-הַמִּטָּה, וְאֵת כְּבִיר הָעִזִּים, שָׂמָה מְרַאֲשֹׁתָיו; וַתְּכַס, בַּבָּגֶד. | And Michal took the teraphim, and laid it in the bed, and put a quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof, and covered it with a cloth.{S} | אַחַי אַתֶּם, עַצְמִי וּבְשָׂרִי אַתֶּם; וְלָמָּה תִהְיוּ אַחֲרֹנִים, לְהָשִׁיב אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ. | Ye are my brethren, ye are my bone and my flesh; wherefore then should ye be the last to bring back the king?

text_he: וישלח שאול מלאכים לקחת את-דוד ותאמר חלה הוא | And when Saul sent messengers to take David she said 'He is sick'{S} | ולעמשא תמרו הלוא עצמי ובשרי אתה כה יעשה-לי אלהים וכה יוסיף אם-לא שר-צבא תהיה לפני כל-הימים תחת יואב | And say ye to Amasa Art thou not my bone and my flesh God do so to me and more also if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab'
text_en: And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said: 'He is sick.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל מַלְאָכִים, לָקַחַת אֶת-דָּוִד; וַתֹּאמֶר, חֹלֶה הוּא. | And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said: 'He is sick.'{S} | וְלַעֲמָשָׂא, תֹּמְרוּ, הֲלוֹא עַצְמִי וּבְשָׂרִי, אָתָּה; כֹּה יַעֲשֶׂה-לִּי אֱלֹהִים, וְכֹה יוֹסִיף, אִם-לֹא שַׂר-צָבָא תִּהְיֶה לְפָנַי כָּל-הַיָּמִים, תַּחַת יוֹאָב. | And say ye to Amasa: Art thou not my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.'

text_he: וישלח שאול את-המלאכים לראות את-דוד לאמר העלו אתו במטה אלי להמתו | And Saul sent the messengers to see David saying 'Bring him up to me in the bed that I may slay him' | ויט את-לב כל-איש-יהודה כאיש אחד וישלחו אל-המלך שוב אתה וכל-עבדיך | And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah even as the heart of one man so that they sent unto the king 'Return thou and all thy servants'
text_en: And Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying: 'Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may slay him.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל אֶת-הַמַּלְאָכִים, לִרְאוֹת אֶת-דָּוִד לֵאמֹר: הַעֲלוּ אֹתוֹ בַמִּטָּה אֵלַי, לַהֲמִתוֹ. | And Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying: 'Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may slay him.' | וַיַּט אֶת-לְבַב כָּל-אִישׁ-יְהוּדָה, כְּאִישׁ אֶחָד; וַיִּשְׁלְחוּ, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, שׁוּב אַתָּה, וְכָל-עֲבָדֶיךָ. | And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent unto the king: 'Return thou, and all thy servants.'

text_he: ויבאו המלאכים והנה התרפים אל-המטה וכביר העזים מראשתיו | And when the messengers came in behold the teraphim was in the bed with the quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof{S} | וישב המלך ויבא עד-הירדן ויהודה בא הגלגלה לכת לקראת המלך להעביר את-המלך את-הירדן | So the king returned and came to the Jordan And Judah came to Gilgal to go to meet the king to bring the king over the Jordan
text_en: And when the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹאוּ, הַמַּלְאָכִים, וְהִנֵּה הַתְּרָפִים, אֶל-הַמִּטָּה; וּכְבִיר הָעִזִּים, מְרַאֲשֹׁתָיו. | And when the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the quilt of goats' hair at the head thereof.{S} | וַיָּשָׁב הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיָּבֹא עַד-הַיַּרְדֵּן; וִיהוּדָה בָּא הַגִּלְגָּלָה, לָלֶכֶת לִקְרַאת הַמֶּלֶךְ, לְהַעֲבִיר אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן. | So the king returned, and came to the Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to bring the king over the Jordan.

text_he: ויאמר שאול אל-מיכל למה כה רמיתני ותשלחי את-איבי וימלט ותאמר מיכל אל-שאול הוא-אמר אלי שלחני למה אמיתך | And Saul said unto Michal 'Why hast thou deceived me thus and let mine enemy go that he is escaped' And Michal answered Saul 'He said unto me Let me go why should I kill thee' | וימהר שמעי בן-גרא בן-הימיני אשר מבחורים וירד עם-איש יהודה לקראת המלך דוד | And Shimei the son of Gera the Benjamite who was of Bahurim made haste and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David
text_en: And Saul said unto Michal: 'Why hast thou deceived me thus, and let mine enemy go, that he is escaped?' And Michal answered Saul: 'He said unto me: Let me go; why should I kill thee?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל אֶל-מִיכַל, לָמָּה כָּכָה רִמִּיתִנִי, וַתְּשַׁלְּחִי אֶת-אֹיְבִי, וַיִּמָּלֵט; וַתֹּאמֶר מִיכַל אֶל-שָׁאוּל, הוּא-אָמַר אֵלַי שַׁלְּחִנִי לָמָה אֲמִיתֵךְ. | And Saul said unto Michal: 'Why hast thou deceived me thus, and let mine enemy go, that he is escaped?' And Michal answered Saul: 'He said unto me: Let me go; why should I kill thee?' | וַיְמַהֵר, שִׁמְעִי בֶן-גֵּרָא בֶּן-הַיְמִינִי, אֲשֶׁר, מִבַּחוּרִים; וַיֵּרֶד עִם-אִישׁ יְהוּדָה, לִקְרַאת הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד. | And Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, who was of Bahurim, made haste and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.

text_he: ודוד ברח וימלט ויבא אל-שמואל הרמתה ויגד-לו את כל-אשר עשה-לו שאול וילך הוא ושמואל וישבו בנוית (בניות) | Now David fled and escaped and came to Samuel to Ramah and told him all that Saul had done to him And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth | ואלף איש עמו מבנימן וציבא נער בית שאול וחמשת עשר בניו ועשרים עבדיו אתו וצלחו הירדן לפני המלך | And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him And they rushed into the Jordan before the king
text_en: Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth.
text_pisuk: וְדָוִד בָּרַח וַיִּמָּלֵט, וַיָּבֹא אֶל-שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתָה, וַיַּגֶּד-לוֹ, אֵת כָּל-אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה-לוֹ שָׁאוּל; וַיֵּלֶךְ הוּא וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וַיֵּשְׁבוּ בנוית (בְּנָיוֹת). | Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth. | וְאֶלֶף אִישׁ עִמּוֹ, מִבִּנְיָמִן, וְצִיבָא נַעַר בֵּית שָׁאוּל, וַחֲמֵשֶׁת עָשָׂר בָּנָיו וְעֶשְׂרִים עֲבָדָיו אִתּוֹ; וְצָלְחוּ הַיַּרְדֵּן, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him. And they rushed into the Jordan before the king.

text_he: ויגד לשאול לאמר הנה דוד בנוית (בניות) ברמה | And it was told Saul saying 'Behold David is at Naioth in Ramah' | ועברה העברה לעביר את-בית המלך ולעשות הטוב בעינו ושמעי בן-גרא נפל לפני המלך בעברו בירדן | And the ferryboat passed to and fro to bring over the king's household and to do what he thought good And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king when he would go over the Jordan
text_en: And it was told Saul, saying: 'Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.'
text_pisuk: וַיֻּגַּד לְשָׁאוּל, לֵאמֹר: הִנֵּה דָוִד, בנוית (בְּנָיוֹת) בָּרָמָה. | And it was told Saul, saying: 'Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.' | וְעָבְרָה הָעֲבָרָה, לַעֲבִיר אֶת-בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְלַעֲשׂוֹת הַטּוֹב, בְּעֵינָו; וְשִׁמְעִי בֶן-גֵּרָא, נָפַל לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, בְּעָבְרוֹ, בַּיַּרְדֵּן. | And the ferryboat passed to and fro to bring over the king's household, and to do what he thought good. And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, when he would go over the Jordan.

text_he: וישלח שאול מלאכים לקחת את-דוד וירא את-להקת הנביאים נבאים ושמואל עמד נצב עליהם ותהי על-מלאכי שאול רוח אלהים ויתנבאו גם-המה | And Saul sent messengers to take David and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying and Samuel standing as head over them the spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul and they also prophesied | ויאמר אל-המלך אל-יחשב-לי אדני עון ואל-תזכר את אשר העוה עבדך ביום אשר-יצא אדני-המלך מירושלם--לשום המלך אל-לבו | And he said unto the king 'Let not my lord impute iniquity unto me neither do thou remember that which thy servant did iniquitously the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem that the king should take it to his heart
text_en: And Saul sent messengers to take David; and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, the spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שָׁאוּל מַלְאָכִים, לָקַחַת אֶת-דָּוִד, וַיַּרְא אֶת-לַהֲקַת הַנְּבִיאִים נִבְּאִים, וּשְׁמוּאֵל עֹמֵד נִצָּב עֲלֵיהֶם; וַתְּהִי עַל-מַלְאֲכֵי שָׁאוּל, רוּחַ אֱלֹהִים, וַיִּתְנַבְּאוּ, גַּם-הֵמָּה. | And Saul sent messengers to take David; and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, the spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, אַל-יַחֲשָׁב-לִי אֲדֹנִי עָון, וְאַל-תִּזְכֹּר אֵת אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱוָה עַבְדְּךָ, בַּיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר-יָצָא אֲדֹנִי-הַמֶּלֶךְ מִירוּשָׁלִָם--לָשׂוּם הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֶל-לִבּוֹ. | And he said unto the king: 'Let not my lord impute iniquity unto me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did iniquitously the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.

text_he: ויגדו לשאול וישלח מלאכים אחרים ויתנבאו גם-המה ויסף שאול וישלח מלאכים שלשים ויתנבאו גם-המה | And when it was told Saul he sent other messengers and they also prophesied{S}And Saul sent messengers again the third time and they also prophesied | כי ידע עבדך כי אני חטאתי והנה-באתי היום ראשון לכל-בית יוסף לרדת לקראת אדני המלך | For thy servant doth know that I have sinned therefore behold I am come this day the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king'{S}
text_en: And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied.{S}And Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied.
text_pisuk: וַיַּגִּדוּ לְשָׁאוּל, וַיִּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכִים אֲחֵרִים, וַיִּתְנַבְּאוּ, גַּם-הֵמָּה;  וַיֹּסֶף שָׁאוּל, וַיִּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכִים שְׁלִשִׁים, וַיִּתְנַבְּאוּ, גַּם-הֵמָּה. | And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied.{S}And Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied. | כִּי יָדַע עַבְדְּךָ, כִּי אֲנִי חָטָאתִי; וְהִנֵּה-בָאתִי הַיּוֹם, רִאשׁוֹן לְכָל-בֵּית יוֹסֵף, לָרֶדֶת, לִקְרַאת אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | For thy servant doth know that I have sinned; therefore, behold, I am come this day the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.'{S}

text_he: וילך גם-הוא הרמתה ויבא עד-בור הגדול אשר בשכו וישאל ויאמר איפה שמואל ודוד ויאמר הנה בנוית (בניות) ברמה | Then went he also to Ramah and came to the great cistern that is in Secu and he asked and said 'Where are Samuel and David' And one said 'Behold they are at Naioth in Ramah' | ויען אבישי בן-צרויה ויאמר התחת זאת לא יומת שמעי כי קל את-משיח יהוה | But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said 'Shall not Shimei be put to death for this because he cursed the LORD'S anointed'{S}
text_en: Then went he also to Ramah, and came to the great cistern that is in Secu; and he asked and said: 'Where are Samuel and David?' And one said: 'Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.'
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ גַּם-הוּא הָרָמָתָה, וַיָּבֹא עַד-בּוֹר הַגָּדוֹל אֲשֶׁר בַּשֶּׂכוּ, וַיִּשְׁאַל וַיֹּאמֶר, אֵיפֹה שְׁמוּאֵל וְדָוִד; וַיֹּאמֶר, הִנֵּה בנוית (בְּנָיוֹת) בָּרָמָה. | Then went he also to Ramah, and came to the great cistern that is in Secu; and he asked and said: 'Where are Samuel and David?' And one said: 'Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.' | וַיַּעַן אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, וַיֹּאמֶר, הֲתַחַת זֹאת, לֹא יוּמַת שִׁמְעִי: כִּי קִלֵּל, אֶת-מְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה. | But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said: 'Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD'S anointed?'{S}

text_he: וילך שם אל-נוית (ניות) ברמה ותהי עליו גם-הוא רוח אלהים וילך הלוך ויתנבא עד-באו בנוית (בניות) ברמה | And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah and the spirit of God came upon him also and he went on and prophesied until he came to Naioth in Ramah | ויאמר דוד מה-לי ולכם בני צרויה--כי-תהיו-לי היום לשטן היום יומת איש בישראל--כי הלוא ידעתי כי היום אני-מלך על-ישראל | And David said 'What have I to do with you ye sons of Zeruiah that ye should this day be adversaries unto me shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel'
text_en: And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah; and the spirit of God came upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ שָׁם, אֶל-נוית (נָיוֹת) בָּרָמָה; וַתְּהִי עָלָיו גַּם-הוּא רוּחַ אֱלֹהִים, וַיֵּלֶךְ הָלוֹךְ וַיִּתְנַבֵּא, עַד-בֹּאוֹ, בנוית (בְּנָיוֹת) בָּרָמָה. | And he went thither to Naioth in Ramah; and the spirit of God came upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah. | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, מַה-לִּי וְלָכֶם בְּנֵי צְרוּיָה--כִּי-תִהְיוּ-לִי הַיּוֹם, לְשָׂטָן; הַיּוֹם, יוּמַת אִישׁ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל--כִּי הֲלוֹא יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי הַיּוֹם אֲנִי-מֶלֶךְ עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And David said: 'What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries unto me? shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?'

text_he: ויפשט גם-הוא בגדיו ויתנבא גם-הוא לפני שמואל ויפל ערם כל-היום הוא וכל-הלילה על-כן יאמרו--הגם שאול בנביאם | And he also stripped off his clothes and he also prophesied before Samuel and lay down naked all that day and all that night Wherefore they say 'Is Saul also among the prophets' | ויאמר המלך אל-שמעי לא תמות וישבע לו המלך | And the king said unto Shimei 'Thou shalt not die' And the king swore unto him{S}
text_en: And he also stripped off his clothes, and he also prophesied before Samuel, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say: 'Is Saul also among the prophets?'
text_pisuk: וַיִּפְשַׁט גַּם-הוּא בְּגָדָיו, וַיִּתְנַבֵּא גַם-הוּא לִפְנֵי שְׁמוּאֵל, וַיִּפֹּל עָרֹם, כָּל-הַיּוֹם הַהוּא וְכָל-הַלָּיְלָה; עַל-כֵּן, יֹאמְרוּ--הֲגַם שָׁאוּל, בַּנְּבִיאִם. | And he also stripped off his clothes, and he also prophesied before Samuel, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Wherefore they say: 'Is Saul also among the prophets?' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-שִׁמְעִי, לֹא תָמוּת; וַיִּשָּׁבַע לוֹ, הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And the king said unto Shimei: 'Thou shalt not die.' And the king swore unto him.{S}

text_he: ויברח דוד מנות (מניות) ברמה ויבא ויאמר לפני יהונתן מה עשיתי מה-עוני ומה-חטאתי לפני אביך--כי מבקש את-נפשי | And David fled from Naioth in Ramah and came and said before Jonathan 'What have I done what is mine iniquity and what is my sin before thy father that he seeketh my life' | ושם נקרא איש בליעל ושמו שבע בן-בכרי--איש ימיני ויתקע בשפר ויאמר אין-לנו חלק בדוד ולא נחלה-לנו בן-ישי--איש לאהליו ישראל | Now there happened to be there a base fellow whose name was Sheba the son of Bichri a Benjamite and he blew the horn and said 'We have no portion in David neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse every man to his tents O Israel'
text_en: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan: 'What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life?'
text_pisuk: וַיִּבְרַח דָּוִד, מנוות (מִנָּיוֹת) בָּרָמָה; וַיָּבֹא וַיֹּאמֶר לִפְנֵי יְהוֹנָתָן, מֶה עָשִׂיתִי מֶה-עֲונִי וּמֶה-חַטָּאתִי לִפְנֵי אָבִיךָ--כִּי מְבַקֵּשׁ, אֶת-נַפְשִׁי. | And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan: 'What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life?' | וְשָׁם נִקְרָא אִישׁ בְּלִיַּעַל, וּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי--אִישׁ יְמִינִי; וַיִּתְקַע בַּשֹּׁפָר, וַיֹּאמֶר אֵין-לָנוּ חֵלֶק בְּדָוִד וְלֹא נַחֲלָה-לָנוּ בְּבֶן-יִשַׁי--אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָיו, יִשְׂרָאֵל. | Now there happened to be there a base fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite; and he blew the horn, and said: 'We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse; every man to his tents, O Israel.'

text_he: ויאמר לו חלילה לא תמות--הנה לו-עשה (לא-יעשה) אבי דבר גדול או דבר קטן ולא יגלה את-אזני ומדוע יסתיר אבי מני את-הדבר הזה אין זאת | And he said unto him 'Far from it thou shalt not die behold my father doeth nothing either great or small but that he discloseth it unto me and why should my father hide this thing from me it is not so' | ויעל כל-איש ישראל מאחרי דוד אחרי שבע בן-בכרי ואיש יהודה דבקו במלכם מן-הירדן ועד-ירושלם | So all the men of Israel went up from following David and followed Sheba the son of Bichri but the men of Judah did cleave unto their king from the Jordan even to Jerusalem
text_en: And he said unto him: 'Far from it; thou shalt not die; behold, my father doeth nothing either great or small, but that he discloseth it unto me; and why should my father hide this thing from me? it is not so.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ חָלִילָה, לֹא תָמוּת--הִנֵּה לו-עשה (לֹא-יַעֲשֶׂה) אָבִי דָּבָר גָּדוֹל אוֹ דָּבָר קָטֹן, וְלֹא יִגְלֶה אֶת-אָזְנִי; וּמַדּוּעַ יַסְתִּיר אָבִי מִמֶּנִּי אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה, אֵין זֹאת. | And he said unto him: 'Far from it; thou shalt not die; behold, my father doeth nothing either great or small, but that he discloseth it unto me; and why should my father hide this thing from me? it is not so.' | וַיַּעַל כָּל-אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מֵאַחֲרֵי דָוִד, אַחֲרֵי, שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי; וְאִישׁ יְהוּדָה דָּבְקוּ בְמַלְכָּם, מִן-הַיַּרְדֵּן וְעַד-יְרוּשָׁלִָם. | So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah did cleave unto their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.

text_he: וישבע עוד דוד ויאמר ידע ידע אביך כי-מצאתי חן בעיניך ויאמר אל-ידע-זאת יהונתן פן-יעצב ואולם חי-יהוה וחי נפשך--כי כפשע ביני ובין המות | And David swore moreover and said 'Thy father knoweth well that I have found favour in thine eyes and he saith Let not Jonathan know this lest he be grieved but truly as the LORD liveth and as thy soul liveth there is but a step between me and death' | ויבא דוד אל-ביתו ירושלם ויקח המלך את עשר-נשים פלגשים אשר הניח לשמר הבית ויתנם בית-משמרת ויכלכלם ואליהם לא-בא ותהינה צרות עד-יום מתן אלמנות חיות | And David came to his house at Jerusalem and the king took the ten women his concubines whom he had left to keep the house and put them in ward and provided them with sustenance but went not in unto them So they were shut up unto the day of their death in widowhood with their husband alive{S}
text_en: And David swore moreover, and said: 'Thy father knoweth well that I have found favour in thine eyes; and he saith: Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved; but truly as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשָּׁבַע עוֹד דָּוִד, וַיֹּאמֶר יָדֹעַ יָדַע אָבִיךָ כִּי-מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ, וַיֹּאמֶר אַל-יֵדַע-זֹאת יְהוֹנָתָן, פֶּן-יֵעָצֵב; וְאוּלָם, חַי-יְהוָה וְחֵי נַפְשֶׁךָ--כִּי כְפֶשַׂע, בֵּינִי וּבֵין הַמָּוֶת. | And David swore moreover, and said: 'Thy father knoweth well that I have found favour in thine eyes; and he saith: Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved; but truly as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.' | וַיָּבֹא דָוִד אֶל-בֵּיתוֹ, יְרוּשָׁלִַם, וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵת עֶשֶׂר-נָשִׁים פִּלַגְשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הִנִּיחַ לִשְׁמֹר הַבַּיִת וַיִּתְּנֵם בֵּית-מִשְׁמֶרֶת וַיְכַלְכְּלֵם, וַאֲלֵיהֶם לֹא-בָא; וַתִּהְיֶינָה צְרֻרוֹת עַד-יוֹם מֻתָן, אַלְמְנוּת חַיּוּת. | And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and provided them with sustenance, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, in widowhood, with their husband alive.{S}

text_he: ויאמר יהונתן אל-דוד מה-תאמר נפשך ואעשה-לך | Then said Jonathan unto David 'What doth thy soul desire that I should do it for thee' | ויאמר המלך אל-עמשא הזעק-לי את-איש-יהודה שלשת ימים ואתה פה עמד | Then said the king to Amasa 'Call me the men of Judah together within three days and be thou here present'
text_en: Then said Jonathan unto David: 'What doth thy soul desire, that I should do it for thee?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן, אֶל-דָּוִד: מַה-תֹּאמַר נַפְשְׁךָ, וְאֶעֱשֶׂה-לָּךְ. | Then said Jonathan unto David: 'What doth thy soul desire, that I should do it for thee?' | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-עֲמָשָׂא, הַזְעֶק-לִי אֶת-אִישׁ-יְהוּדָה שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים; וְאַתָּה, פֹּה עֲמֹד. | Then said the king to Amasa: 'Call me the men of Judah together within three days, and be thou here present.'

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-יהונתן הנה-חדש מחר ואנכי ישב-אשב עם-המלך לאכול ושלחתני ונסתרתי בשדה עד הערב השלשית | And David said unto Jonathan 'Behold to-morrow is the new moon when I should sit with the king to eat so let me go that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even | וילך עמשא להזעיק את-יהודה ואדוניחר (ויוחר) מן-המועד אשר יעדו | So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him{S}
text_en: And David said unto Jonathan: 'Behold, to-morrow is the new moon, when I should sit with the king to eat; so let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-יְהוֹנָתָן, הִנֵּה-חֹדֶשׁ מָחָר, וְאָנֹכִי יָשֹׁב-אֵשֵׁב עִם-הַמֶּלֶךְ, לֶאֱכוֹל; וְשִׁלַּחְתַּנִי וְנִסְתַּרְתִּי בַשָּׂדֶה, עַד הָעֶרֶב הַשְּׁלִשִׁית. | And David said unto Jonathan: 'Behold, to-morrow is the new moon, when I should sit with the king to eat; so let me go, that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even. | וַיֵּלֶךְ עֲמָשָׂא, לְהַזְעִיק אֶת-יְהוּדָה; וייחר (וַיּוֹחֶר), מִן-הַמּוֹעֵד אֲשֶׁר יְעָדוֹ. | So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together; but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him.{S}
text_notes: יי represents the divine name (Tetragrammaton) and has been replaced with אדוני (Adonai)

text_he: אם-פקד יפקדני אביך ואמרת נשאל נשאל מני דוד לרוץ בית-לחם עירו--כי זבח הימים שם לכל-המשפחה | If thy father miss me at all then say David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Beth-lehem his city for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family | ויאמר דוד אל-אבישי עתה ירע לנו שבע בן-בכרי מן-אבשלום אתה קח את-עבדי אדניך ורדף אחריו--פן-מצא לו ערים בצרות והציל עינו | And David said to Abishai 'Now will Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom take thou thy lord's servants and pursue after him lest he get him fortified cities and escape out of our sight'
text_en: If thy father miss me at all, then say: David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Beth-lehem his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family.
text_pisuk: אִם-פָּקֹד יִפְקְדֵנִי, אָבִיךָ: וְאָמַרְתָּ, נִשְׁאֹל נִשְׁאַל מִמֶּנִּי דָוִד לָרוּץ בֵּית-לֶחֶם עִירוֹ--כִּי זֶבַח הַיָּמִים שָׁם, לְכָל-הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה. | If thy father miss me at all, then say: David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Beth-lehem his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family. | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד, אֶל-אֲבִישַׁי, עַתָּה יֵרַע לָנוּ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי, מִן-אַבְשָׁלוֹם; אַתָּה קַח אֶת-עַבְדֵי אֲדֹנֶיךָ, וּרְדֹף אַחֲרָיו--פֶּן-מָצָא לוֹ עָרִים בְּצֻרוֹת, וְהִצִּיל עֵינֵנוּ. | And David said to Abishai: 'Now will Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom; take thou thy lord's servants, and pursue after him, lest he get him fortified cities, and escape out of our sight.'

text_he: אם-כה יאמר טוב שלום לעבדך ואם-חרה יחרה לו--דע כי-כלתה הרעה מעמו | If he say thus It is well thy servant shall have peace but if he be wroth then know that evil is determined by him | ויצאו אחריו אנשי יואב והכרתי והפלתי וכל-הגברים ויצאו מירושלם לרדף אחרי שבע בן-בכרי | And there went out after him Joab's men and the Cherethites and the Pelethites and all the mighty men and they went out of Jerusalem to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri
text_en: If he say thus: It is well; thy servant shall have peace; but if he be wroth, then know that evil is determined by him.
text_pisuk: אִם-כֹּה יֹאמַר טוֹב, שָׁלוֹם לְעַבְדֶּךָ; וְאִם-חָרֹה יֶחֱרֶה, לוֹ--דַּע, כִּי-כָלְתָה הָרָעָה מֵעִמּוֹ. | If he say thus: It is well; thy servant shall have peace; but if he be wroth, then know that evil is determined by him. | וַיֵּצְאוּ אַחֲרָיו אַנְשֵׁי יוֹאָב, וְהַכְּרֵתִי וְהַפְּלֵתִי וְכָל-הַגִּבֹּרִים; וַיֵּצְאוּ, מִירוּשָׁלִַם, לִרְדֹּף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי. | And there went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

text_he: ועשית חסד על-עבדך כי ברית יהוה הבאת את-עבדך עמך ואם-יש-בי עון המיתני אתה ועד-אביך למה-זה תביאני | Therefore deal kindly with thy servant for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the LORD with thee but if there be in me iniquity slay me thyself for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father' | הם עם-האבן הגדולה אשר בגבעון ועמשא בא לפניהם ויואב חגור מדו לבשו ועלו חגור חרב מצמדת על-מתניו בתערה והוא יצא ותפל | When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon Amasa came to meet them And Joab was girded with his apparel of war that he had put on and thereon was a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof and as he went forth it fell out{S}
text_en: Therefore deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the LORD with thee; but if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?'
text_pisuk: וְעָשִׂיתָ חֶסֶד, עַל-עַבְדֶּךָ, כִּי בִּבְרִית יְהוָה, הֵבֵאתָ אֶת-עַבְדְּךָ עִמָּךְ; וְאִם-יֶשׁ-בִּי עָון הֲמִיתֵנִי אַתָּה, וְעַד-אָבִיךָ לָמָּה-זֶּה תְבִיאֵנִי. | Therefore deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the LORD with thee; but if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?' | הֵם, עִם-הָאֶבֶן הַגְּדוֹלָה אֲשֶׁר בְּגִבְעוֹן, וַעֲמָשָׂא, בָּא לִפְנֵיהֶם; וְיוֹאָב חָגוּר מִדּוֹ לְבֻשׁוֹ, וְעָלָו חֲגוֹר חֶרֶב מְצֻמֶּדֶת עַל-מָתְנָיו בְּתַעְרָהּ, וְהוּא יָצָא, וַתִּפֹּל. | When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. And Joab was girded with his apparel of war that he had put on, and thereon was a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.{S}

text_he: ויאמר יהונתן חלילה לך כי אם-ידע אדע כי-כלתה הרעה מעם אבי לבוא עליך--ולא אתה אגיד לך | And Jonathan said 'Far be it from thee for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee then would not I tell it thee{S} | ויאמר יואב לעמשא השלום אתה אחי ותחז יד-ימין יואב בזקן עמשא--לנשק-לו | And Joab said to Amasa 'Is it well with thee my brother' And Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him
text_en: And Jonathan said: 'Far be it from thee; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן, חָלִילָה לָּךְ: כִּי אִם-יָדֹעַ אֵדַע, כִּי-כָלְתָה הָרָעָה מֵעִם אָבִי לָבוֹא עָלֶיךָ--וְלֹא אֹתָהּ, אַגִּיד לָךְ. | And Jonathan said: 'Far be it from thee; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב לַעֲמָשָׂא, הֲשָׁלוֹם אַתָּה אָחִי; וַתֹּחֶז יַד-יְמִין יוֹאָב, בִּזְקַן עֲמָשָׂא--לִנְשָׁק-לוֹ. | And Joab said to Amasa: 'Is it well with thee, my brother?' And Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.

text_he: ויאמר דוד אל-יהונתן מי יגיד לי או מה-יענך אביך קשה | Then said David to Jonathan 'Who shall tell me if perchance thy father answer thee roughly'{S} | ועמשא לא-נשמר בחרב אשר ביד-יואב ויכהו בה אל-החמש וישפך מעיו ארצה ולא-שנה לו--וימת ויואב ואבישי אחיו רדף אחרי שבע בן-בכרי | But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand so he smote him therewith in the groin and shed out his bowels to the ground and struck him not again and he died And Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri
text_en: Then said David to Jonathan: 'Who shall tell me if perchance thy father answer thee roughly?'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-יְהוֹנָתָן, מִי יַגִּיד לִי; אוֹ מַה-יַּעַנְךָ אָבִיךָ, קָשָׁה. | Then said David to Jonathan: 'Who shall tell me if perchance thy father answer thee roughly?'{S} | וַעֲמָשָׂא לֹא-נִשְׁמַר בַּחֶרֶב אֲשֶׁר בְּיַד-יוֹאָב, וַיַּכֵּהוּ בָהּ אֶל-הַחֹמֶשׁ וַיִּשְׁפֹּךְ מֵעָיו אַרְצָה וְלֹא-שָׁנָה לוֹ--וַיָּמֹת; וְיוֹאָב, וַאֲבִישַׁי אָחִיו, רָדַף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי. | But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand; so he smote him therewith in the groin, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. And Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

text_he: ויאמר יהונתן אל-דוד לכה ונצא השדה ויצאו שניהם השדה | And Jonathan said unto David 'Come and let us go out into the field' And they went out both of them into the field{S} | ואיש עמד עליו מנערי יואב ויאמר מי אשר חפץ ביואב ומי אשר-לדוד--אחרי יואב | And there stood by him one of Joab's young men and said 'He that favoureth Joab and he that is for David let him follow Joab'
text_en: And Jonathan said unto David: 'Come and let us go out into the field.' And they went out both of them into the field.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן אֶל-דָּוִד, לְכָה וְנֵצֵא הַשָּׂדֶה; וַיֵּצְאוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם, הַשָּׂדֶה. | And Jonathan said unto David: 'Come and let us go out into the field.' And they went out both of them into the field.{S} | וְאִישׁ עָמַד עָלָיו, מִנַּעֲרֵי יוֹאָב; וַיֹּאמֶר, מִי אֲשֶׁר חָפֵץ בְּיוֹאָב וּמִי אֲשֶׁר-לְדָוִד--אַחֲרֵי יוֹאָב. | And there stood by him one of Joab's young men, and said: 'He that favoureth Joab, and he that is for David let him follow Joab.'

text_he: ויאמר יהונתן אל-דוד יהוה אלהי ישראל כי-אחקר את-אבי כעת מחר השלשית והנה-טוב אל-דוד--ולא-אז אשלח אליך וגליתי את-אזנך | And Jonathan said unto David 'The LORD the God of Israel--when I have sounded my father about this time to-morrow or the third day behold if there be good toward David shall I not then send unto thee and disclose it unto thee | ועמשא מתגל בדם בתוך המסלה וירא האיש כי-עמד כל-העם ויסב את-עמשא מן-המסלה השדה וישלך עליו בגד כאשר ראה כל-הבא עליו ועמד | And Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway And when the man saw that all the people stood still he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field and cast a garment over him when he saw that every one that came by him stood still
text_en: And Jonathan said unto David: 'The LORD, the God of Israel--when I have sounded my father about this time to-morrow, or the third day, behold, if there be good toward David, shall I not then send unto thee, and disclose it unto thee?
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן אֶל-דָּוִד, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי-אֶחְקֹר אֶת-אָבִי כָּעֵת מָחָר הַשְּׁלִשִׁית, וְהִנֵּה-טוֹב, אֶל-דָּוִד--וְלֹא-אָז אֶשְׁלַח אֵלֶיךָ, וְגָלִיתִי אֶת-אָזְנֶךָ. | And Jonathan said unto David: 'The LORD, the God of Israel--when I have sounded my father about this time to-morrow, or the third day, behold, if there be good toward David, shall I not then send unto thee, and disclose it unto thee? | וַעֲמָשָׂא מִתְגֹּלֵל בַּדָּם, בְּתוֹךְ הַמְסִלָּה; וַיַּרְא הָאִישׁ כִּי-עָמַד כָּל-הָעָם, וַיַּסֵּב אֶת-עֲמָשָׂא מִן-הַמְסִלָּה הַשָּׂדֶה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ עָלָיו בֶּגֶד, כַּאֲשֶׁר רָאָה, כָּל-הַבָּא עָלָיו וְעָמָד. | And Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.

text_he: כה-יעשה יהוה ליהונתן וכה יסיף כי-יטב אל-אבי את-הרעה עליך--וגליתי את-אזנך ושלחתיך והלכת לשלום ויהי יהוה עמך כאשר היה עם-אבי | The LORD do so to Jonathan and more also should it please my father to do thee evil if I disclose it not unto thee and send thee away that thou mayest go in peace and the LORD be with thee as He hath been with my father | כאשר הגה מן-המסלה--עבר כל-איש אחרי יואב לרדף אחרי שבע בן-בכרי | When he was removed out of the highway all the people went on after Joab to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri
text_en: The LORD do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my father to do thee evil, if I disclose it not unto thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace; and the LORD be with thee, as He hath been with my father.
text_pisuk: כֹּה-יַעֲשֶׂה יְהוָה לִיהוֹנָתָן וְכֹה יֹסִיף, כִּי-יֵיטִב אֶל-אָבִי אֶת-הָרָעָה עָלֶיךָ--וְגָלִיתִי אֶת-אָזְנֶךָ, וְשִׁלַּחְתִּיךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ לְשָׁלוֹם; וִיהִי יְהוָה עִמָּךְ, כַּאֲשֶׁר הָיָה עִם-אָבִי. | The LORD do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my father to do thee evil, if I disclose it not unto thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace; and the LORD be with thee, as He hath been with my father. | כַּאֲשֶׁר הֹגָה, מִן-הַמְסִלָּה--עָבַר כָּל-אִישׁ, אַחֲרֵי יוֹאָב, לִרְדֹּף, אַחֲרֵי שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי. | When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

text_he: ולא אם-עודני חי ולא-תעשה עמדי חסד יהוה ולא אמות | And thou shalt not only while yet I live show me the kindness of the LORD that I die not | ויעבר בכל-שבטי ישראל אבלה ובית מעכה--וכל-הברים ויקלהו (ויקהלו) ויבאו אף-אחריו | And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel and to Beth-maacah and all the Berites{S}and they were gathered together and went in also after him
text_en: And thou shalt not only while yet I live show me the kindness of the LORD, that I die not;
text_pisuk: וְלֹא, אִם-עוֹדֶנִּי חָי; וְלֹא-תַעֲשֶׂה עִמָּדִי חֶסֶד יְהוָה, וְלֹא אָמוּת. | And thou shalt not only while yet I live show me the kindness of the LORD, that I die not; | וַיַּעֲבֹר בְּכָל-שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָבֵלָה וּבֵית מַעֲכָה--וְכָל-הַבֵּרִים;  ויקלהו (וַיִּקָּהֲלוּ), וַיָּבֹאוּ אַף-אַחֲרָיו. | And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Beth-maacah, and all the Berites;{S}and they were gathered together, and went in also after him.

text_he: ולא-תכרית את-חסדך מעם ביתי עד-עולם ולא בהכרת יהוה את-איבי דוד איש מעל פני האדמה | but also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever no not when the LORD hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth' | ויבאו ויצרו עליו באבלה בית המעכה וישפכו סלה אל-העיר ותעמד בחל וכל-העם אשר את-יואב משחיתם להפיל החומה | And they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maacah and they cast up a mound against the city and it stood in the moat and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall to throw it down
text_en: but also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever; no, not when the LORD hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.'
text_pisuk: וְלֹא-תַכְרִית אֶת-חַסְדְּךָ מֵעִם בֵּיתִי, עַד-עוֹלָם; וְלֹא, בְּהַכְרִת יְהוָה אֶת-אֹיְבֵי דָוִד, אִישׁ, מֵעַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה. | but also thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever; no, not when the LORD hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.' | וַיָּבֹאוּ וַיָּצֻרוּ עָלָיו, בְּאָבֵלָה בֵּית הַמַּעֲכָה, וַיִּשְׁפְּכוּ סֹלְלָה אֶל-הָעִיר, וַתַּעֲמֹד בַּחֵל; וְכָל-הָעָם אֲשֶׁר אֶת-יוֹאָב, מַשְׁחִיתִם לְהַפִּיל הַחוֹמָה. | And they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood in the moat; and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

text_he: ויכרת יהונתן עם-בית דוד ובקש יהוה מיד איבי דוד | So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David 'The LORD even require it at the hand of David's enemies' | ותקרא אשה חכמה מן-העיר שמעו שמעו אמרו-נא אל-יואב קרב עד-הנה ואדברה אליך | Then cried a wise woman out of the city 'Hear hear say I pray you unto Joab Come near hither that I may speak with thee'
text_en: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David: 'The LORD even require it at the hand of David's enemies.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּכְרֹת יְהוֹנָתָן, עִם-בֵּית דָּוִד; וּבִקֵּשׁ יְהוָה, מִיַּד אֹיְבֵי דָוִד. | So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David: 'The LORD even require it at the hand of David's enemies.' | וַתִּקְרָא אִשָּׁה חֲכָמָה, מִן-הָעִיר; שִׁמְעוּ שִׁמְעוּ, אִמְרוּ-נָא אֶל-יוֹאָב, קְרַב עַד-הֵנָּה, וַאֲדַבְּרָה אֵלֶיךָ. | Then cried a wise woman out of the city: 'Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab: Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.'

text_he: ויוסף יהונתן להשביע את-דוד באהבתו אתו כי-אהבת נפשו אהבו | And Jonathan caused David to swear again for the love that he had to him for he loved him as he loved his own soul{S} | ויקרב אליה ותאמר האשה האתה יואב ויאמר אני ותאמר לו שמע דברי אמתך ויאמר שמע אנכי | And he came near unto her and the woman said 'Art thou Joab' And he answered 'I am' Then she said unto him 'Hear the words of thy handmaid' And he answered 'I do hear'
text_en: And Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that he had to him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיּוֹסֶף יְהוֹנָתָן לְהַשְׁבִּיעַ אֶת-דָּוִד, בְּאַהֲבָתוֹ אֹתוֹ: כִּי-אַהֲבַת נַפְשׁוֹ, אֲהֵבוֹ. | And Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that he had to him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.{S} | וַיִּקְרַב אֵלֶיהָ, וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה הַאַתָּה יוֹאָב וַיֹּאמֶר אָנִי; וַתֹּאמֶר לוֹ, שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי אֲמָתֶךָ, וַיֹּאמֶר, שֹׁמֵעַ אָנֹכִי. | And he came near unto her; and the woman said: 'Art thou Joab?' And he answered: 'I am.' Then she said unto him: 'Hear the words of thy handmaid.' And he answered: 'I do hear.'

text_he: ויאמר-לו יהונתן מחר חדש ונפקדת כי יפקד מושבך | And Jonathan said unto him 'To-morrow is the new moon and thou wilt be missed thy seat will be empty | ותאמר לאמר דבר ידברו בראשנה לאמר שאול ישאלו באבל וכן התמו | Then she spoke saying 'They were wont to speak in old time saying They shall surely ask counsel at Abel and so they ended the matter
text_en: And Jonathan said unto him: 'To-morrow is the new moon; and thou wilt be missed, thy seat will be empty.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר-לוֹ יְהוֹנָתָן, מָחָר חֹדֶשׁ; וְנִפְקַדְתָּ, כִּי יִפָּקֵד מוֹשָׁבֶךָ. | And Jonathan said unto him: 'To-morrow is the new moon; and thou wilt be missed, thy seat will be empty. | וַתֹּאמֶר, לֵאמֹר: דַּבֵּר יְדַבְּרוּ בָרִאשֹׁנָה לֵאמֹר, שָׁאוֹל יְשָׁאֲלוּ בְּאָבֵל וְכֵן הֵתַמּוּ. | Then she spoke, saying: 'They were wont to speak in old time, saying: They shall surely ask counsel at Abel; and so they ended the matter.

text_he: ושלשת תרד מאד ובאת אל-המקום אשר-נסתרת שם ביום המעשה וישבת אצל האבן האזל | And in the third day thou shalt hide thyself well and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself in the day of work and shalt remain by the stone Ezel | אנכי שלמי אמוני ישראל אתה מבקש להמית עיר ואם בישראל--למה תבלע נחלת יהוה | We are of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel seekest thou to destroy a city and a mother in Israel why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD'
text_en: And in the third day thou shalt hide thyself well, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself in the day of work, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.
text_pisuk: וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ, תֵּרֵד מְאֹד, וּבָאתָ אֶל-הַמָּקוֹם, אֲשֶׁר-נִסְתַּרְתָּ שָּׁם בְּיוֹם הַמַּעֲשֶׂה; וְיָשַׁבְתָּ, אֵצֶל הָאֶבֶן הָאָזֶל. | And in the third day thou shalt hide thyself well, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself in the day of work, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel. | אָנֹכִי, שְׁלֻמֵי אֱמוּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ, לְהָמִית עִיר וְאֵם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל--לָמָּה תְבַלַּע, נַחֲלַת יְהוָה. | We are of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel; seekest thou to destroy a city and a mother in Israel? why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?'

text_he: ואני שלשת החצים צדה אורה לשלח-לי למטרה | And I will shoot three arrows to the side-ward as though I shot at a mark | ויען יואב ויאמר חלילה חלילה לי אם-אבלע ואם-אשחית | And Joab answered and said 'Far be it far be it from me that I should swallow up or destroy
text_en: And I will shoot three arrows to the side-ward, as though I shot at a mark.
text_pisuk: וַאֲנִי, שְׁלֹשֶׁת הַחִצִּים צִדָּה אוֹרֶה, לְשַׁלַּח-לִי, לְמַטָּרָה. | And I will shoot three arrows to the side-ward, as though I shot at a mark. | וַיַּעַן יוֹאָב, וַיֹּאמַר: חָלִילָה חָלִילָה לִי, אִם-אֲבַלַּע וְאִם-אַשְׁחִית. | And Joab answered and said: 'Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.

text_he: והנה אשלח את-הנער לך מצא את-החצים אם-אמר אמר לנער הנה החצים מך והנה קחנו ובאה כי-שלום לך ואין דבר--חי-יהוה | And behold I will send the lad Go find the arrows If I say unto the lad Behold the arrows are on this side of thee take them and come for there is peace to thee and no hurt as the LORD liveth | לא-כן הדבר כי איש מהר אפרים שבע בן-בכרי שמו נשא ידו במלך בדוד--תנו-אתו לבדו ואלכה מעל העיר ותאמר האשה אל-יואב הנה ראשו משלך אליך בעד החומה | The matter is not so but a man of the hill-country of Ephraim Sheba the son of Bichri by name hath lifted up his hand against the king even against David deliver him only and I will depart from the city' And the woman said unto Joab 'Behold his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall'
text_en: And, behold, I will send the lad: Go, find the arrows. If I say unto the lad: Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee; take them, and come; for there is peace to thee and no hurt, as the LORD liveth.
text_pisuk: וְהִנֵּה אֶשְׁלַח אֶת-הַנַּעַר, לֵךְ מְצָא אֶת-הַחִצִּים: אִם-אָמֹר אֹמַר לַנַּעַר הִנֵּה הַחִצִּים מִמְּךָ וָהֵנָּה, קָחֶנּוּ וָבֹאָה כִּי-שָׁלוֹם לְךָ וְאֵין דָּבָר--חַי-יְהוָה. | And, behold, I will send the lad: Go, find the arrows. If I say unto the lad: Behold, the arrows are on this side of thee; take them, and come; for there is peace to thee and no hurt, as the LORD liveth. | לֹא-כֵן הַדָּבָר, כִּי אִישׁ מֵהַר אֶפְרַיִם שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי שְׁמוֹ נָשָׂא יָדוֹ בַּמֶּלֶךְ בְּדָוִד--תְּנוּ-אֹתוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, וְאֵלְכָה מֵעַל הָעִיר; וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה אֶל-יוֹאָב, הִנֵּה רֹאשׁוֹ מֻשְׁלָךְ אֵלֶיךָ בְּעַד הַחוֹמָה. | The matter is not so; but a man of the hill-country of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David; deliver him only, and I will depart from the city.' And the woman said unto Joab: 'Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.'

text_he: ואם-כה אמר לעלם הנה החצים מך והלאה--לך כי שלחך יהוה | But if I say thus unto the boy Behold the arrows are beyond thee go thy way for the LORD hath sent thee away | ותבוא האשה אל-כל-העם בחכמתה ויכרתו את-ראש שבע בן-בכרי וישלכו אל-יואב ויתקע בשפר ויפצו מעל-העיר איש לאהליו ויואב שב ירושלם אל-המלך | Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri and threw it out to Joab And he blew the horn and they were dispersed from the city every man to his tent And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king{S}
text_en: But if I say thus unto the boy: Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way; for the LORD hath sent thee away.
text_pisuk: וְאִם-כֹּה אֹמַר לָעֶלֶם, הִנֵּה הַחִצִּים מִמְּךָ וָהָלְאָה--לֵךְ, כִּי שִׁלַּחֲךָ יְהוָה. | But if I say thus unto the boy: Behold, the arrows are beyond thee; go thy way; for the LORD hath sent thee away. | וַתָּבוֹא הָאִשָּׁה אֶל-כָּל-הָעָם בְּחָכְמָתָהּ, וַיִּכְרְתוּ אֶת-רֹאשׁ שֶׁבַע בֶּן-בִּכְרִי וַיַּשְׁלִכוּ אֶל-יוֹאָב, וַיִּתְקַע בַּשֹּׁפָר, וַיָּפֻצוּ מֵעַל-הָעִיר אִישׁ לְאֹהָלָיו; וְיוֹאָב שָׁב יְרוּשָׁלִַם, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ. | Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. And he blew the horn, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king.{S}

text_he: והדבר--אשר דברנו אני ואתה הנה יהוה ביני ובינך עד-עולם | And as touching the matter which I and thou have spoken of behold the LORD is between me and thee for ever'{S} | ויואב אל כל-הצבא ישראל ובניה בן-יהוידע על-הכרי (הכרתי) ועל-הפלתי | Now Joab was over all the host of Israel and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites
text_en: And as touching the matter which I and thou have spoken of, behold, the LORD is between me and thee for ever.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְהַדָּבָר--אֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְנוּ, אֲנִי וָאָתָּה: הִנֵּה יְהוָה בֵּינִי וּבֵינְךָ, עַד-עוֹלָם. | And as touching the matter which I and thou have spoken of, behold, the LORD is between me and thee for ever.'{S} | וְיוֹאָב, אֶל כָּל-הַצָּבָא יִשְׂרָאֵל; וּבְנָיָה, בֶּן-יְהוֹיָדָע, עַל-הכרי (הַכְּרֵתִי), וְעַל-הַפְּלֵתִי. | Now Joab was over all the host of Israel; and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites;

text_he: ויסתר דוד בשדה ויהי החדש וישב המלך על- (אל-) הלחם לאכול | So David hid himself in the field and when the new moon was come the king sat him down to the meal to eat | ואדרם על-המס ויהושפט בן-אחילוד המזכיר | and Adoram was over the levy and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder
text_en: So David hid himself in the field; and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to the meal to eat.
text_pisuk: וַיִּסָּתֵר דָּוִד, בַּשָּׂדֶה; וַיְהִי הַחֹדֶשׁ, וַיֵּשֶׁב הַמֶּלֶךְ על- (אֶל-) הַלֶּחֶם לֶאֱכוֹל. | So David hid himself in the field; and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to the meal to eat. | וַאֲדֹרָם, עַל-הַמַּס; וִיהוֹשָׁפָט בֶּן-אֲחִילוּד, הַמַּזְכִּיר. | and Adoram was over the levy; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder;

text_he: וישב המלך על-מושבו כפעם בפעם אל-מושב הקיר ויקם יהונתן וישב אבנר מצד שאול ויפקד מקום דוד | And the king sat upon his seat as at other times even upon the seat by the wall and Jonathan stood up and Abner sat by Saul's side but David's place was empty | ושיא (ושוא) ספר וצדוק ואביתר כהנים | and Sheva was scribe and Zadok and Abiathar were priests
text_en: And the king sat upon his seat, as at other times, even upon the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side; but David's place was empty.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּשֶׁב הַמֶּלֶךְ עַל-מוֹשָׁבוֹ כְּפַעַם בְּפַעַם, אֶל-מוֹשַׁב הַקִּיר, וַיָּקָם יְהוֹנָתָן, וַיֵּשֶׁב אַבְנֵר מִצַּד שָׁאוּל; וַיִּפָּקֵד, מְקוֹם דָּוִד. | And the king sat upon his seat, as at other times, even upon the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side; but David's place was empty. | ושיא (וּשְׁוָא), סֹפֵר; וְצָדוֹק וְאֶבְיָתָר, כֹּהֲנִים. | and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

text_he: ולא-דבר שאול מאומה ביום הוא כי אמר מקרה הוא בלתי טהור הוא כי-לא טהור | Nevertheless Saul spoke not any thing that day for he thought 'Something hath befallen him he is unclean surely he is not clean'{S} | וגם עירא היארי היה כהן לדוד | and Ira also the Jairite was chief minister unto David{S}
text_en: Nevertheless Saul spoke not any thing that day; for he thought: 'Something hath befallen him, he is unclean; surely he is not clean.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְלֹא-דִבֶּר שָׁאוּל מְאוּמָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא: כִּי אָמַר מִקְרֶה הוּא, בִּלְתִּי טָהוֹר הוּא כִּי-לֹא טָהוֹר. | Nevertheless Saul spoke not any thing that day; for he thought: 'Something hath befallen him, he is unclean; surely he is not clean.'{S} | וְגַם, עִירָא הַיָּאִרִי, הָיָה כֹהֵן, לְדָוִד. | and Ira also the Jairite was chief minister unto David.{S}

text_he: ויהי מחרת החדש השני ויפקד מקום דוד ויאמר שאול אל-יהונתן בנו מדוע לא-בא בן-ישי גם-תמול גם-היום אל-הלחם
text_en: And it came to pass on the morrow after the new moon, which was the second day, that David's place was empty;and Saul said unto Jonathan his son: 'Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to the meal, neither yesterday, nor to-day?'
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, מִמָּחֳרַת הַחֹדֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי, וַיִּפָּקֵד, מְקוֹם דָּוִד; וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, אֶל-יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ, מַדּוּעַ לֹא-בָא בֶן-יִשַׁי גַּם-תְּמוֹל גַּם-הַיּוֹם, אֶל-הַלָּחֶם.

text_he: ויען יהונתן את-שאול נשאל נשאל דוד מעמדי עד-בית לחם
text_en: And Jonathan answered Saul: 'David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Beth-lehem;
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן יְהוֹנָתָן, אֶת-שָׁאוּל: נִשְׁאֹל נִשְׁאַל דָּוִד מֵעִמָּדִי, עַד-בֵּית לָחֶם.

text_he: ויאמר שלחני נא כי זבח משפחה לנו בעיר והוא צוה-לי אחי ועתה אם-מצאתי חן בעיניך אמלטה נא ואראה את-אחי על-כן לא-בא אל-שלחן המלך
text_en: and he said: Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he hath commanded me; and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he is not come unto the king's table.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שַׁלְּחֵנִי נָא כִּי זֶבַח מִשְׁפָּחָה לָנוּ בָּעִיר, וְהוּא צִוָּה-לִי אָחִי, וְעַתָּה אִם-מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ, אִמָּלְטָה נָּא וְאֶרְאֶה אֶת-אֶחָי; עַל-כֵּן לֹא-בָא, אֶל-שֻׁלְחַן הַמֶּלֶךְ.

text_he: ויחר-אף שאול ביהונתן ויאמר לו בן-נעות המרדות הלוא ידעתי כי-בחר אתה לבן-ישי לבשתך ולבשת ערות אמך
text_en: Then Saul's anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him: 'Thou son of perverse rebellion, do not I know that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thine own shame, and unto the shame of thy mother's nakedness?
text_pisuk: וַיִּחַר-אַף שָׁאוּל, בִּיהוֹנָתָן, וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, בֶּן-נַעֲוַת הַמַּרְדּוּת: הֲלוֹא יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי-בֹחֵר אַתָּה לְבֶן-יִשַׁי, לְבָשְׁתְּךָ, וּלְבֹשֶׁת עֶרְוַת אִמֶּךָ.

text_he: כי כל-הימים אשר בן-ישי חי על-האדמה לא תכון אתה ומלכותך ועתה שלח וקח אתו אלי--כי בן-מות הוא
text_en: For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the earth, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he deserveth to die.'{S}
text_pisuk: כִּי כָל-הַיָּמִים, אֲשֶׁר בֶּן-יִשַׁי חַי עַל-הָאֲדָמָה, לֹא תִכּוֹן, אַתָּה וּמַלְכוּתֶךָ; וְעַתָּה, שְׁלַח וְקַח אֹתוֹ אֵלַי--כִּי בֶן-מָוֶת, הוּא.

text_he: ויען יהונתן את-שאול אביו ויאמר אליו למה יומת מה עשה
text_en: And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said unto him: 'Wherefore should he be put to death? what hath he done?'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן, יְהוֹנָתָן, אֶת-שָׁאוּל, אָבִיו; וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו לָמָּה יוּמַת, מֶה עָשָׂה.

text_he: ויטל שאול את-החנית עליו להכתו וידע יהונתן כי-כלה היא מעם אביו להמית את-דוד
text_en: And Saul cast his spear at him to smite him; whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to put David to death.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּטֶל שָׁאוּל אֶת-הַחֲנִית עָלָיו, לְהַכֹּתוֹ; וַיֵּדַע, יְהוֹנָתָן, כִּי-כָלָה הִיא מֵעִם אָבִיו, לְהָמִית אֶת-דָּוִד.

text_he: ויקם יהונתן מעם השלחן בחרי-אף ולא-אכל ביום-החדש השני לחם--כי נעצב אל-דוד כי הכלמו אביו
text_en: So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and did eat no food the second day of the month; for he was grieved for David, and because his father had put him to shame.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם יְהוֹנָתָן מֵעִם הַשֻּׁלְחָן, בָּחֳרִי-אָף; וְלֹא-אָכַל בְּיוֹם-הַחֹדֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי, לֶחֶם--כִּי נֶעְצַב אֶל-דָּוִד, כִּי הִכְלִמוֹ אָבִיו.

text_he: ויהי בקר ויצא יהונתן השדה למועד דוד ונער קטן עמו
text_en: And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad with him.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי בַבֹּקֶר, וַיֵּצֵא יְהוֹנָתָן הַשָּׂדֶה לְמוֹעֵד דָּוִד; וְנַעַר קָטֹן, עִמּוֹ.

text_he: ויאמר לנערו--רץ מצא נא את-החצים אשר אנכי מורה הנער רץ והוא-ירה החצי להעברו
text_en: And he said unto his lad: 'Run, find now the arrows which I shoot.' And as the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר לְנַעֲרוֹ--רֻץ מְצָא נָא אֶת-הַחִצִּים, אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי מוֹרֶה; הַנַּעַר רָץ, וְהוּא-יָרָה הַחֵצִי לְהַעֲבִרוֹ.

text_he: ויבא הנער עד-מקום החצי אשר ירה יהונתן ויקרא יהונתן אחרי הנער ויאמר הלוא החצי מך והלאה
text_en: And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the lad, and said: 'Is not the arrow beyond thee?'
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא הַנַּעַר עַד-מְקוֹם הַחֵצִי, אֲשֶׁר יָרָה יְהוֹנָתָן; וַיִּקְרָא יְהוֹנָתָן אַחֲרֵי הַנַּעַר, וַיֹּאמֶר, הֲלוֹא הַחֵצִי, מִמְּךָ וָהָלְאָה.

text_he: ויקרא יהונתן אחרי הנער מהרה חושה אל-תעמד וילקט נער יהונתן את-החצי (החצים) ויבא אל-אדניו
text_en: And Jonathan cried after the lad: 'Make speed, hasten, stay not.' And Jonathan's lad gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקְרָא יְהוֹנָתָן אַחֲרֵי הַנַּעַר, מְהֵרָה חוּשָׁה אַל-תַּעֲמֹד; וַיְלַקֵּט נַעַר יְהוֹנָתָן, אֶת-החצי (הַחִצִּים), וַיָּבֹא, אֶל-אֲדֹנָיו.

text_he: והנער לא-ידע מאומה אך יהונתן ודוד ידעו את-הדבר
text_en: But the lad knew not any thing; only Jonathan and David knew the matter.{S}
text_pisuk: וְהַנַּעַר, לֹא-יָדַע מְאוּמָה; אַךְ יְהוֹנָתָן וְדָוִד, יָדְעוּ אֶת-הַדָּבָר.

text_he: ויתן יהונתן את-כליו אל-הנער אשר-לו ויאמר לו לך הביא העיר
text_en: And Jonathan gave his weapons unto his lad, and said unto him: 'Go, carry them to the city.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּתֵּן יְהוֹנָתָן אֶת-כֵּלָיו, אֶל-הַנַּעַר אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ; וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, לֵךְ הָבֵיא הָעִיר.

text_he: הנער בא ודוד קם מאצל הנגב ויפל לאפיו ארצה וישתחו שלש פעמים וישקו איש את-רעהו ויבכו איש את-רעהו עד-דוד הגדיל
text_en: And as soon as the lad was gone, David arose out of a place toward the South, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed down three times; and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded.
text_pisuk: הַנַּעַר, בָּא, וְדָוִד קָם מֵאֵצֶל הַנֶּגֶב, וַיִּפֹּל לְאַפָּיו אַרְצָה וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים; וַיִּשְּׁקוּ אִישׁ אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ, וַיִּבְכּוּ אִישׁ אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ, עַד-דָּוִד, הִגְדִּיל.

text_he: ויאמר יהונתן לדוד לך לשלום אשר נשבענו שנינו אנחנו בשם יהוה לאמר יהוה יהיה ביני ובינך ובין זרעי ובין זרעך עד-עולם
text_en: And Jonathan said to David: 'Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of the LORD, saying: The LORD shall be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed, for ever.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן לְדָוִד, לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם: אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְנוּ שְׁנֵינוּ אֲנַחְנוּ, בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה לֵאמֹר, יְהוָה יִהְיֶה בֵּינִי וּבֵינֶךָ וּבֵין זַרְעִי וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ, עַד-עוֹלָם.

text_he: ויקם וילך ויהונתן בא העיר | And he arose and departed and Jonathan went into the city | ויהי רעב בימי דוד שלש שנים שנה אחרי שנה ויבקש דוד את-פני יהוה ויאמר יהוה אל-שאול ואל-בית הדמים על אשר-המית את-הגבענים | And there was a famine in the days of David three years year after year and David sought the face of the LORD{S}And the LORD said 'It is for Saul and for his bloody house because he put to death the Gibeonites'
text_en: And he arose and departed; and Jonathan went into the city.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם, וַיֵּלַךְ; וִיהוֹנָתָן, בָּא הָעִיר. | And he arose and departed; and Jonathan went into the city. | וַיְהִי רָעָב בִּימֵי דָוִד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, שָׁנָה אַחֲרֵי שָׁנָה, וַיְבַקֵּשׁ דָּוִד, אֶת-פְּנֵי יְהוָה;  וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, אֶל-שָׁאוּל וְאֶל-בֵּית הַדָּמִים, עַל אֲשֶׁר-הֵמִית, אֶת-הַגִּבְעֹנִים. | And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David sought the face of the LORD.{S}And the LORD said: 'It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites.'

text_he: ויבא דוד נבה אל-אחימלך הכהן ויחרד אחימלך לקראת דוד ויאמר לו מדוע אתה לבדך ואיש אין אתך | Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest and Ahimelech came to meet David trembling and said unto him 'Why art thou alone and no man with thee' | ויקרא המלך לגבענים ויאמר אליהם והגבענים לא מבני ישראל המה כי אם-מיתר האמרי ובני ישראל נשבעו להם ויבקש שאול להכתם בקנאתו לבני-ישראל ויהודה | And the king called the Gibeonites and said unto them--now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel but of the remnant of the Amorites and the children of Israel had sworn unto them and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah--
text_en: Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest; and Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said unto him: 'Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?'
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא דָוִד נֹבֶה, אֶל-אֲחִימֶלֶךְ הַכֹּהֵן; וַיֶּחֱרַד אֲחִימֶלֶךְ לִקְרַאת דָּוִד, וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ מַדּוּעַ אַתָּה לְבַדֶּךָ, וְאִישׁ, אֵין אִתָּךְ. | Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest; and Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said unto him: 'Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?' | וַיִּקְרָא הַמֶּלֶךְ לַגִּבְעֹנִים, וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם: וְהַגִּבְעֹנִים לֹא מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵמָּה, כִּי אִם-מִיֶּתֶר הָאֱמֹרִי, וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נִשְׁבְּעוּ לָהֶם, וַיְבַקֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל לְהַכֹּתָם בְּקַנֹּאתוֹ לִבְנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוּדָה. | And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them--now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them; and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah--

text_he: ויאמר דוד לאחימלך הכהן המלך צוני דבר ויאמר אלי איש אל-ידע מאומה את-הדבר אשר-אנכי שלחך ואשר צויתך ואת-הנערים יודעתי אל-מקום פלני אלמוני | And David said unto Ahimelech the priest 'The king hath commanded me a business and hath said unto me Let no man know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee and what I have commanded thee and the young men have I appointed to such and such a place | ויאמר דוד אל-הגבענים מה אעשה לכם ובמה אכפר וברכו את-נחלת יהוה | and David said unto the Gibeonites 'What shall I do for you and wherewith shall I make atonement that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD'
text_en: And David said unto Ahimelech the priest: 'The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me: Let no man know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee; and the young men have I appointed to such and such a place.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לַאֲחִימֶלֶךְ הַכֹּהֵן, הַמֶּלֶךְ צִוַּנִי דָבָר, וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי אִישׁ אַל-יֵדַע מְאוּמָה אֶת-הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר-אָנֹכִי שֹׁלֵחֲךָ, וַאֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִךָ; וְאֶת-הַנְּעָרִים יוֹדַעְתִּי, אֶל-מְקוֹם פְּלֹנִי אַלְמוֹנִי. | And David said unto Ahimelech the priest: 'The king hath commanded me a business, and hath said unto me: Let no man know any thing of the business whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee; and the young men have I appointed to such and such a place. | וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-הַגִּבְעֹנִים, מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם; וּבַמָּה אֲכַפֵּר, וּבָרְכוּ אֶת-נַחֲלַת יְהוָה. | and David said unto the Gibeonites: 'What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?'

text_he: ועתה מה-יש תחת-ידך חמשה-לחם--תנה בידי או הנמצא | Now therefore what is under thy hand five loaves of bread give them in my hand or whatsoever there is present' | ויאמרו לו הגבענים אין-לי (לנו) כסף וזהב עם-שאול ועם-ביתו ואין-לנו איש להמית בישראל ויאמר מה-אתם אמרים אעשה לכם | And the Gibeonites said unto him 'It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul or his house neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel' And he said 'What say ye that I should do for you'
text_en: Now therefore what is under thy hand? five loaves of bread? give them in my hand, or whatsoever there is present.'
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה, מַה-יֵּשׁ תַּחַת-יָדְךָ חֲמִשָּׁה-לֶחֶם--תְּנָה בְיָדִי; אוֹ, הַנִּמְצָא. | Now therefore what is under thy hand? five loaves of bread? give them in my hand, or whatsoever there is present.' | וַיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ הַגִּבְעֹנִים, אֵין-לי (לָנוּ) כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב עִם-שָׁאוּל וְעִם-בֵּיתוֹ, וְאֵין-לָנוּ אִישׁ, לְהָמִית בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֹּאמֶר מָה-אַתֶּם אֹמְרִים, אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם. | And the Gibeonites said unto him: 'It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel.' And he said: 'What say ye that I should do for you?'

text_he: ויען הכהן את-דוד ויאמר אין-לחם חל אל-תחת ידי כי-אם-לחם קדש יש אם-נשמרו הנערים אך מאשה | And the priest answered David and said 'There is no common bread under my hand but there is holy bread if only the young men have kept themselves from women' | ויאמרו אל-המלך האיש אשר כלנו ואשר דמה-לנו נשמדנו מהתיצב בכל-גבל ישראל | And they said unto the king 'The man that consumed us and that devised against us so that we have been destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel
text_en: And the priest answered David, and said: 'There is no common bread under my hand, but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן הַכֹּהֵן אֶת-דָּוִד וַיֹּאמֶר, אֵין-לֶחֶם חֹל אֶל-תַּחַת יָדִי: כִּי-אִם-לֶחֶם קֹדֶשׁ יֵשׁ, אִם-נִשְׁמְרוּ הַנְּעָרִים אַךְ מֵאִשָּׁה. | And the priest answered David, and said: 'There is no common bread under my hand, but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.' | וַיֹּאמְרוּ, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר כִּלָּנוּ, וַאֲשֶׁר דִּמָּה-לָנוּ; נִשְׁמַדְנוּ, מֵהִתְיַצֵּב בְּכָל-גְּבֻל יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And they said unto the king: 'The man that consumed us, and that devised against us, so that we have been destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,

text_he: ויען דוד את-הכהן ויאמר לו כי אם-אשה עצרה-לנו כתמול שלשם בצאתי ויהיו כלי-הנערים קדש והוא דרך חל--ואף כי היום יקדש בכלי | And David answered the priest and said unto him 'Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days when I came out the vessels of the young men were holy though it was but a common journey how much more then to-day when there shall be holy bread in their vessels' | ינתן- (יתן-) לנו שבעה אנשים מבניו והוקענום ליהוה בגבעת שאול בחיר יהוה ויאמר המלך אני אתן | let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us and we will hang them up unto the LORD in Gibeah of Saul the chosen of the LORD'And the king said 'I will deliver them'
text_en: And David answered the priest, and said unto him: 'Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days; when I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey; how much more then to-day, when there shall be holy bread in their vessels?'
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן דָּוִד אֶת-הַכֹּהֵן וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, כִּי אִם-אִשָּׁה עֲצֻרָה-לָנוּ כִּתְמוֹל שִׁלְשֹׁם, בְּצֵאתִי, וַיִּהְיוּ כְלֵי-הַנְּעָרִים קֹדֶשׁ: וְהוּא, דֶּרֶךְ חֹל--וְאַף, כִּי הַיּוֹם יִקְדַּשׁ בַּכֶּלִי. | And David answered the priest, and said unto him: 'Of a truth women have been kept from us about these three days; when I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey; how much more then to-day, when there shall be holy bread in their vessels?' | ינתן- (יֻתַּן-) לָנוּ שִׁבְעָה אֲנָשִׁים, מִבָּנָיו, וְהוֹקַעֲנוּם לַיהוָה, בְּגִבְעַת שָׁאוּל בְּחִיר יְהוָה; וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אֲנִי אֶתֵּן. | let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the LORD.'And the king said: 'I will deliver them.'

text_he: ויתן-לו הכהן קדש כי לא-היה שם לחם כי-אם-לחם הפנים המוסרים מלפני יהוה לשום לחם חם ביום הלקחו | So the priest gave him holy bread for there was no bread there but the showbread that was taken from before the LORD to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away-- | ויחמל המלך על-מפיבשת בן-יהונתן בן-שאול על-שבעת יהוה אשר בינתם--בין דוד ובין יהונתן בן-שאול | But the king spared Mephibosheth the son of Jonathan the son of Saul because of the LORD'S oath that was between them between David and Jonathan the son of Saul
text_en: So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the showbread, that was taken from before the LORD, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.--
text_pisuk: וַיִּתֶּן-לוֹ הַכֹּהֵן, קֹדֶשׁ: כִּי לֹא-הָיָה שָׁם לֶחֶם, כִּי-אִם-לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים הַמּוּסָרִים מִלִּפְנֵי יְהוָה, לָשׂוּם לֶחֶם חֹם, בְּיוֹם הִלָּקְחוֹ. | So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the showbread, that was taken from before the LORD, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.-- | וַיַּחְמֹל הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַל-מְפִיבֹשֶׁת בֶּן-יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-שָׁאוּל; עַל-שְׁבֻעַת יְהוָה, אֲשֶׁר בֵּינֹתָם--בֵּין דָּוִד, וּבֵין יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-שָׁאוּל. | But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the LORD'S oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

text_he: ושם איש מעבדי שאול ביום הוא נעצר לפני יהוה ושמו דאג האדמי--אביר הרעים אשר לשאול | Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day detained before the LORD and his name was Doeg the Edomite the chiefest of the herdmen that belonged to Saul-- | ויקח המלך את-שני בני רצפה בת-איה אשר ילדה לשאול את-ארמני ואת-מפבשת ואת-חמשת בני מיכל בת-שאול אשר ילדה לעדריאל בן-ברזלי המחלתי | But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah whom she bore unto Saul Armoni and Mephibosheth and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite
text_en: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the LORD; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chiefest of the herdmen that belonged to Saul.--
text_pisuk: וְשָׁם אִישׁ מֵעַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, נֶעְצָר לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, וּשְׁמוֹ, דֹּאֵג הָאֲדֹמִי--אַבִּיר הָרֹעִים, אֲשֶׁר לְשָׁאוּל. | Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the LORD; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chiefest of the herdmen that belonged to Saul.-- | וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת-שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה, אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְשָׁאוּל, אֶת-אַרְמֹנִי, וְאֶת-מְפִבֹשֶׁת; וְאֶת-חֲמֵשֶׁת, בְּנֵי מִיכַל בַּת-שָׁאוּל, אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְעַדְרִיאֵל בֶּן-בַּרְזִלַּי, הַמְּחֹלָתִי. | But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite;

text_he: ויאמר דוד לאחימלך ואין יש-פה תחת-ידך חנית או-חרב כי גם-חרבי וגם-כלי לא-לקחתי בידי כי-היה דבר-המלך נחוץ | And David said unto Ahimelech 'And is there peradventure here under thy hand spear or sword for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me because the king's business required haste'{S} | ויתנם ביד הגבענים ויקיעם בהר לפני יהוה ויפלו שבעתים (שבעתם) יחד והם (והמה) המתו בימי קציר בראשנים תחלת (בתחלת) קציר שערים | and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites and they hanged them in the mountain before the LORD and they fell all seven together and they were put to death in the days of harvest in the first days at the beginning of barley harvest
text_en: And David said unto Ahimelech: 'And is there peradventure here under thy hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king's business required haste.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לַאֲחִימֶלֶךְ, וְאִין יֶשׁ-פֹּה תַחַת-יָדְךָ חֲנִית אוֹ-חָרֶב: כִּי גַם-חַרְבִּי וְגַם-כֵּלַי לֹא-לָקַחְתִּי בְיָדִי, כִּי-הָיָה דְבַר-הַמֶּלֶךְ נָחוּץ. | And David said unto Ahimelech: 'And is there peradventure here under thy hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king's business required haste.'{S} | וַיִּתְּנֵם בְּיַד הַגִּבְעֹנִים, וַיֹּקִיעֻם בָּהָר לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, וַיִּפְּלוּ שבעתים (שְׁבַעְתָּם), יָחַד; והם (וְהֵמָּה) הֻמְתוּ בִּימֵי קָצִיר, בָּרִאשֹׁנִים, תחלת (בִּתְחִלַּת), קְצִיר שְׂעֹרִים. | and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the mountain before the LORD, and they fell all seven together; and they were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.

text_he: ויאמר הכהן חרב גלית הפלשתי אשר-הכית בעמק האלה הנה-היא לוטה בשמלה אחרי האפוד--אם-אתה תקח-לך קח כי אין אחרת זולתה בזה ויאמר דוד אין כמוה תנה לי | And the priest said 'The sword of Goliath the Philistine whom thou slewest in the vale of Elah behold it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod if thou wilt take that take it for there is no other save that here'{S}And David said 'There is none like that give it me' | ותקח רצפה בת-איה את-השק ותטהו לה אל-הצור מתחלת קציר עד נתך-מים עליהם מן-השמים ולא-נתנה עוף השמים לנוח עליהם יומם ואת-חית השדה לילה | And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it for her upon the rock from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven and she suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day nor the beasts of the field by night
text_en: And the priest said: 'The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the vale of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod; if thou wilt take that, take it; for there is no other save that here.'{S}And David said: 'There is none like that; give it me.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַכֹּהֵן, חֶרֶב גָּלְיָת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי אֲשֶׁר-הִכִּיתָ בְּעֵמֶק הָאֵלָה הִנֵּה-הִיא לוּטָה בַשִּׂמְלָה אַחֲרֵי הָאֵפוֹד--אִם-אֹתָהּ תִּקַּח-לְךָ קָח, כִּי אֵין אַחֶרֶת זוּלָתָהּ בָּזֶה;  וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֵין כָּמוֹהָ, תְּנֶנָּה לִּי. | And the priest said: 'The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the vale of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod; if thou wilt take that, take it; for there is no other save that here.'{S}And David said: 'There is none like that; give it me.' | וַתִּקַּח רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה אֶת-הַשַּׂק וַתַּטֵּהוּ לָהּ אֶל-הַצּוּר, מִתְּחִלַּת קָצִיר, עַד נִתַּךְ-מַיִם עֲלֵיהֶם, מִן-הַשָּׁמָיִם; וְלֹא-נָתְנָה עוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם לָנוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם, יוֹמָם, וְאֶת-חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה, לָיְלָה. | And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven; and she suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.

text_he: ויקם דוד ויברח ביום-הוא מפני שאול ויבא אל-אכיש מלך גת | And David arose and fled that day for fear of Saul and went to Achish the king of Gath | ויגד לדוד את אשר-עשתה רצפה בת-איה פלגש שאול | And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah the concubine of Saul had done
text_en: And David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, וַיִּבְרַח בַּיּוֹם-הַהוּא מִפְּנֵי שָׁאוּל; וַיָּבֹא, אֶל-אָכִישׁ מֶלֶךְ גַּת. | And David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath. | וַיֻּגַּד, לְדָוִד, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-עָשְׂתָה רִצְפָּה בַת-אַיָּה, פִּלֶגֶשׁ שָׁאוּל. | And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

text_he: ויאמרו עבדי אכיש אליו הלוא-זה דוד מלך הארץ הלוא לזה יענו במחלות לאמר הכה שאול באלפו ודוד ברבתו | And the servants of Achish said unto him 'Is not this David the king of the land Did they not sing one to another of him in dances saying Saul hath slain his thousands and David his ten thousands' | וילך דוד ויקח את-עצמות שאול ואת-עצמות יהונתן בנו מאת בעלי יביש גלעד--אשר גנבו אתם מרחב בית-שן אשר תלום (תלאום) שם הפלשתים (שמה פלשתים) ביום הכות פלשתים את-שאול בגלבע | And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead who had stolen them from the broad place of Beth-shan where the Philistines had hanged them in the day that the Philistines slew Saul in Gilboa
text_en: And the servants of Achish said unto him: 'Is not this David the king of the land? Did they not sing one to another of him in dances, saying: Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands?'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמְרוּ עַבְדֵי אָכִישׁ, אֵלָיו, הֲלוֹא-זֶה דָוִד, מֶלֶךְ הָאָרֶץ; הֲלוֹא לָזֶה, יַעֲנוּ בַמְּחֹלוֹת לֵאמֹר, הִכָּה שָׁאוּל בַּאֲלָפָו, וְדָוִד בְּרִבְבֹתָו. | And the servants of Achish said unto him: 'Is not this David the king of the land?
