Did they not sing one to another of him in dances, saying: Saul hath slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands?' | וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד, וַיִּקַּח אֶת-עַצְמוֹת שָׁאוּל וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ, מֵאֵת, בַּעֲלֵי יָבֵישׁ גִּלְעָד--אֲשֶׁר גָּנְבוּ אֹתָם מֵרְחֹב בֵּית-שַׁן, אֲשֶׁר תלום (תְּלָאוּם) שם הפלשתים (שָׁמָּה פְּלִשְׁתִּים), בְּיוֹם הַכּוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת-שָׁאוּל, בַּגִּלְבֹּעַ. | And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the broad place of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines slew Saul in Gilboa;

text_he: וישם דוד את-הדברים האלה בלבו וירא מאד מפני אכיש מלך-גת | And David laid up these words in his heart and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath | ויעל משם את-עצמות שאול ואת-עצמות יהונתן בנו ויאספו את-עצמות המוקעים | and he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged
text_en: And David laid up these words in his heart, and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
text_pisuk: וַיָּשֶׂם דָּוִד אֶת-הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה, בִּלְבָבוֹ; וַיִּרָא מְאֹד, מִפְּנֵי אָכִישׁ מֶלֶךְ-גַּת. | And David laid up these words in his heart, and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath. | וַיַּעַל מִשָּׁם אֶת-עַצְמוֹת שָׁאוּל, וְאֶת-עַצְמוֹת יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ; וַיַּאַסְפוּ, אֶת-עַצְמוֹת הַמּוּקָעִים. | and he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

text_he: וישנו את-טעמו בעיניהם ויתהל בידם ויתו על-דלתות השער ויורד רירו אל-זקנו | And he changed his demeanour before them and feigned himself mad in their hands and scrabbled on the doors of the gate and let his spittle fall down upon his beard{S} | ויקברו את-עצמות-שאול ויהונתן-בנו בארץ בנימן בצלע בקבר קיש אביו ויעשו כל אשר-צוה המלך ויעתר אלהים לארץ אחרי-כן | And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela in the sepulchre of Kish his father and they performed all that the king commanded And after that God was entreated for the land
text_en: And he changed his demeanour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְשַׁנּוֹ אֶת-טַעְמוֹ בְּעֵינֵיהֶם, וַיִּתְהֹלֵל בְּיָדָם; וַיְתָו עַל-דַּלְתוֹת הַשַּׁעַר, וַיּוֹרֶד רִירוֹ אֶל-זְקָנוֹ. | And he changed his demeanour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.{S} | וַיִּקְבְּרוּ אֶת-עַצְמוֹת-שָׁאוּל וִיהוֹנָתָן-בְּנוֹ בְּאֶרֶץ בִּנְיָמִן בְּצֵלָע, בְּקֶבֶר קִישׁ אָבִיו, וַיַּעֲשׂוּ, כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ; וַיֵּעָתֵר אֱלֹהִים לָאָרֶץ, אַחֲרֵי-כֵן. | And they buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the sepulchre of Kish his father; and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land.

text_he: ויאמר אכיש אל-עבדיו הנה תראו איש משתגע למה תביאו אתו אלי | Then said Achish unto his servants 'Lo when ye see a man that is mad wherefore do ye bring him to me | ותהי-עוד מלחמה לפלשתים את-ישראל וירד דוד ועבדיו עמו וילחמו את-פלשתים--ויעף דוד | And the Philistines had war again with Israel and David went down and his servants with him and fought against the Philistines and David waxed faint
text_en: Then said Achish unto his servants: 'Lo, when ye see a man that is mad, wherefore do ye bring him to me?
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אָכִישׁ, אֶל-עֲבָדָיו: הִנֵּה תִרְאוּ אִישׁ מִשְׁתַּגֵּעַ, לָמָּה תָּבִיאוּ אֹתוֹ אֵלָי. | Then said Achish unto his servants: 'Lo, when ye see a man that is mad, wherefore do ye bring him to me? | וַתְּהִי-עוֹד מִלְחָמָה לַפְּלִשְׁתִּים, אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֵּרֶד דָּוִד וַעֲבָדָיו עִמּוֹ, וַיִּלָּחֲמוּ אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים--וַיָּעַף דָּוִד. | And the Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines; and David waxed faint.

text_he: חסר משגעים אני כי-הבאתם את-זה להשתגע עלי הזה יבוא אל-ביתי | Do I lack madmen that ye have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence shall this fellow come into my house' | וישבו (וישבי) בנב אשר בילידי הרפה ומשקל קינו שלש מאות משקל נחשת והוא חגור חדשה ויאמר להכות את-דוד | And Ishbibenob who was of the sons of the giant the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight he being girded with new armour thought to have slain David
text_en: Do I lack madmen, that ye have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?'
text_pisuk: חֲסַר מְשֻׁגָּעִים, אָנִי, כִּי-הֲבֵאתֶם אֶת-זֶה, לְהִשְׁתַּגֵּעַ עָלָי; הֲזֶה, יָבוֹא אֶל-בֵּיתִי. | Do I lack madmen, that ye have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?' | וישבו (וְיִשְׁבִּי) בְּנֹב אֲשֶׁר בִּילִידֵי הָרָפָה, וּמִשְׁקַל קֵינוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת מִשְׁקַל נְחֹשֶׁת, וְהוּא, חָגוּר חֲדָשָׁה; וַיֹּאמֶר, לְהַכּוֹת אֶת-דָּוִד. | And Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with new armour, thought to have slain David.

text_he: וילך דוד משם וימלט אל-מערת עדלם וישמעו אחיו וכל-בית אביו וירדו אליו שמה | David therefore departed thence and escaped to the cave of Adullam and when his brethren and all his father's house heard it they went down thither to him | וידבר דוד ליהוה את-דברי השירה הזאת ביום הציל יהוה אתו {ר} מכף כל-איביו ומכף שאול | And David spoke unto the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies and out of the hand of Saul
text_en: David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave of Adullam; and when his brethren and all his father's house heard it, they went down thither to him.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד מִשָּׁם, וַיִּמָּלֵט אֶל-מְעָרַת עֲדֻלָּם; וַיִּשְׁמְעוּ אֶחָיו וְכָל-בֵּית אָבִיו, וַיֵּרְדוּ אֵלָיו שָׁמָּה. | David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave of Adullam; and when his brethren and all his father's house heard it, they went down thither to him. | וַיְדַבֵּר דָּוִד לַיהוָה, אֶת-דִּבְרֵי הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת,  בְּיוֹם הִצִּיל יְהוָה אֹתוֹ {ר} מִכַּף כָּל-אֹיְבָיו, וּמִכַּף שָׁאוּל. | And David spoke unto the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul;

text_he: ויתקבצו אליו כל-איש מצוק וכל-איש אשר-לו נשא וכל-איש מר-נפש ויהי עליהם לשר ויהיו עמו כארבע מאות איש | And every one that was in distress and every one that was in debt and every one that was discontented gathered themselves unto him and he became captain over them and there were with him about four hundred men | ויאמר יהוה סלעי ומצדתי {ר} ומפלטי-לי | and he said The LORD is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer
text_en: And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became captain over them; and there were with him about four hundred men.
text_pisuk: וַיִּתְקַבְּצוּ אֵלָיו כָּל-אִישׁ מָצוֹק וְכָל-אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ נֹשֶׁא, וְכָל-אִישׁ מַר-נֶפֶשׁ, וַיְהִי עֲלֵיהֶם, לְשָׂר; וַיִּהְיוּ עִמּוֹ, כְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת אִישׁ. | And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto him; and he became captain over them; and there were with him about four hundred men. | וַיֹּאמַר: יְהוָה סַלְעִי וּמְצֻדָתִי, {ר} וּמְפַלְטִי-לִי. | and he said: The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;

text_he: וילך דוד משם מצפה מואב ויאמר אל-מלך מואב יצא-נא אבי ואמי אתכם עד אשר אדע מה-יעשה-לי אלהים | And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab and he said unto the king of Moab 'Let my father and my mother I pray thee come forth and be with you till I know what God will do for me' | אלהי צורי אחסה-בו מגני וקרן ישעי {ר} משגבי ומנוסי משעי מחמס תשעני {ר} | The God who is my rock in Him I take refuge my shield and my horn of salvation my high tower and my refuge my saviour Thou savest me from violence
text_en: And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab; and he said unto the king of Moab: 'Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me.'
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד מִשָּׁם, מִצְפֵּה מוֹאָב; וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב, יֵצֵא-נָא אָבִי וְאִמִּי אִתְּכֶם, עַד אֲשֶׁר אֵדַע, מַה-יַּעֲשֶׂה-לִּי אֱלֹהִים. | And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab; and he said unto the king of Moab: 'Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me.' | אֱלֹהֵי צוּרִי, אֶחֱסֶה-בּוֹ;  מָגִנִּי וְקֶרֶן יִשְׁעִי, {ר} מִשְׂגַּבִּי וּמְנוּסִי,  מֹשִׁעִי, מֵחָמָס תֹּשִׁעֵנִי. {ר} | The God who is my rock, in Him I take refuge; my shield, and my horn of salvation, my high tower, and my refuge; my saviour, Thou savest me from violence.

text_he: וינחם את-פני מלך מואב וישבו עמו כל-ימי היות-דוד במצודה | And he brought them before the king of Moab and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the stronghold{S} | מהל אקרא יהוה ומאיבי אושע {ר} | Praised I cry is the LORD and I am saved from mine enemies
text_en: And he brought them before the king of Moab; and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the stronghold.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיַּנְחֵם, אֶת-פְּנֵי מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב; וַיֵּשְׁבוּ עִמּוֹ, כָּל-יְמֵי הֱיוֹת-דָּוִד בַּמְּצוּדָה. | And he brought them before the king of Moab; and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the stronghold.{S} | מְהֻלָּל, אֶקְרָא יְהוָה;  וּמֵאֹיְבַי, אִוָּשֵׁעַ. {ר} | Praised, I cry, is the LORD, and I am saved from mine enemies.

text_he: ויאמר גד הנביא אל-דוד לא תשב במצודה--לך ובאת-לך ארץ יהודה וילך דוד ויבא יער חרת | And the prophet Gad said unto David 'Abide not in the stronghold depart and get thee into the land of Judah' Then David departed and came into the forest of Hereth{S} | כי אפני משברי-מות נחלי בליעל יבעתני {ר} | For the waves of Death compassed me The floods of Belial assailed me
text_en: And the prophet Gad said unto David: 'Abide not in the stronghold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah.' Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר גָּד הַנָּבִיא אֶל-דָּוִד, לֹא תֵשֵׁב בַּמְּצוּדָה--לֵךְ וּבָאתָ-לְּךָ, אֶרֶץ יְהוּדָה; וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד, וַיָּבֹא יַעַר חָרֶת. | And the prophet Gad said unto David: 'Abide not in the stronghold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah.' Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.{S} | כִּי אֲפָפֻנִי, מִשְׁבְּרֵי-מָוֶת;  נַחֲלֵי בְלִיַּעַל, יְבַעֲתֻנִי. {ר} | For the waves of Death compassed me. The floods of Belial assailed me.

text_he: וישמע שאול--כי נודע דוד ואנשים אשר אתו ושאול יושב בגבעה תחת-האשל ברמה וחניתו בידו וכל-עבדיו נצבים עליו | And Saul heard that David was discovered and the men that were with him now Saul was sitting in Gibeah under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah with his spear in his hand and all his servants were standing about him | חבלי שאול סבני קדמני מקשי-מות {ר} | The cords of Sheol surrounded me the snares of Death confronted me
text_en: And Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him; now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him.
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁמַע שָׁאוּל--כִּי נוֹדַע דָּוִד, וַאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ; וְשָׁאוּל יוֹשֵׁב בַּגִּבְעָה תַּחַת-הָאֶשֶׁל בָּרָמָה, וַחֲנִיתוֹ בְיָדוֹ, וְכָל-עֲבָדָיו, נִצָּבִים עָלָיו. | And Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him; now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him. | חֶבְלֵי שְׁאוֹל, סַבֻּנִי;  קִדְּמֻנִי, מֹקְשֵׁי-מָוֶת. {ר} | The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of Death confronted me.

text_he: ויאמר שאול לעבדיו הנצבים עליו שמעו-נא בני ימיני גם-לכלכם יתן בן-ישי שדות וכרמים--לכלכם ישים שרי אלפים ושרי מאות | And Saul said unto his servants that stood about him 'Hear now ye Benjamites will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds | בצר-לי אקרא יהוה ואל-אלהי אקרא וישמע מהיכלו קולי ושועתי באזניו {ר} | In my distress I called upon the LORD yea I called unto my God and out of His temple He heard my voice and my cry did enter into His ears
text_en: And Saul said unto his servants that stood about him: 'Hear now, ye Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds;
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, לַעֲבָדָיו הַנִּצָּבִים עָלָיו, שִׁמְעוּ-נָא, בְּנֵי יְמִינִי: גַּם-לְכֻלְּכֶם, יִתֵּן בֶּן-יִשַׁי שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים--לְכֻלְּכֶם יָשִׂים, שָׂרֵי אֲלָפִים וְשָׂרֵי מֵאוֹת. | And Saul said unto his servants that stood about him: 'Hear now, ye Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds; | בַּצַּר-לִי אֶקְרָא יְהוָה, וְאֶל-אֱלֹהַי אֶקְרָא;  וַיִּשְׁמַע מֵהֵיכָלוֹ קוֹלִי, וְשַׁוְעָתִי בְּאָזְנָיו. {ר} | In my distress I called upon the LORD, yea, I called unto my God; and out of His temple He heard my voice, and my cry did enter into His ears.

text_he: כי קשרתם כלכם עלי ואין-גלה את-אזני בכרת-בני עם-בן-ישי ואין-חלה מכם עלי וגלה את-אזני כי הקים בני את-עבדי עלי לארב כיום הזה | that all of you have conspired against me and there was none that disclosed it to me when my son made a league with the son of Jesse and there is none of you that is sorry for me or discloseth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me to lie in wait as at this day'{S} | ותגעש (ויתגעש) ותרעש הארץ מוסדות השמים ירגזו ויתגעשו כי-חרה לו {ר} | Then the earth did shake and quake the foundations of heaven did tremble they were shaken because He was wroth
text_en: that all of you have conspired against me, and there was none that disclosed it to me when my son made a league with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or discloseth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'{S}
text_pisuk: כִּי קְשַׁרְתֶּם כֻּלְּכֶם עָלַי, וְאֵין-גֹּלֶה אֶת-אָזְנִי בִּכְרָת-בְּנִי עִם-בֶּן-יִשַׁי, וְאֵין-חֹלֶה מִכֶּם עָלַי, וְגֹלֶה אֶת-אָזְנִי: כִּי הֵקִים בְּנִי אֶת-עַבְדִּי עָלַי לְאֹרֵב, כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה. | that all of you have conspired against me, and there was none that disclosed it to me when my son made a league with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or discloseth unto me that my son hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'{S} | ותגעש (וַיִּתְגָּעַשׁ) וַתִּרְעַשׁ הָאָרֶץ,  מוֹסְדוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם יִרְגָּזוּ; וַיִּתְגָּעֲשׁוּ, כִּי-חָרָה לוֹ. {ר} | Then the earth did shake and quake, the foundations of heaven did tremble; they were shaken, because He was wroth.

text_he: ויען דאג האדמי והוא נצב על-עבדי-שאול--ויאמר ראיתי את-בן-ישי בא נבה אל-אחימלך בן-אחטוב | Then answered Doeg the Edomite who was set over the servants of Saul and said 'I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub | עלה עשן באפו ואש מפיו תאכל גחלים בערו מנו {ר} | Smoke arose up in His nostrils and fire out of His mouth did devour coals flamed forth from Him
text_en: Then answered Doeg the Edomite, who was set over the servants of Saul, and said: 'I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן דֹּאֵג הָאֲדֹמִי, וְהוּא נִצָּב עַל-עַבְדֵי-שָׁאוּל--וַיֹּאמַר: רָאִיתִי, אֶת-בֶּן-יִשַׁי, בָּא נֹבֶה, אֶל-אֲחִימֶלֶךְ בֶּן-אֲחִטוּב. | Then answered Doeg the Edomite, who was set over the servants of Saul, and said: 'I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub. | עָלָה עָשָׁן בְּאַפּוֹ, וְאֵשׁ מִפִּיו תֹּאכֵל;  גֶּחָלִים, בָּעֲרוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. {ר} | Smoke arose up in His nostrils, and fire out of His mouth did devour; coals flamed forth from Him.

text_he: וישאל-לו ביהוה וצידה נתן לו ואת חרב גלית הפלשתי--נתן לו | And he inquired of the LORD for him and gave him victuals and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine' | ויט שמים וירד וערפל תחת רגליו {ר} | He bowed the heavens also and came down and thick darkness was under His feet
text_en: And he inquired of the LORD for him, and gave him victuals, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁאַל-לוֹ, בַּיהוָה, וְצֵידָה, נָתַן לוֹ; וְאֵת, חֶרֶב גָּלְיָת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי--נָתַן לוֹ. | And he inquired of the LORD for him, and gave him victuals, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.' | וַיֵּט שָׁמַיִם, וַיֵּרַד;  וַעֲרָפֶל, תַּחַת רַגְלָיו. {ר} | He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and thick darkness was under His feet.

text_he: וישלח המלך לקרא את-אחימלך בן-אחיטוב הכהן ואת כל-בית אביו הכהנים--אשר בנב ויבאו כלם אל-המלך | Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest the son of Ahitub and all his father's house the priests that were in Nob and they came all of them to the king{S} | וירכב על-כרוב ויעף וירא על-כנפי-רוח {ר} | And He rode upon a cherub and did fly yea He was seen upon the wings of the wind
text_en: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father's house, the priests that were in Nob; and they came all of them to the king.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח הַמֶּלֶךְ לִקְרֹא אֶת-אֲחִימֶלֶךְ בֶּן-אֲחִיטוּב הַכֹּהֵן, וְאֵת כָּל-בֵּית אָבִיו הַכֹּהֲנִים--אֲשֶׁר בְּנֹב; וַיָּבֹאוּ כֻלָּם, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ. | Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father's house, the priests that were in Nob; and they came all of them to the king.{S} | וַיִּרְכַּב עַל-כְּרוּב, וַיָּעֹף;  וַיֵּרָא, עַל-כַּנְפֵי-רוּחַ. {ר} | And He rode upon a cherub, and did fly; yea, He was seen upon the wings of the wind.

text_he: ויאמר שאול שמע-נא בן-אחיטוב ויאמר הני אדני | And Saul said 'Hear now thou son of Ahitub' And he answered 'Here I am my lord' | וישת חשך סביבתיו סכות חשרת-מים עבי שחקים {ר} | And He made darkness pavilions round about Him gathering of waters thick clouds of the skies
text_en: And Saul said: 'Hear now, thou son of Ahitub.' And he answered: 'Here I am, my lord.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, שְׁמַע-נָא בֶּן-אֲחִיטוּב; וַיֹּאמֶר, הִנְנִי אֲדֹנִי. | And Saul said: 'Hear now, thou son of Ahitub.' And he answered: 'Here I am, my lord.' | וַיָּשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ סְבִיבֹתָיו, סֻכּוֹת;  חַשְׁרַת-מַיִם, עָבֵי שְׁחָקִים. {ר} | And He made darkness pavilions round about Him, gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

text_he: ויאמר אלו שאול למה קשרתם עלי אתה ובן-ישי--בתך לו לחם וחרב ושאול לו באלהים לקום אלי לארב כיום הזה | And Saul said unto him 'Why have ye conspired against me thou and the son of Jesse in that thou hast given him bread and a sword and hast inquired of God for him that he should rise against me to lie in wait as at this day'{S} | מנגה נגדו בערו גחלי-אש | At the brightness before Him coals of fire flamed forth
text_en: And Saul said unto him: 'Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָו, שָׁאוּל, לָמָּה קְשַׁרְתֶּם עָלַי, אַתָּה וּבֶן-יִשָׁי--בְּתִתְּךָ לוֹ לֶחֶם וְחֶרֶב, וְשָׁאוֹל לוֹ בֵּאלֹהִים, לָקוּם אֵלַי לְאֹרֵב, כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה. | And Saul said unto him: 'Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'{S} | מִנֹּגַהּ, נֶגְדּוֹ; בָּעֲרוּ, גַּחֲלֵי-אֵשׁ. | At the brightness before Him coals of fire flamed forth.

text_he: ויען אחימלך את-המלך ויאמר ומי בכל-עבדיך כדוד נאמן וחתן המלך וסר אל-משמעתך ונכבד ביתך | Then Ahimelech answered the king and said 'And who among all thy servants is so trusted as David who is the king's son-in-law and giveth heed unto thy bidding and is honourable in thy house | ירעם מן-שמים יהוה {ר} ועליון יתן קולו | The LORD thundered from heaven and the Most High gave forth His voice
text_en: Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said: 'And who among all thy servants is so trusted as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and giveth heed unto thy bidding, and is honourable in thy house?
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן אֲחִימֶלֶךְ אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיֹּאמַר: וּמִי בְכָל-עֲבָדֶיךָ כְּדָוִד נֶאֱמָן, וַחֲתַן הַמֶּלֶךְ וְסָר אֶל-מִשְׁמַעְתֶּךָ וְנִכְבָּד בְּבֵיתֶךָ. | Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said: 'And who among all thy servants is so trusted as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and giveth heed unto thy bidding, and is honourable in thy house? | יַרְעֵם מִן-שָׁמַיִם, יְהוָה; {ר} וְעֶלְיוֹן, יִתֵּן קוֹלוֹ. | The LORD thundered from heaven, and the Most High gave forth His voice.

text_he: היום החלתי לשאול- (לשאל-) לו באלהים חלילה לי אל-ישם המלך בעבדו דבר בכל-בית אבי--כי לא-ידע עבדך בכל-זאת דבר קטן או גדול | Have I to-day begun to inquire of God for him be it far from me let not the king impute any thing unto his servant nor to all the house of my father for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this less or more' | וישלח חצים ויפיצם ברק ויהמם (ויהם) {ר} | And He sent out arrows and scattered them lightning and discomfited them
text_en: Have I to-day begun to inquire of God for him? be it far from me; let not the king impute any thing unto his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.'
text_pisuk: הַיּוֹם הַחִלֹּתִי לשאול- (לִשְׁאָל-) לוֹ בֵאלֹהִים, חָלִילָה לִּי: אַל-יָשֵׂם הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּעַבְדּוֹ דָבָר, בְּכָל-בֵּית אָבִי--כִּי לֹא-יָדַע עַבְדְּךָ בְּכָל-זֹאת, דָּבָר קָטֹן אוֹ גָדוֹל. | Have I to-day begun to inquire of God for him? be it far from me; let not the king impute any thing unto his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.' | וַיִּשְׁלַח חִצִּים, וַיְפִיצֵם; בָּרָק, ויהמם (וַיָּהֹם). {ר} | And He sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them.

text_he: ויאמר המלך מות תמות אחימלך אתה וכל-בית אביך | And the king said 'Thou shalt surely die Ahimelech thou and all thy father's house' | ויראו אפקי ים יגלו מסדות תבל בגערת יהוה מנשמת רוח אפו {ר} | And the channels of the sea appeared the foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of the LORD at the blast of the breath of His nostrils
text_en: And the king said: 'Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father's house.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, מוֹת תָּמוּת אֲחִימֶלֶךְ: אַתָּה, וְכָל-בֵּית אָבִיךָ. | And the king said: 'Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father's house.' | וַיֵּרָאוּ אֲפִקֵי יָם, יִגָּלוּ מֹסְדוֹת תֵּבֵל;  בְּגַעֲרַת יְהוָה, מִנִּשְׁמַת רוּחַ אַפּוֹ. {ר} | And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of the LORD, at the blast of the breath of His nostrils.

text_he: ויאמר המלך לרצים הנצבים עליו סבו והמיתו כהני יהוה כי גם-ידם עם-דוד וכי ידעו כי-ברח הוא ולא גלו את-אזנו (אזני) ולא-אבו עבדי המלך לשלח את-ידם לפגע בכהני יהוה | And the king said unto the guard that stood about him 'Turn and slay the priests of the LORD because their hand also is with David and because they knew that he fled and did not disclose it to me' But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the LORD{S} | ישלח מרום יקחני ימשני מים רבים {ר} | He sent from on high He took me He drew me out of many waters
text_en: And the king said unto the guard that stood about him: 'Turn, and slay the priests of the LORD; because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he fled, and did not disclose it to me.' But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the LORD.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לָרָצִים הַנִּצָּבִים עָלָיו סֹבּוּ וְהָמִיתוּ כֹּהֲנֵי יְהוָה, כִּי גַם-יָדָם עִם-דָּוִד, וְכִי יָדְעוּ כִּי-בֹרֵחַ הוּא, וְלֹא גָלוּ אֶת-אזנו (אָזְנִי); וְלֹא-אָבוּ עַבְדֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, לִשְׁלֹחַ אֶת-יָדָם, לִפְגֹעַ, בְּכֹהֲנֵי יְהוָה. | And the king said unto the guard that stood about him: 'Turn, and slay the priests of the LORD; because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he fled, and did not disclose it to me.' But the servants of the king would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the LORD.{S} | יִשְׁלַח מִמָּרוֹם, יִקָּחֵנִי;  יַמְשֵׁנִי, מִמַּיִם רַבִּים. {ר} | He sent from on high, He took me; He drew me out of many waters;

text_he: ויאמר המלך לדויג (לדואג) סב אתה ופגע בכהנים ויסב דויג (דואג) האדמי ויפגע-הוא בכהנים וימת ביום הוא שמנים וחמשה איש נשא אפוד בד | And the king said to Doeg 'Turn thou and fall upon the priests' And Doeg the Edomite turned and he fell upon the priests and he slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod | יצילני מאיבי עז משנאי כי אמצו מני {ר} | He delivered me from mine enemy most strong from them that hated me for they were too mighty for me
text_en: And the king said to Doeg: 'Turn thou, and fall upon the priests.' And Doeg the Edomite turned, and he fell upon the priests, and he slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, לדויג (לְדוֹאֵג), סֹב אַתָּה, וּפְגַע בַּכֹּהֲנִים; וַיִּסֹּב דויג (דּוֹאֵג) הָאֲדֹמִי, וַיִּפְגַּע-הוּא בַּכֹּהֲנִים, וַיָּמֶת בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא שְׁמֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אִישׁ, נֹשֵׂא אֵפוֹד בָּד. | And the king said to Doeg: 'Turn thou, and fall upon the priests.' And Doeg the Edomite turned, and he fell upon the priests, and he slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod. | יַצִּילֵנִי, מֵאֹיְבִי עָז;  מִשֹּׂנְאַי, כִּי אָמְצוּ מִמֶּנִּי. {ר} | He delivered me from mine enemy most strong, from them that hated me, for they were too mighty for me.

text_he: ואת נב עיר-הכהנים הכה לפי-חרב מאיש ועד-אשה מעול ועד-יונק ושור וחמור ושה לפי-חרב | And Nob the city of the priests smote he with the edge of the sword both men and women children and sucklings and oxen and asses and sheep with the edge of the sword | יקדמני ביום אידי ויהי יהוה משען לי | They confronted me in the day of my calamity but the LORD was a stay unto me
text_en: And Nob, the city of the priests, smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen and asses and sheep, with the edge of the sword.
text_pisuk: וְאֵת נֹב עִיר-הַכֹּהֲנִים, הִכָּה לְפִי-חֶרֶב, מֵאִישׁ וְעַד-אִשָּׁה, מֵעוֹלֵל וְעַד-יוֹנֵק; וְשׁוֹר וַחֲמוֹר וָשֶׂה, לְפִי-חָרֶב. | And Nob, the city of the priests, smote he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen and asses and sheep, with the edge of the sword. | יְקַדְּמֻנִי, בְּיוֹם אֵידִי; וַיְהִי יְהוָה מִשְׁעָן, לִי. | They confronted me in the day of my calamity; but the LORD was a stay unto me.

text_he: וימלט בן-אחד לאחימלך בן-אחטוב ושמו אביתר ויברח אחרי דוד | And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub named Abiathar escaped and fled after David | ויצא למרחב אתי {ר} יחלצני כי-חפץ בי | He brought me forth also into a large place He delivered me because He delighted in me
text_en: And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David.
text_pisuk: וַיִּמָּלֵט בֵּן-אֶחָד, לַאֲחִימֶלֶךְ בֶּן-אֲחִטוּב, וּשְׁמוֹ, אֶבְיָתָר; וַיִּבְרַח, אַחֲרֵי דָוִד. | And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David. | וַיֹּצֵא לַמֶּרְחָב, אֹתִי; {ר} יְחַלְּצֵנִי, כִּי-חָפֵץ בִּי. | He brought me forth also into a large place; He delivered me, because He delighted in me.

text_he: ויגד אביתר לדוד כי הרג שאול את כהני יהוה | And Abiathar told David that Saul had slain the LORD'S priests | יגמלני יהוה כצדקתי {ר} כבר ידי ישיב לי | The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness according to the cleanness of my hands hath He recompensed me
text_en: And Abiathar told David that Saul had slain the LORD'S priests.
text_pisuk: וַיַּגֵּד אֶבְיָתָר, לְדָוִד: כִּי הָרַג שָׁאוּל, אֵת כֹּהֲנֵי יְהוָה. | And Abiathar told David that Saul had slain the LORD'S priests. | יִגְמְלֵנִי יְהוָה, כְּצִדְקָתִי; {ר} כְּבֹר יָדַי, יָשִׁיב לִי. | The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath He recompensed me.

text_he: ויאמר דוד לאביתר ידעתי ביום הוא כי-שם דויג (דואג) האדמי כי-הגד יגיד לשאול אנכי סבתי בכל-נפש בית אביך | And David said unto Abiathar 'I knew on that day when Doeg the Edomite was there that he would surely tell Saul I have brought about the death of all the persons of thy father's house | כי שמרתי דרכי יהוה {ר} ולא רשעתי מאלהי | For I have kept the ways of the LORD and have not wickedly departed from my God
text_en: And David said unto Abiathar: 'I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul; I have brought about the death of all the persons of thy father's house.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לְאֶבְיָתָר, יָדַעְתִּי בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא כִּי-שָׁם דויג (דּוֹאֵג) הָאֲדֹמִי, כִּי-הַגֵּד יַגִּיד, לְשָׁאוּל: אָנֹכִי סַבֹּתִי, בְּכָל-נֶפֶשׁ בֵּית אָבִיךָ. | And David said unto Abiathar: 'I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul; I have brought about the death of all the persons of thy father's house. | כִּי שָׁמַרְתִּי, דַּרְכֵי יְהוָה; {ר} וְלֹא רָשַׁעְתִּי, מֵאֱלֹהָי. | For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

text_he: שבה אתי אל-תירא כי אשר-יבקש את-נפשי יבקש את-נפשך כי-משמרת אתה עמדי | Abide thou with me fear not for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life for with me thou shalt be in safeguard'{S} | כי כל-משפטו לנגדי וחקתיו לא-אסור מנה {ר} | For all His ordinances were before me and as for His statutes I did not depart from them
text_en: Abide thou with me, fear not; for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life; for with me thou shalt be in safeguard.'{S}
text_pisuk: שְׁבָה אִתִּי אַל-תִּירָא, כִּי אֲשֶׁר-יְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-נַפְשִׁי יְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-נַפְשֶׁךָ: כִּי-מִשְׁמֶרֶת אַתָּה, עִמָּדִי. | Abide thou with me, fear not; for he that seeketh my life seeketh thy life; for with me thou shalt be in safeguard.'{S} | כִּי כָל-מִשְׁפָּטָו, לְנֶגְדִּי; וְחֻקֹּתָיו, לֹא-אָסוּר מִמֶּנָּה. {ר} | For all His ordinances were before me; and as for His statutes, I did not depart from them.

text_he: ויגדו לדוד לאמר הנה פלשתים נלחמים בקעילה והמה שסים את-הגרנות | And they told David saying 'Behold the Philistines are fighting against Keilah and they rob the threshing-floors' | ואלה דברי דוד האחרנים נאם דוד בן-ישי ונאם הגבר הקם על--משיח אלהי יעקב ונעים זמרות ישראל | Now these are the last words of David The saying of David the son of Jesse and the saying of the man raised on high the anointed of the God of Jacob and the sweet singer of Israel
text_en: And they told David, saying: 'Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they rob the threshing-floors.'
text_pisuk: וַיַּגִּדוּ לְדָוִד, לֵאמֹר: הִנֵּה פְלִשְׁתִּים נִלְחָמִים בִּקְעִילָה, וְהֵמָּה שֹׁסִים אֶת-הַגֳּרָנוֹת. | And they told David, saying: 'Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they rob the threshing-floors.' | וְאֵלֶּה דִּבְרֵי דָוִד, הָאַחֲרֹנִים: נְאֻם דָּוִד בֶּן-יִשַׁי, וּנְאֻם הַגֶּבֶר הֻקַם עָל--מְשִׁיחַ אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב, וּנְעִים זְמִרוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל. | Now these are the last words of David: The saying of David the son of Jesse, and the saying of the man raised on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet singer of Israel:

text_he: וישאל דוד ביהוה לאמר האלך והכיתי בפלשתים האלה ויאמר יהוה אל-דוד לך והכית בפלשתים והושעת את-קעילה | Therefore David inquired of the LORD saying 'Shall I go and smite these Philistines'{S}And the LORD said unto David 'Go and smite the Philistines and save Keilah' | רוח יהוה דבר-בי ומלתו על-לשוני | The spirit of the LORD spoke by me and His word was upon my tongue
text_en: Therefore David inquired of the LORD, saying: 'Shall I go and smite these Philistines?'{S}And the LORD said unto David: 'Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.'
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁאַל דָּוִד בַּיהוָה, לֵאמֹר, הַאֵלֵךְ וְהִכֵּיתִי, בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים הָאֵלֶּה;  וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה אֶל-דָּוִד, לֵךְ וְהִכִּיתָ בַפְּלִשְׁתִּים, וְהוֹשַׁעְתָּ, אֶת-קְעִילָה. | Therefore David inquired of the LORD, saying: 'Shall I go and smite these Philistines?'{S}And the LORD said unto David: 'Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.' | רוּחַ יְהוָה, דִּבֶּר-בִּי; וּמִלָּתוֹ, עַל-לְשׁוֹנִי. | The spirit of the LORD spoke by me, and His word was upon my tongue.

text_he: ויאמרו אנשי דוד אליו הנה אנחנו פה ביהודה יראים ואף כי-נלך קעלה אל-מערכות פלשתים | And David's men said unto him 'Behold we are afraid here in Judah how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines'{S} | אמר אלהי ישראל לי דבר צור ישראל מושל באדם--צדיק מושל יראת אלהים | The God of Israel said The Rock of Israel spoke to me 'Ruler over men shall be the righteous even he that ruleth in the fear of God
text_en: And David's men said unto him: 'Behold, we are afraid here in Judah; how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמְרוּ אַנְשֵׁי דָוִד, אֵלָיו, הִנֵּה אֲנַחְנוּ פֹה בִּיהוּדָה, יְרֵאִים; וְאַף כִּי-נֵלֵךְ קְעִלָה, אֶל-מַעַרְכוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים. | And David's men said unto him: 'Behold, we are afraid here in Judah; how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?'{S} | אָמַר אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִי דִבֶּר צוּר יִשְׂרָאֵל: מוֹשֵׁל, בָּאָדָם--צַדִּיק, מוֹשֵׁל יִרְאַת אֱלֹהִים. | The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spoke to me: 'Ruler over men shall be the righteous, even he that ruleth in the fear of God,

text_he: ויוסף עוד דוד לשאול ביהוה ויענהו יהוה ויאמר קום רד קעילה--כי-אני נתן את-פלשתים בידך | Then David inquired of the LORD yet again And the LORD answered him and said 'Arise go down to Keilah for I will deliver the Philistines into thy hand' | וכאור בקר יזרח-שמש בקר לא עבות מנגה מטר דשא מארץ | And as the light of the morning when the sun riseth a morning without clouds when through clear shining after rain the tender grass springeth out of the earth'
text_en: Then David inquired of the LORD yet again. And the LORD answered him and said: 'Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thy hand.'
text_pisuk: וַיּוֹסֶף עוֹד דָּוִד לִשְׁאוֹל בַּיהוָה, וַיַּעֲנֵהוּ יְהוָה; וַיֹּאמֶר, קוּם רֵד קְעִילָה--כִּי-אֲנִי נֹתֵן אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים, בְּיָדֶךָ. | Then David inquired of the LORD yet again. And the LORD answered him and said: 'Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thy hand.' | וּכְאוֹר בֹּקֶר, יִזְרַח-שָׁמֶשׁ; בֹּקֶר לֹא עָבוֹת, מִנֹּגַהּ מִמָּטָר דֶּשֶׁא מֵאָרֶץ. | And as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, a morning without clouds; when through clear shining after rain, the tender grass springeth out of the earth.'

text_he: וילך דוד ואנשו קעילה וילחם בפלשתים וינהג את-מקניהם ויך בהם מכה גדולה וישע דוד את ישבי קעילה | And David and his men went to Keilah and fought with the Philistines and brought away their cattle and slew them with a great slaughter So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah{S} | כי-לא-כן ביתי עם-אל כי ברית עולם שם לי ערוכה בכל ושמרה--כי-כל-ישעי וכל-חפץ כי-לא יצמיח | For is not my house established with God for an everlasting covenant He hath made with me ordered in all things and sure for all my salvation and all my desire will he not make it to grow
text_en: And David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and slew them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁו קְעִילָה וַיִּלָּחֶם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים, וַיִּנְהַג אֶת-מִקְנֵיהֶם, וַיַּךְ בָּהֶם, מַכָּה גְדוֹלָה; וַיֹּשַׁע דָּוִד, אֵת יֹשְׁבֵי קְעִילָה. | And David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and slew them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.{S} | כִּי-לֹא-כֵן בֵּיתִי, עִם-אֵל: כִּי בְרִית עוֹלָם שָׂם לִי, עֲרוּכָה בַכֹּל וּשְׁמֻרָה--כִּי-כָל-יִשְׁעִי וְכָל-חֵפֶץ, כִּי-לֹא יַצְמִיחַ. | For is not my house established with God? for an everlasting covenant He hath made with me, ordered in all things, and sure; for all my salvation, and all my desire, will he not make it to grow?

text_he: ויהי ברח אביתר בן-אחימלך אל-דוד--קעילה אפוד ירד בידו | And it came to pass when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah that he came down with an ephod in his hand | ובליעל כקוץ מנד כלהם כי-לא ביד יקחו | But the ungodly they are as thorns thrust away all of them for they cannot be taken with the hand
text_en: And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, בִּבְרֹחַ אֶבְיָתָר בֶּן-אֲחִימֶלֶךְ אֶל-דָּוִד--קְעִילָה; אֵפוֹד, יָרַד בְּיָדוֹ. | And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand. | וּבְלִיַּעַל, כְּקוֹץ מֻנָד כֻּלָּהַם: כִּי-לֹא בְיָד, יִקָּחוּ. | But the ungodly, they are as thorns thrust away, all of them, for they cannot be taken with the hand;

text_he: ויגד לשאול כי-בא דוד קעילה ויאמר שאול נכר אתו אלהים בידי--כי נסגר לבוא בעיר דלתים ובריח | And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah And Saul said 'God hath delivered him into my hand for he is shut in by entering into a town that hath gates and bars' | ואיש יגע בהם ימלא ברזל ועץ חנית ובאש שרוף ישרפו בשבת | But the man that toucheth them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear and they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place
text_en: And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said: 'God hath delivered him into my hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.'
text_pisuk: וַיֻּגַּד לְשָׁאוּל, כִּי-בָא דָוִד קְעִילָה; וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, נִכַּר אֹתוֹ אֱלֹהִים בְּיָדִי--כִּי נִסְגַּר לָבוֹא, בְּעִיר דְּלָתַיִם וּבְרִיחַ. | And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said: 'God hath delivered him into my hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.' | וְאִישׁ יִגַּע בָּהֶם, יִמָּלֵא בַרְזֶל וְעֵץ חֲנִית; וּבָאֵשׁ, שָׂרוֹף יִשָּׂרְפוּ בַּשָּׁבֶת. | But the man that toucheth them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place.

text_he: וישמע שאול את-כל-העם למלחמה לרדת קעילה לצור אל-דוד ואל-אנשיו | And Saul summoned all the people to war to go down to Keilah to besiege David and his men | אלה שמות הגברים אשר לדוד ישב בשבת תחכמני ראש השלשי הוא עדינו העצנו (העצני)--על-שמנה מאות חל בפעם אחד (אחת) | These are the names of the mighty men whom David had Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite chief of the captains the same was Adino the Eznite against eight hundred whom he slew at one time{S}
text_en: And Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.
text_pisuk: וַיְשַׁמַּע שָׁאוּל אֶת-כָּל-הָעָם, לַמִּלְחָמָה, לָרֶדֶת קְעִילָה, לָצוּר אֶל-דָּוִד וְאֶל-אֲנָשָׁיו. | And Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men. | אֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹת הַגִּבֹּרִים, אֲשֶׁר לְדָוִד: יֹשֵׁב בַּשֶּׁבֶת תַּחְכְּמֹנִי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁלִשִׁי, הוּא עֲדִינוֹ העצנו (הָעֶצְנִי)--עַל-שְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת חָלָל, בְּפַעַם אחד (אֶחָת). | These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite; against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.{S}

text_he: וידע דוד--כי עליו שאול מחריש הרעה ויאמר אל-אביתר הכהן הגישה האפוד | And David knew that Saul devised mischief against him and he said to Abiathar the priest 'Bring hither the ephod'{S} | ואחרו אלעזר בן-די (דו) בן-אחי בשלשה גברים (הגברים) עם-דוד בחרפם בפלשתים נאספו-שם למלחמה ויעלו איש ישראל | And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the son of an Ahohite one of the three mighty men with David when they jeoparded their lives against the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle and the men of Israel were gone away
text_en: And David knew that Saul devised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest: 'Bring hither the ephod.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֵּדַע דָּוִד--כִּי עָלָיו, שָׁאוּל מַחֲרִישׁ הָרָעָה; וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-אֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֵן, הַגִּישָׁה הָאֵפוֹד. | And David knew that Saul devised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest: 'Bring hither the ephod.'{S} | וְאַחֲרָו אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן-דדי (דֹּדוֹ), בֶּן-אֲחֹחִי; בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה גברים (הַגִּבֹּרִים) עִם-דָּוִד, בְּחָרְפָם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים נֶאֶסְפוּ-שָׁם לַמִּלְחָמָה, וַיַּעֲלוּ, אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they jeoparded their lives against the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away;

text_he: ויאמר דוד יהוה אלהי ישראל שמע שמע עבדך כי-מבקש שאול לבוא אל-קעילה--לשחת לעיר בעבורי | Then said David 'O LORD the God of Israel Thy servant hath surely heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah to destroy the city for my sake | הוא קם ויך בפלשתים עד כי-יגעה ידו ותדבק ידו אל-החרב ויעש יהוה תשועה גדולה ביום הוא והעם ישבו אחריו אך-לפשט | he stood firm and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary and his hand did cleave unto the sword and the LORD wrought a great victory that day and the people returned after him only to strip the slain{S}
text_en: Then said David: 'O LORD, the God of Israel, Thy servant hath surely heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר, דָּוִד, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, שָׁמֹעַ שָׁמַע עַבְדְּךָ כִּי-מְבַקֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל לָבוֹא אֶל-קְעִילָה--לְשַׁחֵת לָעִיר, בַּעֲבוּרִי. | Then said David: 'O LORD, the God of Israel, Thy servant hath surely heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake. | הוּא קָם וַיַּךְ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים עַד כִּי-יָגְעָה יָדוֹ, וַתִּדְבַּק יָדוֹ אֶל-הַחֶרֶב, וַיַּעַשׂ יְהוָה תְּשׁוּעָה גְדוֹלָה, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא; וְהָעָם יָשֻׁבוּ אַחֲרָיו, אַךְ-לְפַשֵּׁט. | he stood firm, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand did cleave unto the sword; and the LORD wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to strip the slain.{S}

text_he: היסגרני בעלי קעילה בידו הירד שאול כאשר שמע עבדך--יהוה אלהי ישראל הגד-נא לעבדך ויאמר יהוה ירד | Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand will Saul come down as Thy servant hath heard' O LORD the God of Israel I beseech Thee tell Thy servant'{S}And the LORD said 'He will come down'{S} | ואחריו שמה בן-אגא הרי ויאספו פלשתים לחיה ותהי-שם חלקת השדה מלאה עדשים והעם נס מפני פלשתים | And after him was Shammah the son of Age the Ararite And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop where was a plot of ground full of lentils and the people fled from the Philistines
text_en: Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as Thy servant hath heard?' O LORD, the God of Israel, I beseech Thee, tell Thy servant.'{S}And the LORD said: 'He will come down.'{S}
text_pisuk: הֲיַסְגִּרֻנִי בַעֲלֵי קְעִילָה בְיָדוֹ הֲיֵרֵד שָׁאוּל, כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁמַע עַבְדֶּךָ--יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַגֶּד-נָא לְעַבְדֶּךָ;  וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, יֵרֵד. | Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as Thy servant hath heard?' O LORD, the God of Israel, I beseech Thee, tell Thy servant.'{S}And the LORD said: 'He will come down.'{S} | וְאַחֲרָיו שַׁמָּה בֶן-אָגֵא, הָרָרִי; וַיֵּאָסְפוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים לַחַיָּה, וַתְּהִי-שָׁם חֶלְקַת הַשָּׂדֶה מְלֵאָה עֲדָשִׁים, וְהָעָם נָס, מִפְּנֵי פְלִשְׁתִּים. | And after him was Shammah the son of Age the Ararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.

text_he: ויאמר דוד--היסגרו בעלי קעילה אתי ואת-אנשי ביד-שאול ויאמר יהוה יסגירו | Then said David 'Will the men of Keilah deliver up me and my men into the hand of Saul' And the LORD said 'They will deliver thee up'{S} | ויתיצב בתוך-החלקה ויצילה ויך את-פלשתים ויעש יהוה תשועה גדולה | But he stood in the midst of the plot and defended it and slew the Philistines and the LORD wrought a great victory{S}
text_en: Then said David: 'Will the men of Keilah deliver up me and my men into the hand of Saul?' And the LORD said: 'They will deliver thee up.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד--הֲיַסְגִּרוּ בַּעֲלֵי קְעִילָה אֹתִי וְאֶת-אֲנָשַׁי, בְּיַד-שָׁאוּל; וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוָה, יַסְגִּירוּ. | Then said David: 'Will the men of Keilah deliver up me and my men into the hand of Saul?' And the LORD said: 'They will deliver thee up.'{S} | וַיִּתְיַצֵּב בְּתוֹךְ-הַחֶלְקָה וַיַּצִּילֶהָ, וַיַּךְ אֶת-פְּלִשְׁתִּים; וַיַּעַשׂ יְהוָה, תְּשׁוּעָה גְדוֹלָה. | But he stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD wrought a great victory.{S}

text_he: ויקם דוד ואנשיו כש-מאות איש ויצאו מקעלה ויתהלכו באשר יתהלכו ולשאול הגד כי-נמלט דוד מקעילה ויחדל לצאת | Then David and his men who were about six hundred arose and departed out of Keilah and went whithersoever they could go And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah and he forbore to go forth | וירדו שלשים (שלשה) מהשלשים ראש ויבאו אל-קציר אל-דוד--אל-מערת עדלם וחית פלשתים חנה בעמק רפאים | And three of the thirty chief went down and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam and the troop of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim
text_en: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbore to go forth.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו כְּשֵׁשׁ-מֵאוֹת אִישׁ, וַיֵּצְאוּ מִקְּעִלָה, וַיִּתְהַלְּכוּ, בַּאֲשֶׁר יִתְהַלָּכוּ; וּלְשָׁאוּל הֻגַּד, כִּי-נִמְלַט דָּוִד מִקְּעִילָה, וַיֶּחְדַּל, לָצֵאת. | Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbore to go forth. | וַיֵּרְדוּ שלשים (שְׁלֹשָׁה) מֵהַשְּׁלֹשִׁים רֹאשׁ, וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶל-קָצִיר אֶל-דָּוִד--אֶל-מְעָרַת, עֲדֻלָּם; וְחַיַּת פְּלִשְׁתִּים, חֹנָה בְּעֵמֶק רְפָאִים. | And three of the thirty chief went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

text_he: וישב דוד במדבר במצדות וישב בהר במדבר-זיף ויבקשהו שאול כל-הימים ולא-נתנו אלהים בידו | And David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds and remained in the hill-country in the wilderness of Ziph And Saul sought him every day but God delivered him not into his hand | ודוד אז במצודה ומצב פלשתים אז בית לחם | And David was then in the stronghold and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem
text_en: And David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill-country in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּשֶׁב דָּוִד בַּמִּדְבָּר בַּמְּצָדוֹת, וַיֵּשֶׁב בָּהָר בְּמִדְבַּר-זִיף; וַיְבַקְשֵׁהוּ שָׁאוּל כָּל-הַיָּמִים, וְלֹא-נְתָנוֹ אֱלֹהִים בְּיָדוֹ. | And David abode in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill-country in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand. | וְדָוִד, אָז בַּמְּצוּדָה; וּמַצַּב פְּלִשְׁתִּים, אָז בֵּית לָחֶם. | And David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.

text_he: וירא דוד כי-יצא שאול לבקש את-נפשו ודוד במדבר-זיף בחרשה | And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood{S} | ויתאוה דוד ויאמר מי ישקני מים מבאר בית-לחם אשר בשער | And David longed and said 'Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem which is by the gate'{S}
text_en: And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life; and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיַּרְא דָּוִד, כִּי-יָצָא שָׁאוּל לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-נַפְשׁוֹ; וְדָוִד בְּמִדְבַּר-זִיף, בַּחֹרְשָׁה. | And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life; and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.{S} | וַיִּתְאַוֶּה דָוִד, וַיֹּאמַר: מִי יַשְׁקֵנִי מַיִם, מִבֹּאר בֵּית-לֶחֶם אֲשֶׁר בַּשָּׁעַר. | And David longed, and said: 'Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!'{S}

text_he: ויקם יהונתן בן-שאול וילך אל-דוד חרשה ויחזק את-ידו באלהים | And Jonathan Saul's son arose and went to David into the wood and strengthened his hand in God | ויבקעו שלשת הגברים במחנה פלשתים וישאבו-מים מבאר בית-לחם אשר בשער וישאו ויבאו אל-דוד ולא אבה לשתותם ויסך אתם ליהוה | And the three mighty men broke through the host of the Philistines and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem that was by the gate and took it and brought it to David but he would not drink thereof but poured it out unto the LORD
text_en: And Jonathan Saul's son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן-שָׁאוּל, וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל-דָּוִד חֹרְשָׁה; וַיְחַזֵּק אֶת-יָדוֹ, בֵּאלֹהִים. | And Jonathan Saul's son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God. | וַיִּבְקְעוּ שְׁלֹשֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִים בְּמַחֲנֵה פְלִשְׁתִּים, וַיִּשְׁאֲבוּ-מַיִם מִבֹּאר בֵּית-לֶחֶם אֲשֶׁר בַּשַּׁעַר, וַיִּשְׂאוּ, וַיָּבִאוּ אֶל-דָּוִד; וְלֹא אָבָה לִשְׁתּוֹתָם, וַיַּסֵּךְ אֹתָם לַיהוָה. | And the three mighty men broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David; but he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD.

text_he: ויאמר אליו אל-תירא כי לא תמצאך יד שאול אבי ואתה תמלך על-ישראל ואנכי אהיה-לך למשנה וגם-שאול אבי ידע כן | And he said unto him 'Fear not for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee and thou shalt be king over Israel and I shall be next unto thee and that also Saul my father knoweth' | ויאמר חלילה לי יהוה מעשתי זאת הדם האנשים הלכים בנפשותם ולא אבה לשתותם אלה עשו שלשת הגברים | And he said 'Be it far from me O LORD that I should do this shall I drink the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives' therefore he would not drink it These things did the three mighty men{S}
text_en: And he said unto him: 'Fear not; for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו אַל-תִּירָא, כִּי לֹא תִמְצָאֲךָ יַד שָׁאוּל אָבִי, וְאַתָּה תִּמְלֹךְ עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָנֹכִי אֶהְיֶה-לְּךָ לְמִשְׁנֶה; וְגַם-שָׁאוּל אָבִי, יֹדֵעַ כֵּן. | And he said unto him: 'Fear not; for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.' | וַיֹּאמֶר חָלִילָה לִּי יְהוָה מֵעֲשֹׂתִי זֹאת, הֲדַם הָאֲנָשִׁים הַהֹלְכִים בְּנַפְשׁוֹתָם, וְלֹא אָבָה, לִשְׁתּוֹתָם; אֵלֶּה עָשׂוּ, שְׁלֹשֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִים. | And he said: 'Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this; shall I drink the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives?' therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.{S}

text_he: ויכרתו שניהם ברית לפני יהוה וישב דוד בחרשה ויהונתן הלך לביתו | And they two made a covenant before the LORD and David abode in the wood and Jonathan went to his house{S} | ואבישי אחי יואב בן-צרויה הוא ראש השלשי (השלשה) והוא עור את-חניתו על-שלש מאות חל ולו-שם בשלשה | And Abishai the brother of Joab the son of Zeruiah was chief of the three And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them and had a name among the three
text_en: And they two made a covenant before the LORD; and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּכְרְתוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּרִית, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה; וַיֵּשֶׁב דָּוִד בַּחֹרְשָׁה, וִיהוֹנָתָן הָלַךְ לְבֵיתוֹ. | And they two made a covenant before the LORD; and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.{S} | וַאֲבִישַׁי אֲחִי יוֹאָב בֶּן-צְרוּיָה, הוּא רֹאשׁ השלשי (הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה), וְהוּא עוֹרֵר אֶת-חֲנִיתוֹ, עַל-שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת חָלָל; וְלוֹ-שֵׁם, בַּשְּׁלֹשָׁה. | And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.

text_he: ויעלו זפים אל-שאול הגבעתה לאמר הלוא דוד מסתר עמנו במצדות בחרשה--בגבעת החכילה אשר מימין הישימון | Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah saying 'Doth not David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the wood in the hill of Hachilah which is on the south of Jeshimon | מן-השלשה הכי נכבד ויהי להם לשר ועד-השלשה לא-בא | He was most honourable of the three therefore he was made their captain howbeit he attained not unto the first three{S}
text_en: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying: 'Doth not David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon?
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲלוּ זִפִים אֶל-שָׁאוּל, הַגִּבְעָתָה לֵאמֹר: הֲלוֹא דָוִד מִסְתַּתֵּר עִמָּנוּ בַמְּצָדוֹת, בַּחֹרְשָׁה--בְּגִבְעַת הַחֲכִילָה, אֲשֶׁר מִימִין הַיְשִׁימוֹן. | Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying: 'Doth not David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon? | מִן-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה הֲכִי נִכְבָּד, וַיְהִי לָהֶם לְשָׂר; וְעַד-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה, לֹא-בָא. | He was most honourable of the three; therefore he was made their captain; howbeit he attained not unto the first three.{S}

text_he: ועתה לכל-אות נפשך המלך לרדת--רד ולנו הסגירו ביד המלך | Now therefore O king come down according to all the desire of thy soul to come down and our part shall be to deliver him up into the king's hand' | ובניהו בן-יהוידע בן-איש-חי (חיל) רב-פעלים מקבצאל הוא הכה את שני אראל מואב והוא ירד והכה את-האריה (הארי) בתוך הבאר ביום השלג | And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel who had done mighty deeds he smote the two altar-hearths of Moab he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow
text_en: Now therefore, O king, come down, according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him up into the king's hand.'
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה לְכָל-אַוַּת נַפְשְׁךָ הַמֶּלֶךְ, לָרֶדֶת--רֵד; וְלָנוּ הַסְגִּירוֹ, בְּיַד הַמֶּלֶךְ. | Now therefore, O king, come down, according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him up into the king's hand.' | וּבְנָיָהוּ בֶן-יְהוֹיָדָע בֶּן-אִישׁ-חי (חַיִל) רַב-פְּעָלִים, מִקַּבְצְאֵל; הוּא הִכָּה, אֵת שְׁנֵי אֲרִאֵל מוֹאָב, וְהוּא יָרַד וְהִכָּה אֶת-האריה (הָאֲרִי) בְּתוֹךְ הַבֹּאר, בְּיוֹם הַשָּׁלֶג. | And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he smote the two altar-hearths of Moab; he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow;

text_he: ויאמר שאול ברוכים אתם ליהוה כי חמלתם עלי | And Saul said 'Blessed be ye of the LORD for ye have had compassion on me | והוא-הכה את-איש מצרי אשר (איש) מראה וביד המצרי חנית וירד אליו בשבט ויגזל את-החנית מיד המצרי ויהרגהו בחניתו | and he slew an Egyptian a goodly man and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand but he went down to him with a staff and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand and slew him with his own spear
text_en: And Saul said: 'Blessed be ye of the LORD; for ye have had compassion on me.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל, בְּרוּכִים אַתֶּם לַיהוָה: כִּי חֲמַלְתֶּם, עָלָי. | And Saul said: 'Blessed be ye of the LORD; for ye have had compassion on me. | וְהוּא-הִכָּה אֶת-אִישׁ מִצְרִי אשר (אִישׁ) מַרְאֶה, וּבְיַד הַמִּצְרִי חֲנִית, וַיֵּרֶד אֵלָיו, בַּשָּׁבֶט; וַיִּגְזֹל אֶת-הַחֲנִית מִיַּד הַמִּצְרִי, וַיַּהַרְגֵהוּ בַּחֲנִיתוֹ. | and he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man; and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.

text_he: לכו-נא הכינו עוד ודעו וראו את-מקומו אשר תהיה רגלו--מי ראהו שם כי אמר אלי ערום יערם הוא | Go I pray you make yet more sure and know and see his place where his haunt is and who hath seen him there for it is told me that he dealeth very subtly | אלה עשה בניהו בן-יהוידע ולו-שם בשלשה הגברים | These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada and had a name among the three mighty men
text_en: Go, I pray you, make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there; for it is told me that he dealeth very subtly.
text_pisuk: לְכוּ-נָא הָכִינוּ עוֹד, וּדְעוּ וּרְאוּ אֶת-מְקוֹמוֹ אֲשֶׁר תִּהְיֶה רַגְלוֹ--מִי רָאָהוּ, שָׁם: כִּי אָמַר אֵלַי, עָרוֹם יַעְרִם הוּא. | Go, I pray you, make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who hath seen him there; for it is told me that he dealeth very subtly. | אֵלֶּה עָשָׂה, בְּנָיָהוּ בֶּן-יְהוֹיָדָע; וְלוֹ-שֵׁם, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה הַגִּבֹּרִים. | These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.

text_he: וראו ודעו מכל המחבאים אשר יתחבא שם ושבתם אלי אל-נכון והלכתי אתכם והיה אם-ישנו בארץ--וחפשתי אתו בכל אלפי יהודה | See therefore and take knowledge of all the lurking-places where he hideth himself and come ye back to me with the certainty and I will go with you and it shall come to pass if he be in the land that I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah' | מן-השלשים נכבד ואל-השלשה לא-בא וישמהו דוד {ר} אל-משמעתו | He was more honourable than the thirty but he attained not to the first three And David set him over his guard
text_en: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking-places where he hideth himself, and come ye back to me with the certainty, and I will go with you; and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah.'
text_pisuk: וּרְאוּ וּדְעוּ, מִכֹּל הַמַּחֲבֹאִים אֲשֶׁר יִתְחַבֵּא שָׁם, וְשַׁבְתֶּם אֵלַי אֶל-נָכוֹן, וְהָלַכְתִּי אִתְּכֶם; וְהָיָה, אִם-יֶשְׁנוֹ בָאָרֶץ--וְחִפַּשְׂתִּי אֹתוֹ, בְּכֹל אַלְפֵי יְהוּדָה. | See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking-places where he hideth himself, and come ye back to me with the certainty, and I will go with you; and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah.' | מִן-הַשְּׁלֹשִׁים נִכְבָּד, וְאֶל-הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה לֹא-בָא; וַיְשִׂמֵהוּ דָוִד, {ר} אֶל-מִשְׁמַעְתּוֹ. | He was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.

text_he: ויקומו וילכו זיפה לפני שאול ודוד ואנשיו במדבר מעון בערבה--אל ימין הישימון | And they arose and went to Ziph before Saul but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon in the Arabah on the south of Jeshimon | עשהאל אחי-יואב בשלשים אלחנן בן-דו {ר} בית לחם | Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem
text_en: And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul; but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of Jeshimon.
text_pisuk: וַיָּקוּמוּ וַיֵּלְכוּ זִיפָה, לִפְנֵי שָׁאוּל; וְדָוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו בְּמִדְבַּר מָעוֹן, בָּעֲרָבָה--אֶל, יְמִין הַיְשִׁימוֹן. | And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul; but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of Jeshimon. | עֲשָׂהאֵל אֲחִי-יוֹאָב, בַּשְּׁלֹשִׁים; אֶלְחָנָן בֶּן-דֹּדוֹ, {ר} בֵּית לָחֶם. | Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem;

text_he: וילך שאול ואנשיו לבקש ויגדו לדוד וירד הסלע וישב במדבר מעון וישמע שאול וירדף אחרי-דוד מדבר מעון | And Saul and his men went to seek him And they told David wherefore he came down to the rock and abode in the wilderness of Maon And when Saul heard that he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon | שמה החרדי אליקא {ר} החרדי | Shammah the Harodite Elika the Harodite
text_en: And Saul and his men went to seek him. And they told David; wherefore he came down to the rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ שָׁאוּל וַאֲנָשָׁיו, לְבַקֵּשׁ, וַיַּגִּדוּ לְדָוִד, וַיֵּרֶד הַסֶּלַע וַיֵּשֶׁב בְּמִדְבַּר מָעוֹן; וַיִּשְׁמַע שָׁאוּל, וַיִּרְדֹּף אַחֲרֵי-דָוִד מִדְבַּר מָעוֹן. | And Saul and his men went to seek him. And they told David; wherefore he came down to the rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon. | שַׁמָּה, הַחֲרֹדִי,  אֱלִיקָא, {ר} הַחֲרֹדִי. | Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite;

text_he: וילך שאול מצד הר מזה ודוד ואנשיו מצד הר מזה ויהי דוד נחפז לכת מפני שאול ושאול ואנשיו עטרים אל-דוד ואל-אנשיו לתפשם | And Saul went on this side of the mountain and David and his men on that side of the mountain and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them | חלץ הפלטי עירא {ר} בן-עקש התקועי | Helez the Paltite Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite
text_en: And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain; and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ שָׁאוּל מִצַּד הָהָר, מִזֶּה, וְדָוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו מִצַּד הָהָר, מִזֶּה; וַיְהִי דָוִד נֶחְפָּז לָלֶכֶת, מִפְּנֵי שָׁאוּל, וְשָׁאוּל וַאֲנָשָׁיו עֹטְרִים אֶל-דָּוִד וְאֶל-אֲנָשָׁיו, לְתָפְשָׂם. | And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain; and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them. | חֶלֶץ, הַפַּלְטִי,  עִירָא {ר} בֶן-עִקֵּשׁ,  הַתְּקוֹעִי. | Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite;

text_he: ומלאך בא אל-שאול לאמר מהרה ולכה כי-פשטו פלשתים על-הארץ | But there came a messenger unto Saul saying 'Haste thee and come for the Philistines have made a raid upon the land' | אביעזר {ר} הענתי מבני החשתי | Abiezer the Anathothite Mebunnai the Hushathite
text_en: But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying: 'Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have made a raid upon the land.'
text_pisuk: וּמַלְאָךְ בָּא, אֶל-שָׁאוּל לֵאמֹר: מַהֲרָה וְלֵכָה, כִּי-פָשְׁטוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים עַל-הָאָרֶץ. | But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying: 'Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have made a raid upon the land.' | אֲבִיעֶזֶר, {ר} הָעַנְּתֹתִי,  מְבֻנַּי, הַחֻשָׁתִי. | Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite;

text_he: וישב שאול מרדף אחרי דוד וילך לקראת פלשתים על-כן קראו למקום הוא סלע המחלקות | So Saul returned from pursuing after David and went against the Philistines therefore they called that place Sela-hammahlekoth | צלמון {ר} האחי מהרי הנטפתי | Zalmon the Ahohite Maharai the Netophathite
text_en: So Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines; therefore they called that place Sela-hammahlekoth.
text_pisuk: וַיָּשָׁב שָׁאוּל, מִרְדֹף אַחֲרֵי דָוִד, וַיֵּלֶךְ, לִקְרַאת פְּלִשְׁתִּים; עַל-כֵּן, קָרְאוּ לַמָּקוֹם הַהוּא, סֶלַע, הַמַּחְלְקוֹת. | So Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines; therefore they called that place Sela-hammahlekoth. | צַלְמוֹן, {ר} הָאֲחֹחִי,  מַהְרַי, הַנְּטֹפָתִי. | Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite;

text_he: ויעל דוד משם וישב במצדות עין-גדי | And David went up from thence and dwelt in the strongholds of En-gedi{S} | חלב בן-בענה {ר} הנטפתי אתי בן-ריבי מגבעת בני בנימן | Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin
text_en: And David went up from thence, and dwelt in the strongholds of En-gedi.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַל דָּוִד, מִשָּׁם; וַיֵּשֶׁב, בִּמְצָדוֹת עֵין-גֶּדִי. | And David went up from thence, and dwelt in the strongholds of En-gedi.{S} | חֵלֶב בֶּן-בַּעֲנָה, {ר} הַנְּטֹפָתִי;  אִתַּי, בֶּן-רִיבַי, מִגִּבְעַת, בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִן. | Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin;

text_he: ויהי כאשר שב שאול מאחרי פלשתים ויגדו לו לאמר הנה דוד במדבר עין גדי | And it came to pass when Saul was returned from following the Philistines that it was told him saying 'Behold David is in the wilderness of En-gedi'{S} | ויסף אף-יהוה לחרות בישראל ויסת את-דוד בהם לאמר לך מנה את-ישראל ואת-יהודה | And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel and He moved David against them saying 'Go number Israel and Judah'
text_en: And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying: 'Behold, David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁב שָׁאוּל, מֵאַחֲרֵי, פְּלִשְׁתִּים; וַיַּגִּדוּ לוֹ, לֵאמֹר, הִנֵּה דָוִד, בְּמִדְבַּר עֵין גֶּדִי. | And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying: 'Behold, David is in the wilderness of En-gedi.'{S} | וַיֹּסֶף, אַף-יְהוָה, לַחֲרוֹת, בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיָּסֶת אֶת-דָּוִד בָּהֶם לֵאמֹר, לֵךְ מְנֵה אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת-יְהוּדָה. | And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and He moved David against them, saying: 'Go, number Israel and Judah.'

text_he: ויקח שאול שלשת אלפים איש בחור--מכל-ישראל וילך לבקש את-דוד ואנשיו על-פני צורי היעלים | Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks of the wild goats | ויאמר המלך אל-יואב שר-החיל אשר-אתו שוט-נא בכל-שבטי ישראל מדן ועד-באר שבע ופקדו את-העם וידעתי את מספר העם | And the king said to Joab the captain of the host that was with him 'Go now to and fro through all the tribes of Israel from Dan even to Beer-sheba and number ye the people that I may know the sum of the people'{S}
text_en: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks of the wild goats.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַּח שָׁאוּל, שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים אִישׁ בָּחוּר--מִכָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֵּלֶךְ, לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת-דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו, עַל-פְּנֵי, צוּרֵי הַיְּעֵלִים. | Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks of the wild goats. | וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-יוֹאָב שַׂר-הַחַיִל אֲשֶׁר-אִתּוֹ, שׁוּט-נָא בְּכָל-שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִדָּן וְעַד-בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע, וּפִקְדוּ, אֶת-הָעָם; וְיָדַעְתִּי, אֵת מִסְפַּר הָעָם. | And the king said to Joab the captain of the host that was with him: 'Go now to and fro through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the sum of the people.'{S}

text_he: ויבא אל-גדרות הצאן על-הדרך ושם מערה ויבא שאול להסך את-רגליו ודוד ואנשיו בירכתי המערה ישבים | And he came to the sheepcotes by the way where was a cave and Saul went in to cover his feet Now David and his men were sitting in the innermost parts of the cave | ויאמר יואב אל-המלך ויוסף יהוה אלהיך אל-העם כהם וכהם מאה פעמים ועיני אדני-המלך ראות ואדני המלך למה חפץ בדבר הזה | And Joab said unto the king 'Now the LORD thy God add unto the people how many soever they may be a hundredfold and may the eyes of my lord the king see it but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing'
text_en: And he came to the sheepcotes by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet. Now David and his men were sitting in the innermost parts of the cave.
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא אֶל-גִּדְרוֹת הַצֹּאן עַל-הַדֶּרֶךְ, וְשָׁם מְעָרָה, וַיָּבֹא שָׁאוּל, לְהָסֵךְ אֶת-רַגְלָיו; וְדָוִד, וַאֲנָשָׁיו, בְּיַרְכְּתֵי הַמְּעָרָה, יֹשְׁבִים. | And he came to the sheepcotes by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet. Now David and his men were sitting in the innermost parts of the cave. | וַיֹּאמֶר יוֹאָב אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְיוֹסֵף יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֶל-הָעָם כָּהֵם וְכָהֵם מֵאָה פְעָמִים, וְעֵינֵי אֲדֹנִי-הַמֶּלֶךְ, רֹאוֹת; וַאדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ, לָמָּה חָפֵץ בַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | And Joab said unto the king: 'Now the LORD thy God add unto the people, how many soever they may be, a hundredfold, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it; but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing?'

text_he: ויאמרו אנשי דוד אליו הנה היום אשר-אמר יהוה אליך הנה אנכי נתן את-איביך (איבך) בידך ועשית לו כאשר יטב בעיניך ויקם דוד ויכרת את-כנף-המעיל אשר-לשאול--בלט | And the men of David said unto him 'Behold the day in which the LORD hath said unto thee Behold I will deliver thine enemy into thy hand and thou shalt do to him as it shall seem good unto thee' Then David arose and cut off the skirt of Saul's robe privily | ויחזק דבר-המלך אל-יואב ועל שרי החיל ויצא יואב ושרי החיל לפני המלך לפקד את-העם את-ישראל | Notwithstanding the king's word prevailed against Joab and against the captains of the host And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king to number the people of Israel
text_en: And the men of David said unto him: 'Behold the day in which the LORD hath said unto thee: Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thy hand, and thou shalt do to him as it shall seem good unto thee.' Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul's robe privily.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמְרוּ אַנְשֵׁי דָוִד אֵלָיו, הִנֵּה הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר-אָמַר יְהוָה אֵלֶיךָ הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי נֹתֵן אֶת-איביך (אֹיִבְךָ) בְּיָדֶךָ, וְעָשִׂיתָ לּוֹ, כַּאֲשֶׁר יִטַב בְּעֵינֶיךָ; וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, וַיִּכְרֹת אֶת-כְּנַף-הַמְּעִיל אֲשֶׁר-לְשָׁאוּל--בַּלָּט. | And the men of David said unto him: 'Behold the day in which the LORD hath said unto thee: Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thy hand, and thou shalt do to him as it shall seem good unto thee.' Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul's robe privily. | וַיֶּחֱזַק דְּבַר-הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶל-יוֹאָב, וְעַל שָׂרֵי הֶחָיִל; וַיֵּצֵא יוֹאָב וְשָׂרֵי הַחַיִל, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, לִפְקֹד אֶת-הָעָם, אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | Notwithstanding the king's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.

text_he: ויהי אחרי-כן ויך לב-דוד אתו--על אשר כרת את-כנף אשר לשאול | And it came to pass afterward that David's heart smote him because he had cut off Saul's skirt | ויעברו את-הירדן ויחנו בערוער ימין העיר אשר בתוך-הנחל הגד--ואל-יעזר | And they passed over the Jordan and pitched in Aroer on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad and unto Jazer
text_en: And it came to pass afterward, that David's heart smote him, because he had cut off Saul's skirt.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי, אַחֲרֵי-כֵן, וַיַּךְ לֵב-דָּוִד, אֹתוֹ--עַל אֲשֶׁר כָּרַת, אֶת-כָּנָף אֲשֶׁר לְשָׁאוּל. | And it came to pass afterward, that David's heart smote him, because he had cut off Saul's skirt. | וַיַּעַבְרוּ, אֶת-הַיַּרְדֵּן; וַיַּחֲנוּ בַעֲרוֹעֵר, יְמִין הָעִיר אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹךְ-הַנַּחַל הַגָּד--וְאֶל-יַעְזֵר. | And they passed over the Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad, and unto Jazer;

text_he: ויאמר לאנשיו חלילה לי מיהוה אם-אעשה את-הדבר הזה לאדני למשיח יהוה--לשלח ידי בו כי-משיח יהוה הוא | And he said unto his men 'The LORD forbid it me that I should do this thing unto my lord the LORD'S anointed to put forth my hand against him seeing he is the LORD'S anointed' | ויבאו הגלעדה ואל-ארץ תחתים חדשי ויבאו דנה יען וסביב אל-צידון | then they came to Gilead and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi and they came to Dan-jaan and round about to Zidon
text_en: And he said unto his men: 'The LORD forbid it me, that I should do this thing unto my lord, the LORD'S anointed, to put forth my hand against him, seeing he is the LORD'S anointed.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר לַאֲנָשָׁיו חָלִילָה לִּי מֵיְהוָה, אִם-אֶעֱשֶׂה אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה לַאדֹנִי לִמְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה--לִשְׁלֹחַ יָדִי, בּוֹ: כִּי-מְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה, הוּא. | And he said unto his men: 'The LORD forbid it me, that I should do this thing unto my lord, the LORD'S anointed, to put forth my hand against him, seeing he is the LORD'S anointed.' | וַיָּבֹאוּ, הַגִּלְעָדָה, וְאֶל-אֶרֶץ תַּחְתִּים, חָדְשִׁי; וַיָּבֹאוּ דָּנָה יַּעַן, וְסָבִיב אֶל-צִידוֹן. | then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi; and they came to Dan-jaan, and round about to Zidon,

text_he: וישסע דוד את-אנשיו בדברים ולא נתנם לקום אל-שאול ושאול קם מהמערה וילך בדרך | So David checked his men with these words and suffered them not to rise against Saul And Saul rose up out of the cave and went on his way{S} | ויבאו מבצר-צר וכל-ערי החוי והכנעני ויצאו אל-נגב יהודה באר שבע | and came to the stronghold of Tyre and to all the cities of the Hivites and of the Canaanites and they went out to the south of Judah at Beer-sheba
text_en: So David checked his men with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. And Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְשַׁסַּע דָּוִד אֶת-אֲנָשָׁיו בַּדְּבָרִים, וְלֹא נְתָנָם לָקוּם אֶל-שָׁאוּל; וְשָׁאוּל קָם מֵהַמְּעָרָה, וַיֵּלֶךְ בַּדָּרֶךְ. | So David checked his men with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. And Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.{S} | וַיָּבֹאוּ, מִבְצַר-צֹר, וְכָל-עָרֵי הַחִוִּי, וְהַכְּנַעֲנִי; וַיֵּצְאוּ אֶל-נֶגֶב יְהוּדָה, בְּאֵר שָׁבַע. | and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beer-sheba.

text_he: ויקם דוד אחרי-כן ויצא מן המערה (מהמערה) ויקרא אחרי-שאול לאמר אדני המלך ויבט שאול אחריו ויקד דוד אפים ארצה וישתחו | David also arose afterward and went out of the cave and cried after Saul saying 'My lord the king' And when Saul looked behind him David bowed with his face to the earth and prostrated himself{S} | וישטו בכל-הארץ ויבאו מקצה תשעה חדשים ועשרים יום--ירושלם | So when they had gone to and fro through all the land they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days
text_en: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying: 'My lord the king.' And when Saul looked behind him, David bowed with his face to the earth, and prostrated himself.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּקָם דָּוִד אַחֲרֵי-כֵן, וַיֵּצֵא מן המערה (מֵהַמְּעָרָה), וַיִּקְרָא אַחֲרֵי-שָׁאוּל לֵאמֹר, אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ; וַיַּבֵּט שָׁאוּל אַחֲרָיו, וַיִּקֹּד דָּוִד אַפַּיִם אַרְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּחוּ. | David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying: 'My lord the king.' And when Saul looked behind him, David bowed with his face to the earth, and prostrated himself.{S} | וַיָּשֻׁטוּ, בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ; וַיָּבֹאוּ מִקְצֵה תִשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים, וְעֶשְׂרִים יוֹם--יְרוּשָׁלִָם. | So when they had gone to and fro through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

text_he: ויאמר דוד לשאול למה תשמע את-דברי אדם לאמר הנה דוד מבקש רעתך | And David said to Saul 'Wherefore hearkenest thou to men's words saying Behold David seeketh thy hurt | ויתן יואב את-מספר מפקד-העם אל-המלך ותהי ישראל שמנה מאות אלף איש-חיל שלף חרב ואיש יהודה חמש-מאות אלף איש | And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto the king and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men
text_en: And David said to Saul: 'Wherefore hearkenest thou to men's words, saying: Behold, David seeketh thy hurt?
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לְשָׁאוּל, לָמָּה תִשְׁמַע אֶת-דִּבְרֵי אָדָם לֵאמֹר: הִנֵּה דָוִד, מְבַקֵּשׁ רָעָתֶךָ. | And David said to Saul: 'Wherefore hearkenest thou to men's words, saying: Behold, David seeketh thy hurt? | וַיִּתֵּן יוֹאָב אֶת-מִסְפַּר מִפְקַד-הָעָם, אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ; וַתְּהִי יִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף אִישׁ-חַיִל, שֹׁלֵף חֶרֶב, וְאִישׁ יְהוּדָה, חֲמֵשׁ-מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף אִישׁ. | And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto the king; and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.

text_he: הנה היום הזה ראו עיניך את אשר-נתנך יהוה היום בידי במערה ואמר להרגך ותחס עליך ואמר לא-אשלח ידי באדני--כי-משיח יהוה הוא | Behold this day thine eyes have seen how that the LORD had delivered thee to-day into my hand in the cave and some bade me kill thee but mine eye spared thee and I said I will not put forth my hand against my lord for he is the LORD'S anointed | ויך לב-דוד אתו אחרי-כן ספר את-העם ויאמר דוד אל-יהוה חטאתי מאד אשר עשיתי ועתה יהוה העבר-נא את-עון עבדך כי נסכלתי מאד | And David's heart smote him after that he had numbered the peopleAnd David said unto the LORD 'I have sinned greatly in what I have done but now O LORD put away I beseech Thee the iniquity of Thy servant for I have done very foolishly'
text_en: Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that the LORD had delivered thee to-day into my hand in the cave; and some bade me kill thee; but mine eye spared thee; and I said: I will not put forth my hand against my lord; for he is the LORD'S anointed.
text_pisuk: הִנֵּה הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה רָאוּ עֵינֶיךָ, אֵת אֲשֶׁר-נְתָנְךָ יְהוָה הַיּוֹם בְּיָדִי בַּמְּעָרָה, וְאָמַר לַהֲרָגְךָ, וַתָּחָס עָלֶיךָ; וָאֹמַר, לֹא-אֶשְׁלַח יָדִי בַּאדֹנִי--כִּי-מְשִׁיחַ יְהוָה, הוּא. | Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that the LORD had delivered thee to-day into my hand in the cave; and some bade me kill thee; but mine eye spared thee; and I said: I will not put forth my hand against my lord; for he is the LORD'S anointed. | וַיַּךְ לֵב-דָּוִד אֹתוֹ, אַחֲרֵי-כֵן סָפַר אֶת-הָעָם; וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד אֶל-יְהוָה, חָטָאתִי מְאֹד אֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתִי, וְעַתָּה יְהוָה הַעֲבֶר-נָא אֶת-עֲון עַבְדְּךָ, כִּי נִסְכַּלְתִּי מְאֹד. | And David's heart smote him after that he had numbered the people.And David said unto the LORD: 'I have sinned greatly in what I have done; but now, O LORD, put away, I beseech Thee, the iniquity of Thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.'

text_he: ואבי ראה--גם ראה את-כנף מעילך בידי כי בכרתי את-כנף מעילך ולא הרגתיך דע וראה כי אין בידי רעה ופשע ולא-חטאתי לך--ואתה צדה את-נפשי לקחתה | Moreover my father see yea see the skirt of thy robe in my hand for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe and killed thee not know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in my hand and I have not sinned against thee though thou layest wait for my soul to take it | ויקם דוד בקר ודבר-יהוה היה אל-גד הנביא חזה דוד לאמר | And when David rose up in the morningthe word of the LORD came unto the prophet Gad David's seer saying
text_en: Moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in my hand, and I have not sinned against thee, though thou layest wait for my soul to take it.
text_pisuk: וְאָבִי רְאֵה--גַּם רְאֵה אֶת-כְּנַף מְעִילְךָ, בְּיָדִי: כִּי בְּכָרְתִי אֶת-כְּנַף מְעִילְךָ וְלֹא הֲרַגְתִּיךָ, דַּע וּרְאֵה כִּי אֵין בְּיָדִי רָעָה וָפֶשַׁע וְלֹא-חָטָאתִי לָךְ--וְאַתָּה צֹדֶה אֶת-נַפְשִׁי, לְקַחְתָּהּ. | Moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in my hand, and I have not sinned against thee, though thou layest wait for my soul to take it. | וַיָּקָם דָּוִד, בַּבֹּקֶר; וּדְבַר-יְהוָה, הָיָה אֶל-גָּד הַנָּבִיא, חֹזֵה דָוִד, לֵאמֹר. | And when David rose up in the morning,the word of the LORD came unto the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying:
